results.description:
Understanding and preventing churn is important to both small and large businesses to maintain and grow revenue. Startups, especially those involved with web- and subscription-based services, should be attentive and analytical with their customer base. In this talk, we describe both unsupervised and supervised machine learning methods that address customer churn. Along with the fact that completely open-sourced software was used, entrepreneurs from all areas of expertise will benefit from this talk.

NYCCEO is honored to have Artit Wangperawong, Ph.D, an expert in this field to give a talk on deep learning. Please join us this Lunch and Learn session this Saturday. 

你是否想知道Deep Learning背后的秘密？
你是否想了解格林深瞳、Ersatz Labs、Enlitic等前端创业公司Deep Learning的技术原理？
你是否正在寻找如何解决customer churn（客户流失）问题的方法？

随着创业圈的竞争越来越激烈,获得一个新客户的开支也越来越大, 如何有效地减少客户流失成为当下备受瞩目的话题。

NYCCEO有幸邀请到深度学习领域的专家 -- 毕业于美国斯坦福大学的Artit Wangperawong博士, 与大家相聚纽约，分享多年的研究成果, 介绍如何利用machine learning（机器学习）来分析预测顾客流失率, 帮助创业团队深度剖析并减少或避免这一现象的发生, 从而揭开顾客流失背后的秘密! 

About Artit Wangperawong

Artit Wangperawong is an American-born Chinese with roots from Thailand. Currently at a stealth-mode startup, he has worked in various industries including energy, medicine, telecommunications, finance, semiconductor, IT and education. He has given lectures in the US and Asia and enjoys studying languages such as Thai, Korean, Mandarin, Cantonese and Teochew. Art studied at Stanford University, where he obtained a B.S. in Mechanical Engineering as well as an M.S. and a Ph.D. in Electrical Engineering.

Artit Wangperawong博士, 毕业于斯坦福大学, 获得机械工程学士, 以及电子工程博士学位。他的工作曾涉及能源，医药，电子科技，金融以及半导体等多个领域。Artit博士致力于深度挖掘及剖析顾客流失这一课题，曾多次受邀在北美和亚洲进行演讲及授课。

时间: 5/7（周六） 11:00am - 2:00pm（含午餐）
地点：Lair East Office @ 424 Broadway, Unit 602
RSVP: http://www.eventbrite.com/e/nycceo-deep-learning-talk--tickets-25146976283#rd 

About Our Partner - Lair East 

Lair East is a New York-based startup community that offers a co-working space, connection to top tier angel/VC investors, and global entrepreneurial network to its members. 

About NYCCEO 

Founded in 2012, NYCCEO is one of the largest and most influential cross-border entrepreneurial organizations in New York with a mission to connect the startup communities in China and the U.S. We organize events and establish platforms to connect investors, entrepreneurs, and other members.

In 2015, we organized 14 events featuring leading investors, startups, and major tech companies, and we have grown our active members and social reach by 3 times. Our 2015 special guests include:
Co-founder/CEO of Jet.com, Head of Global Operation from Xiaomi, Partners from IDG, Angel Investor of Didi Dache, Founders and Partners at ZhenFund, Founders of Raven Technology, Co-Founder/CTO WayUp (Campus Job), Founder of Pre-Angel, Founder of Linear Venture, and executives from Pebble, Chengwei Capital, GWC, WeWork, and Indiegogo.

results.description:
GENEROSITY

“Lord, make me an instrument of your peace;
where there is hatred, let me sow love;
when there is injury, pardon;
where there is doubt, faith;
where there is despair, hope;
where there is darkness, light;
and where there is sadness, joy
Grant that I may not so much seek
to be consoled as to console;
to be understood, as to understand,
to be loved as to love;
for it is in giving that we receive,
it is in pardoning that we are pardoned,and it is in dying [to ourselves] that we are born to eternal life.”

― Francis of Assisi

This week we will look at Generosity as the counterbalancing state to Greed.

As we have seen with the Three Poisons - delusion/ignorance,  hatred/aversion and now, greed, we tend to close in around a belief in a separate self, of a "me against the world," or "us versus them." This understanding of a separate self informs all of our perceptions of the world.  Even so, we sometimes catch a glimpse of a more universal interconnectedness and the interdependent nature of all things that allows us to see that the sense of separation is really a misperception.

As a counterbalance to this contracted reaction to experience, we sense that there are alternatives that allow us to find a more open awareness and expanded sense of being.  With delusion/ignorance we considered its counterbalance of wisdom.  With hatred/aversion we sensed the open expanse of loving kindness and compassion.

Now, we consider Generosity as the counterbalance to Greed. In cultivating an understanding of Generosity we see that it is deeply connected to "letting go." It is the releasing of our attachment to any of the constantly changing things we mistakenly believe will last or make us feel safe and happy. Giving and receiving are two aspects of Generosity that engender a feeling of liberation from suffering. Together they reflect our own sharing as well as our personal acceptance of generosity from others in equal measure.

I hope you'll share your Saturday morning with us.

Class Structure:  

Each class begins with a very brief guided meditation of gathering and quieting followed by a topical teaching and an expanded guided mindfulness meditation. There is time for discussion and Q&A.  Please note that while there is benefit in participating in regular sittings and practice, you do not have to attend every class to find value. 

Fee by donation: Suggested starting donation is $10 and your generosity is greatly appreciated.  No one is ever turned away for lack of funds.  The donation box is on the sign-in table.
results.name: Wheel of Life - Greed and Generosity

results.description:
Let's get together and go to the Liberty Science Center where there are exhibiting this great exhibition. This exhibition is designed with a focus on the legendary RMS Titanic‘s compelling human stories. It features more than 100 authentic artifacts set within replicas of cabins and other areas within the famous ill-fated ship.


Upon entering the exhibition, visitors will be drawn back in time to April 1912, when the ship embarked on its maiden voyage. They will receive a replica boarding pass, assume the role of a passenger, and follow a chronological journey through life on Titanic—from the ship’s construction to life on board, to the moments of impact and sinking, and the modern day efforts to recover and conserve the wreckage for future generations. Visitors can even touch an “iceberg” to feel just how cold the water was at the time that the ship sank.

Ticket Type:


Combination Pass: 


Admission + Titanic Exhibition= $27.75--I will call and ask if we can get a discount going as a group.  There might be a Groupon out there so I'll let everyone know or if you see one, let us know. If you want to stay all day there are other, more expensive passes to see an IMAX film and other exhibits.


I recommend car pooling. The parking fee is $7.00. The fee could be split into how many car pool with 1 person. 


http://lsc.org/plan-your-visit/directions-parking/


.http://lsc.org/see-whats-happening/current-exhibitions-and-experiences/titanic-the-artifact-exhibition/?date=2016-05-01

Check out www.youtube.com  for many short videos about the Titanic.
results.name: Titanic:  The Artifact Exhibition

results.description:
PLEASE RSVP RESPONSIBLY.


We do visits to the Brooklyn Botanical Gardens in every season.  Hopefully the cherry blossoms will be in full bloom by the time we go.  This will be the week AFTER the festival at the garden.  It's WAY too crowded to go for the festival and it's expensive. 


There is free admission to the Brooklyn Botanical Gardens on Saturdays between 10 a.m. and noon. So, while 10:30 a.m. is rather early, we want to get there for no later than that, because if the line gets long and we are shooting for closer to noon, we may get blocked out of the free admission.  And during cherry blossom season, it is very busy!!


We will meet inside the BBG at the gift shop entrance, rather than wait for everyone to then get in line. This is near the Washington Avenue entrance. You can enter the Gardens at the Eastern Parkway entrance, but then you will have to walk towards the Washington Avenue entrance to get to the gift shop. Here's a map to show you what I mean ... http://www.bbg.org/discover/gardens

Bring your cameras!!  And wish for cherry blossoms!!!!

Calling all poets! Jersey City Writers is now offering a weekly poetry workshop. 

This workshop will start by critiquing two poems, one by each person signed up ahead of time. The workshop will end, if time permits, with one or two 10 minute writing prompts (an idea to incorporate into a poem written on the spot).  Poets who sign up to be workshopped must email Sarah poem by 10am Friday so she can print copies for the group. To sign up for a workshop in advance, please contact Sarah Jewell at [masked]. 

While workshopping poems, we will “mind our P’s and Q’s” by Praising first what works in a poem, and then Questioning what might be improved. This helps to keep the feedback positive and constructive. If you are new to critiquing poetry, please see these guidelines:

Waiting List: The day before an event we tend to have a lot of people drop out so do not be discouraged if you're on the waiting list--there's a good chance you'll be able to join.

Attending List: Please remember that the RSVP list closes at 5pm the day before an event. If you change your RSVP to NO after that time or are a no-show, someone on the waiting list could be left out. We take that very seriously.

Club Hours: Gotham Archery has reserved space for us from 11:00am to 1:00pm. Those are the official club hours. Everyone is free to stay longer at the regular range rate.

First-Timers: If it is your first time at Gotham Archery, you will have to take a safety & intro lesson class from the range staff and demonstrate safe shooting. No exceptions. Please arrive 15 minutes early; the class will start promptly at 11:00am.

Public Transportation: Gotham Archery is located at 480 Baltic St (Brooklyn, NY 11217) in Gowanus. It's a few blocks south-west of the Atlantic Av-Barclays Ctr train station. The 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, B, D, N, Q and R trains all stop there.

By car from LI:You can take the LIE, Northern State or Southern State to either Jackie Robinson or the BQE.  Set your GPS to 480 Baltic Street, NY, 11217.  The parking on Sat. AM isn't bad at all: you may have to circle the block once or twice.  The building is painted in a somber yellow ochre.

BUT: please consider car pooling or training it: the drive is awful; the train is lovely.  Most LI LIRR stations suspend parking fees on Sat and Sun.

You change at Jamaica and get in at the Atlantic Terminal in Brooklyn-- walk south for about 7-8 minutes to Baltic -- go right.  Gotham is on the left.  The first time you walk here, you should have your GPS active.


 Range Costs: Make sure to mention when you pay for range time you are shooting with the NYC Archery Group to get the CLUB ONLY rate: $20 for two hours of shooting, $5 for equipment (plus sales tax). These discounts only apply during official club hours.

 Club Equipment: At this time we cannot guarantee there will be club equipment to borrow, so please plan accordingly. One of us will post in the comments if that changes.

 See you on the shooting line!

--The NYC Cannabis Parade is one of the longest running public expressions of cannabis culture and political activism. The rally is an inclusive and peaceful celebration of the “cannabis culture” that spans national, cultural and racial divisions. It is also a political event demanding an end to prohibition, which has been proven to be a disaster.

--Speakers this year include Dana Beal, Jerry Otero (Youth Policy Manager, Drug Policy Alliance), Doug Greene (Legislative Director, Empire State NORML), NYC Council Member Rafael Espinal, and Lieutenant Jack Cole (Executive Director, Law Enforcement Against Prohibition).


--Music will include Lord Digga and Kazoo Crew Family Band

Assembly Time: 11:30AM-12:30PM

Location: Broadway between W.31 & W.32 (Subway, Herald Square) 

Rally Time: 1:00PM-5:00PM

Location: Union Square, South Plaza

Hope to see many of you there!

Импрессионизм (франц. impressionnisme, от impression — впечатление), направление в искусстве последней трети 19 — начала 20 века. Сложилось во французской живописи конца 1860- начала  70 г.

Название 'импрессионизм' возникло после выставки 1974 г. на которой экспонировалась картина К. Моне "Впечатление. Восходящее Солнце"

('Impression. Soleil Levant')

В Metropolitan Museum находится огромная коллекция произведений импрессионистов.

Профессиональный экскурсовод  расскажет о полотнах Ренуара, Сезанна, ван Гога, Моне и других, а так же об их биографиях.

12 - 2 PM


Встречаемся около information desk, справа. Просьба не опаздывать, так как экскурсия начинается ровно в 12. Мы присоединяемся к другой группе, и в случае опоздания, нас никто ждать не будет.


Количество мест ограниченно!


Расходы: 15 долларов + билет в музей.

Билеты, пожалуйста, приобретите самостоятельно, 15 долларов собирает гид перед началом экскурсии.


 Экскурсия будет проводиться на русском языке ( можете приглашать всех знакомых бабушек и дедушек :)
results.name: Импрессионисты. Взгляд профессионала.

DESCRIPTION:
Steve Rogers leads the newly formed team of Avengers in their continued efforts to safeguard humanity. But after another incident involving the Avengers results in collateral damage, political pressure mounts to install a system of accountability, headed by a governing body to oversee and direct the team. The new status quo fractures the Avengers, resulting in two camps--one led by Steve Rogers and his desire for the Avengers to remain free to defend humanity without government interference, and the other following Tony Stark's surprising decision to support government oversight and accountability.

RUNNING TIME:

2 hours and 27 minutes

GENRE

Action

WHERE TO EAT LUNCH or DINNER:
TBD, plans are to eat somewhere in K-Town

[Link]

results.description:
Introduction to Apache Apex - The next generation native Hadoop platform, and writing a native Hadoop big data Apache Apex streaming application.

This talk will cover details about how Apex can be used as a powerful and versatile platform for big data. Apache apex is being used in production by customers for both streaming and batch use cases. Common usage of Apache Apex includes big data ingestion, transformations, streaming analytics, ETL, fast batch. alerts, real-time actions, machine model scoring, threat detection, etc. 

Presenter : Pramod Immaneni Apache Apex PPMC member, committer and senior architect at DataTorrent Inc, where he works on Apex and specializes in big data applications. Prior to DataTorrent he was a co-founder and CTO of Leaf Networks LLC, eventually acquired by Netgear Inc, where he built products in core networking space and was granted patents in peer-to-peer VPNs. Prior to that he was a technical co-founder of a mobile startup where he was an architect of a dynamic content rendering engine for mobile devices. 

Please register for Introduction to Apache Apex - the next generation Hadoop platform; and writing a big data streaming application on May 7, 2016 at: 

https://attendee.gotowebinar.com/register/4592694528192118531

After registering, you will receive a confirmation email containing information about joining the webinar.

@ApacheApex, meetup presentations, meetup recordings, download, Apache Apex releases, docs

This webcast is of an big data Hadoop Ingest meetup event in another city (267 Boston Rd #9, North BIllerica, MA), we are webcasting it enable other Big Data Ingesters to participate. If you are interested in helping organize (hosting, presenting, community leadership) Hadoop Ingest & Transform community, please email [masked]

Come say hi and learn more about our current programs at the 10th Annual EARTH DAY ROCKAWAY. We are partnering with our friends at Rockaway Water Alliance for a day of fun at the Rockaway Institute for a Sustainable Environment (RISE) with free activities and programs for families and kids of all ages.

If you would like to volunteer to help us at this event, please email us at [masked]

This year’s event will include:
// Kite Making // Mock Dolphin Rescue // Firehouse Safety //
// Obstacle Course // Plantings // Composting // Face Painting // 
// arts-related activities for kids 


All activities are free, open to the public and intended to raise awareness 
of the natural resources along the Rockaway waterfront.


For more details on Earth Day Rockaway 2016, 
visit www.nycgovparks.org

results.description:
Join members from multiple Meetup groups for a private tour of MoMa with a dedicated guide to the museum's treasures!

*PREPAY ONLY EVENT - https://dljparty.ticketleap.com/moma/dates/May-07-2016_at_1200PM

*Must purchase ticket in advance. NO tickets sold at door. 

The tour starts at 2:20 pm, however we will have a pre-mingle starting at 12pm at a local bar/pub close to the museum (location emailed to address used to pay for ticket). 

We will then introduce you to the other attendees and give you admission tickets to the museum. At 2pm we will head over to the museum together. 

Our tour guide will give us an hour tour providing a general overview of the Museum. Afterwards, we can explore the other great things the museum has to offer on our own. Your ticket includes:

12pm-2pm - Pre-Mingle & Museum ticket pick up

2:20pm - Group Highlights Tour

3:20pm - General admission to the Museum

*GET TIX HERE - https://dljparty.ticketleap.com/moma/dates/May-07-2016_at_1200PM

*Cost: $49.75-$55.75 depending on when you buy ticket. 


Tour Description -  

MoMA guided tours are the perfect opportunities to discover the collection, in the company of an art historian.  Guided tours explore Yoshio Taniguchi's sublime architecture and then focus on the highlights of the collection showcasing works by the greatest artists from the late nineteenth century through the present. 

Your tour would include works such as Vincent van Gogh's The Starry Night, Claude Monet's Reflections of Clouds on the Water-Lily Pond, and Andy Warhol's Campbell's Soup Cans. 

FAQs:

How many people will be attending? This is a multi-Meetup and we'll have up to 50 members from various groups attending. This page only shows a small portion of the actual attendees.


What if I'm a MoMa member? Sorry but Moma puts a strict maximum as far as the number of people that can attend our events with the private tour. We are charged per person for each tour guide.  Only individuals who purchase through our website can participate in the group tour. 


Is this event age/ethnic specific? No. This event is open to all ages and is not meant to be age/gender/ethnic specific.  

Can I get tickets at the museum? No. You must purchase tickets in advance for our private tour which will include the pre-mingle. You will pick up the actual tour tickets at the pre-mingle location starting at 12pm.

Get tickets here - https://dljparty.ticketleap.com/moma/dates/May-07-2016_at_1200PM

results.description:
Let's discuss the concept of Rights: Individual vs. Collective. What are they? Which concept is valid? Can both concepts coexist?

Some subsidiary questions we might consider: Does the right to life apply to the unborn? Do animals have rights? Is there a right to health care? To education?

(As always, on your way in, please buy something from the Deli, if only a water or a coffee, so we don't get kicked out!)
results.how_to_find_us: Go upstairs and find the table filled with very intelligent-looking people!
results.name: Let's discuss Rights: Individual vs. Collective

results.description:
Surviving as an artist in the modern age is tricky. With a little bit of strategy and discipline, you can survive—and even thrive—as an artist and creator.


"Thrive As An Artist," a Financial Literacy Workshop for Artists, has partnered with Mike Geffner Presents The Inspired Word to host a THREE-part event where Artists can perform at our Open Mic and learn how to thrive financially!


Attendees will be able to participate in an Open Mic where they will have the opportunity to perform their original material, and then stay to participate in a Financial Literacy Workshop hosted by David Sharp, author of “The Thriving Artist. " This workshop will discuss the financial needs and concerns of freelance artists and attendees will learn how to plan, save and budget for their dreams.


*****NO COVER & ALL AGESRSVP required to Attend.Dates: 4/23, 5/7 & 6/11Mic Signup @ 12:00pmPerformances & Workshop begins: 1:00pmWhere: Capital One 360 Café - 968 3rd AvenueManhattan, New York 10022


****Water and snacks will be provided*****


Performance slots are limited so if you are looking to participate in the Open Mic we STRONGLY suggest you arrive early to guarantee your performance slot as this Open Mic will be first come first serve. To create a PG environment all material must be clean and radio friendly. There is limited space for this workshop, so RSVP's are required. RSVP @ 

https://financiallitopenmic.eventbrite.com


*****


Backline Provided: Yamaha PA, Three Shure Mics, Alesis QS7 Keyboard & a Roland Jazz Guitar Amp.


*****


Directions By Subway: Take the 4,5,6,N,Q,R to 59th St & Lexington. The Cafe is located on the corner of E 58th & 3rd Avenue.


*****


Founded by longtime NYC journalist Mike Geffner in January 2010, The Inspired Word is an open mic/literary/performance series that has featured Grammy, Golden Globe, Tony, and Obie Award winners as well as Emmy nominated actors, American Idol and America's Got Talent finalists, and HBO stars. 

InspiredWordNYC.com
results.how_to_find_us: Upstairs
results.name: Thrive As An Artist: An Open Mic & Financial Lit Workshop - FREE

results.description:
Most people in America know that Dim Sum is famous for brunch or afternoon tea in HongKong and Guangdong ( a region in south China). But maybe not so many people know the HongKong style cafe is also quite famous in HongKong, and now it's also popular in some main cities in China. It is, in fact, an indispensable part of people's lives in HongKong, mostly for causal lunch or afternoon snack with a small group of friends or family. 

Here are the typical local food and drinks: 

Pineapple bun and egg 

Mushroom creamy corn soup and sliced toast. Vegetarian-friendly food :)

Fried mantou (buns) + condensed milk ( I absolutely loved it when I was a kid, it's also famous in North China) 

Pork chop, ham, egg, sausage with spaghetti

Coco Cola Chicken Wing


Hong Kong style black milk tea.

Hot milk tea
results.name: International Brunch - HongKong style cafe

group.name: The New York International Happy Hour

results.description:
UPDATE :  MAY 6,2016 :  2.10 PM
Organizer will not able to attend this event, so walking event  on this event is no more.
Please enjoy yourself or communicate with other members to meet there. and enjoy  Urban Wildlife Appreciation Day with NYC Urban Park Ranger.
Coach Baijnath Agiwal

FREE : Urban Wildlife Appreciation Day with NYC Urban Park Ranger & 3 Miles walk

Urban Wildlife Appreciation Day with NYC Urban Park Ranger from 12 noon to 3 PM.

Saturday, May 7, 2016

12:00 p.m.–3:00 p.m. Get up close and personal with New York City's wild residents. See live animals up-close and learn about their behaviors at this annual event with our Urban Park Rangers. Learn about squirrels, coyotes, skunks, urban birds, and more. The Urban Park Rangers will also inform you about the best places to see wildlife in New York City and how to safely interact with them. Learn from New York State licensed rehabilitators and additional wildlife enthusiasts. Come and enjoy live entertainment, relay races, arts and crafts, games, and animal-themed face painting!

The tour starts at 2:20 pm, however we will have a pre-mingle starting at 12pm at a local bar/pub close to the museum (location emailed to address used to pay for ticket). 

We will then introduce you to the other attendees and give you admission tickets to the museum. At 2pm we will head over to the museum together. 

Our tour guide will give us an hour tour providing a general overview of the Museum. Afterwards, we can explore the other great things the museum has to offer on our own. Your ticket includes:

12pm-2pm - Pre-Mingle & Museum ticket pick up

2:20pm - Group Highlights Tour

3:20pm - General admission to the Museum

*GET TIX HERE - https://dljparty.ticketleap.com/moma/dates/May-07-2016_at_1200PM

*Cost: $49.75-$55.75 depending on when you buy ticket.  

Tour Description - 

MoMA guided tours are the perfect opportunities to discover the collection, in the company of an art historian.  Guided tours explore Yoshio Taniguchi's sublime architecture and then focus on the highlights of the collection showcasing works by the greatest artists from the late nineteenth century through the present. 

Your tour would include works such as Vincent van Gogh's The Starry Night, Claude Monet's Reflections of Clouds on the Water-Lily Pond, and Andy Warhol's Campbell's Soup Cans. 

FAQs:

How many people will be attending? This is a multi-Meetup and we'll have up to 50 members from various groups attending. This page only shows a small portion of the actual attendees. 

What if I'm a MoMa member? Sorry but Moma puts a strict maximum as far as the number of people that can attend our events with the private tour. We are charged per person for each tour guide.  Only individuals who purchase through our website can participate in the group tour.  

Is this event age/ethnic specific? No. This event is open to all ages and is not meant to be age/gender/ethnic specific.  

Can I get tickets at the museum? No. You must purchase tickets in advance for our private tour which will include the pre-mingle. You will pick up the actual tour tickets at the pre-mingle location starting at 12pm.

Get tickets here - https://dljparty.ticketleap.com/moma/dates/May-07-2016_at_1200PM

results.description:
The rain is finally forecast to end Saturday and we should see sunny skies in the low 70's....perfect Nordic Walking weather.  This class is more challenging than the 10:30 am class and moves at a more rapid cardio pace and longer distance.
Nordic Walking experience is not necessary - we instruct you on the fly.  We supply audio music and poles - just bring a set of earphones.
Leave handbags at home - belt bags or backpacks are fine.

For more details, click www.HYVAnordicwalking.com

 Bill will be taking out this class - see you Saturday.
results.how_to_find_us: Meet at West 72nd St and Central Park West  entrance to the park.  Look for the guys with the poles.
results.name: Saturday FAST PACE Nordic Walk

results.description:
UPDATE :  MAY 6,2016 :  2.10 PM
Organizer will not able to attend this event, so walking event  on this event is no more.
Please enjoy yourself or communicate with other members to meet there. and enjoy  Urban Wildlife Appreciation Day with NYC Urban Park Ranger.
Coach Baijnath Agiwal



FREE : Urban Wildlife Appreciation Day with NYC Urban Park Ranger

Urban Wildlife Appreciation Day with NYC Urban Park Ranger from 12 noon to 3 PM.

Saturday, May 7, 2016

12:00 p.m.–3:00 p.m. Get up close and personal with New York City's wild residents. See live animals up-close and learn about their behaviors at this annual event with our Urban Park Rangers. Learn about squirrels, coyotes, skunks, urban birds, and more. The Urban Park Rangers will also inform you about the best places to see wildlife in New York City and how to safely interact with them. Learn from New York State licensed rehabilitators and additional wildlife enthusiasts. Come and enjoy live entertainment, relay races, arts and crafts, games, and animal-themed face painting!


Location

Map data ©2016 Google

Terms of Use

Map

Indian Road Lawn in Inwood Hill Park


Manhattan
Directions to this location
Location Details:
Enter the park at West 218th Street and Indian Road


Cost

Free Event Organizer

Northern Manhattan Parks, Urban Park Rangers, Fort Tryon Park Trust

Contact Number

(212)[masked]


Related Links
•Urban Park Rangers
•Fort Tryon Park Trust

12pm-2pm - Pre-Mingle & Museum ticket pick up

2:20pm - Group Highlights Tour

3:20pm - General admission to the Museum

*GET TIX HERE - https://dljparty.ticketleap.com/moma/dates/May-07-2016_at_1200PM

*Cost: $49.75-$55.75 depending on when you buy ticket.  

Tour Description - 

MoMA guided tours are the perfect opportunities to discover the collection, in the company of an art historian.  Guided tours explore Yoshio Taniguchi's sublime architecture and then focus on the highlights of the collection showcasing works by the greatest artists from the late nineteenth century through the present. 

Your tour would include works such as Vincent van Gogh's The Starry Night, Claude Monet's Reflections of Clouds on the Water-Lily Pond, and Andy Warhol's Campbell's Soup Cans. 

FAQs:

How many people will be attending? This is a multi-Meetup and we'll have up to 50 members from various groups attending. This page only shows a small portion of the actual attendees. 

What if I'm a MoMa member? Sorry but Moma puts a strict maximum as far as the number of people that can attend our events with the private tour. We are charged per person for each tour guide.  Only individuals who purchase through our website can participate in the group tour.  

Is this event age/ethnic specific? No. This event is open to all ages and is not meant to be age/gender/ethnic specific.  

Can I get tickets at the museum? No. You must purchase tickets in advance for our private tour which will include the pre-mingle. You will pick up the actual tour tickets at the pre-mingle location starting at 12pm.

Get tickets here - https://dljparty.ticketleap.com/moma/dates/May-07-2016_at_1200PM

results.description:
Join us to play epic acoustic songs on Acoustic Guitars! Ukeleles, Percussion, Upright Bass and Singers are welcome!

We will be working on finger style and acoustic technique as well as building a nice repertoire for Summertime.

This group will meet primarily at this location (353 W 48th St) but also outdoors at the park (TBA).

Setlist include:

Hotel California

Harvest Moon

Wild Horses

Give a Little Bit

Hey There Delilah

Wish You Were Here

Summer Breeze

and a few more...

We have done Classic Rock, The Rolling Stones, Reggae, Motown, Summer Songs, Fleetwood Mac, Funk and Christmas ensembles, The Beatles, Blues Rock and Brazilian Guitar Ensembles, now it's time for Acoustic Jams!

This ensemble welcomes ALL LEVELS, so pick your part and let's play! 


To join:

• RSVP before you attend the session.

• Choose your guitar part from TAB>MORE>FILES download/print and bring it to practice to follow. (charts will be up by 05/05)

• Bring acoustic guitar or electric with a portable amp. 

• Have an amazing time!

results.description:
We the Authentic Steppers of Connecticut/Bklyn have added another Sophisticated Partner Style Dance to our Chicago Style Steppin Classes.

.

It is called Detroit Urban Style Ballroom!

We will have returning Instructor June and Audrey Donaldson from The Philly Phive (Philadelphia)

Location for this particular Workshop is: BROOKLYN MASONIC LODGE

317 Clermont Avenue

Brooklyn, N.Y.

2nd Floor, Room 2 North

12pm-2pm

There will be instruction in the Fundamental basics of the dance in a way that will get you moving and executing moves with comfort your very first class!

For those with previous Ballroom Experience, this will give you the opportunity to increase your repetoire, and perfect mechanics.

We recommend (but don't require) that women wear comfortable shoes with a slight heel and that the Gents wear leather soled shoes.

$15pp

No partner necessary

This will be a monthly class until interest and attendance build and then we will meet more often. Location may change from month to month depending on studio availability and the desire to be inclusive of the Tri-state areas. So please follow us and our meetup updates. RSVP is encouraged and helpful to your hosts.

New York, New Jersey and Connecticut, Please join us!
results.name: DETROIT URBAN BALLROOM MEETS THE TRI-STATE

results.description:
Welcome to the first African Club Dance Meetup! We’ve created an event to engage you in conversation off of the dance floor. We want to know what you want from the dancing experience.


In addition, we’re excited to give away some free tickets to a screening at the New York African Film Festival’s Premiere of Martha & Niki. The film is about two women taking on the world’s biggest street dance competition and becoming the first ever female World Champions in Hip Hop. This film depicts their love of dance, each other and about friendship put to the test. About desires, yearning and finding the right path in life. Check out the trailer below.

https://youtu.be/14_kZFn6LxM

We have free tickets! Be one of the first to register for the upcoming dance workshops starting on Sunday, May 22nd workshop and get a chance to win a free ticket to the screening! You will get to meet the filmmaker and dancers who will be present at the Q&A afterwards. Get passes for workshop here: HERE.

Join us for chai before the screening for a meet & greet to discuss dance, learn about the upcoming workshops, and rub shoulders with other dance lovers.

Don’t miss this fabulous event, sign up today! Cafe location and ticket info coming soon. You could email us at info@africanclubdances and call us at 347.635.5418. Sign up for the newsletter HERE.

Date: Saturday, May 6, 2016Time: 12:00pm - 3:00pm

Location: Europan Cafe 135 Columbus Ave

Manhattan NY,[masked]

b/t West 65th St & 66th St

Next to the American Folk Art Museum 

Nearby Trains Stations:1/2 Trains 66 St. - Lincoln Center

A/B/C Trains 72 St.1/2/3 Trains 72 St.
For Info Contact Shah[masked]

results.description:
This is a co-ed adult pick-up game 6v6 or 7 v7 depending on attendance. 90 minutes with two 45 minute halves. No slide tackling or rough play. We play with Pugg goals. Pinnies provided.  Shin guards are recommended.


This pick up game is hosted by Coach Moe. 


PLEASE UPDATE YOUR RSVP AT LEAST MIDNIGHT THE DAY BEFORE THE GAME!

• RSVPs close by 10:30AM


No shows and those who didn't update their RSVP at least 2 hours before the game will be red carded after the second offense which means that we have the right to edit your RSVP.

Directions by subway or bus:


2 and 3 trains to Clark St.

A and C trains to High St.


F train to York St.


N and R trains to Court St.


Weather policy:

In case of inclement weather we will send out an email to notify you at least two hours before meeting time.

What to bring:

Please note that Cadman Plaza park is a turf field. Turf shoes are preferred. Please bring water or sports drink. Please bring a ball if you have one.


By RSVP-ing YES you agree to the following:

I certify that I have no known medical or other conditions that could interfere with my participation in Brooklyn Soccer Club activities. I also understand and accept that the practice of soccer, both indoor and outdoor, involves certain risks of physical injury. Therefore, I, individually, hereby release and discharge, Brooklyn Soccer Club Organizer and Assistant Organizers from any and all claims, actions, damages, losses, liabilities, costs and expenses of any kind whatsoever, including but not limited to any claims of negligence, arising out of, resulting from, by reason of, or in connection with my participation in any of Brooklyn Soccer Club Programs or activities.
results.how_to_find_us: Coach Moe will be wearing a neon yellow pinnie.
results.name: PICK UP GAME 90 mins SAT 12 NOON Cadman Plaza

group.name: Brooklyn Soccer Club - Adult Soccer lessons and pickup games

results.description:
Have you ever wanted to try shooting with studio strobes? Or, do you own strobes, but still have questions about using them? Do you hate when these topics are discussed using terms you never understand? If so, this is the Meetup for you.  

This is a hands-on, in studio workshop for those looking to work with strobe lighting.  This workshop will cover the basics of using strobes.   Some topics that will be covered are:


• Camera settings


• Light meters and metering light


• Shooting tethered 


• Different types of strobes


• Strobe position 


• 1 light and multi-light setups


• Lighting modifiers 


The purpose of this workshop is to hopefully get people more comfortable shooting with studio strobes and to answer any questions that you may have. 


Participants will also have the opportunity to shoot with their own cameras to have some examples to take home. 

The investment for this workshop is $35.  A $5 deposit is required to reserve your spot and $30 will be collected the day of the event.  Space is limited.  If this session fills up, I will consider adding another session based on interest. 


Please contact me directly if you have any questions. [masked]

Cheers

Devon
results.name: Shooting with strobes 101

venue.name: New Jersey Raw Food Support Network

results.description:
KAREN'S 2 DAY RAW FOOD COACHING & RECIPE WEEKEND WORKSHOP:

Class is rescheduled to the following dates. People are already signed up for this workshop and we can only take two more people. Please contact Karen immediately if interested:

Saturday, May 7th and Sunday, May 22nd

Time: 12 pm to 5 pm

with Award-Winning Author, Internationally Acclaimed Speaker 
and 21 Years Raw Food Coach and Chef,

Karen Ranzi, M.A.

Come Learn Delicious and Simple Easy-to-Prepare Juices, Smoothies, Cereals, Pancakes, Veggie Pasta and Sauces, Salads and Dressings, Burgers and Other Main Meal Entrees, and Party Foods! All with organic foods. You will go home with a huge number of recipe handouts, plant-based magazines, and information about living healthfully with raw living plant foods.

Come learn about the benefits of a healthy raw food diet which brings you health, energy, excellent immunity to illness, and your goals for ideal weight.

Receive a recipe ebook with meal plans, vegan and raw food magazines and article handouts to provide the reasons that the raw food lifestyle is successful for so many people, both in healing disease, losing weight and maintaining health. Learn the numerous mistakes not to make when starting a raw food lifestyle.

Receive guidance and support from Karen Ranzi, M.A., internationally renowned speaker and health coach, in an intimate group environment. Taste delicious and simple raw food recipes to immediately incorporate into your daily lifestyle. Learn about using greens, sprouting, and avoiding a haphazard raw food diet. Learn about detoxification, eating raw in the winter, traveling raw, water filtration, supplementation, personal care products, dealing with societal pressures, local resources, and so much more.

In these two weekend dates totalling 10 hours, we will create breakfast meals, salads with dressings and sauces, veggie pasta and toppings, main meal entrees and raw cheese, and party foods. All organic food is included in the price of this workshop.

Included is a copy of Karen's recipe ebook 21 Days of Raw with loads of great recipes and easy meal plans, from 21 top raw food chefs.

Cost for your Health for the Two Weekend Dates:

10 Hour Raw Food Coaching and Recipe Workshop:  $225 

Times: 12 pm to 5 pm both dates

Some of the many benefits of the raw or high raw food lifestyle:

Reach your ideal weight.

Increase resistance to and heal from illness.

Gain more energy and concentration.

Lift brain fog.

Improve digestion and assimilation.

Get delicious raw food recipes for busy people.

Enjoy group support and make friends with other health-conscious individuals.

Take your health to a new level.

Location: NJ Raw Food Support Network

Ramsey, NJ 07446

Contact: To RSVP, email Karen at [masked] or call 
[masked]

Karen Ranzi is the winner of the 6th Annual Best of Raw Awards Top Professional Simple Raw Foods Chef.

Karen's book Creating Healthy Children won the Bronze Medal "Living Now Award" in the Category of Health and Nutrition from Independent Publishers.

Karen is also the author of Raw Vegan Recipe Fun for Families: 115 Easy Recipes and Health Tips for Energetic Living. This book contains the quickest, easiest recipes for busy people and families. Karen is also the author and contributor of 21 Days of Raw, a raw food recipe book from 20 top raw food chefs.
results.name: Spring Raw Food Group Coaching & Recipe Program with Author and Chef Karen Ranzi

group.name: New Jersey Raw Food Support Network

results.description:
The weekend is almost here!! But the weather is kind of dull where you want to nothing but be Vele. So that is exactly what we are going to do at our Naach Xpress Class in JC this week. This week we are dancing to the song "Vele" from the movie Student of the Year. So get excited !! What is Naach Xpress? NAACH XPRESS is high-energy, fitness fueled dance class to Bollywood beats. It's one big dance PARTY! Students sweat it out to the best of Bollywood Funk NYC's signature dance moves. With a mix of jazz, hip hop, contemporary, and other well known dance techniques, we bring to you our fast track class to sweating it out with some style. Make some friends and dance the night away in this amazing class! There are no worries, come to class tension free and get your weekly dose of fitness and cardio! Each class will focus on ONE hot and popular Bollywood dance song. With a new song featured every week. ALL levels are welcome! Not a dancer? DON'T YOU WORRY! This class is for all, anyone can do it!


Here is a class snip-it:

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=70UcFvuNy1g&feature=youtu.be

For further details and pricing for the class, please visit our website

www.bollywoodfunknyc.com

Looking forward to seeing you all there!!
results.name: Naach Xpress JC- Time To Be Vele

group.name: Naach Xpress- Dance and Exercise the Bollywood way!

results.description:
If you want to become a game designer and would love to know what it takes to make a living off your passion, then join us as we gain valuable insight into the game production cycle with Juan Maldonado. Juan Maldonado has 15 years of experience as a Game Designer, Project Manager and Producer for companies, Arkadium, Johnson & Johnson and his company GR2U. This event is part 3 of a 3 part series. 

 
Below is a breakdown of what will be covered at this event.
----------------------------------------------------

Agenda

Marketing
- Budget
- Spread the Word
- Social Media
- Professional Groups
- Advertisement

Release
- Testing/Debugging
- Upload to Marketplace/Release
- Analytics
- Post-Mortem

We are currently in the process of booking a place and time for this event. We will keep you posted.
results.name: Game Development Production Cycle - Stage 4 & 5: Marketing & Release

results.description:
New York City is home to an amazing abundance of wildlife. From fal­cons and salamanders to deer and seals (and of course, turtles), wildlife viewing opportunities exist year-round in all of our parks and beaches. Urban Wildlife Appreciation Day is spon­sored by the NYC Department of Parks & Recreation and the Urban Park Rangers.

NYTTS will participate for the seventh year in this event. Exhibits will include squirrels, raccoons, coyotes, skunks, eagles, live birds of prey, and turtles provided by NYTTS.
results.how_to_find_us: Two blocks from Dyckman St subway A station.
results.name: Urban Wildlife Appreciation Day

results.description:
This class is an 8 week introduction to dancing Bachata! Bachata is a romantic style of dance from the Dominican Republic. This is a popular partner dance, which is sexy, playful, and surprisingly easy. These classes will move progressively from week to week, while we introduce the basic, timing, turns, body movement and how to partner. The perfect class for absolute beginners, no experience or partner is necessary.

Dates: 5/7/16-7/2/16
Day:Saturdays
Time: 12-1pm
Location: Rhythmology: 361 Union Ave, Westbury, NY 11590

Cost: Bachata Only: Get 8 Weeks for only $110
Unlimited Bachata, Salsa & Merengue:
Get 8 Weeks for $165

Registration required. To register call[masked] or email [masked]

FREE ZUMBA CLASSES. JOIN THE PARTY WE HAVE FUN!!!

Zumba involves dance and aerobic elements. Zumba's choreography incorporates hip-hop, soca, samba, salsa, merengue, mambo, martial arts, and some Bollywood and belly dance moves. Squats and lunges are also included. Approximately 14 million people take weekly Zumba classes in over 141,000 locations across more than 151 countries.

results.description:
Meet to share and discuss SF and fantasy writing, books, films, TV shows, the writing process, the publishing industry, etc. with other SF and fantasy writers (both published and unpublished).  We usually have a long and lively discussion, followed by critiques of stories or chapters (if any) that members brought along.  We don't always have stories to critique, but we usually enjoy having hours worth of discussion, so let us know near the beginning of the Meetup if you brought something to have critiqued so we don't use up all our time talking -- time flies when you're having fun!

Further details or topics for this Meetup may be announced later.

As usual, you can bring a chapter or short story for the group to critique, but it's by no means necessary.  If you do bring your MS, try to bring enough paper copies for everyone attending to have one, and if you want us to write comments or corrections on it, then please double-space it.  We usually ask the author to read it aloud (unless you're shy), which is very helpful, because you'd be surprised how often you don't catch your own mistakes until you read your manuscript aloud for the first time! 

For the manuscript (MS) critiques, length is not set in stone, but suggested length is 1500 words, maximum length 3000 words. In pages (Times 12 point font), 1500 words is just under five pages double spaced, or about three pages single-spaced (but you should always double-space to allow room for people to write comments or corrections!)  Don't worry if your MS is longer than 1500 words, you can still bring it, but please keep it under 3,000 words.

For more guidelines on critiques, see http://www.meetup.com/The-Woodbridge-Science-Fiction-Fantasy-Writers-Meetup/about/
results.name: Share and discuss writing with other SF and fantasy writers

group.name: The Woodbridge Science Fiction & Fantasy Writers Meetup

results.description: Hi all, so Saturdays has ALSO become popular and so I have to cap the attendance at 24 people only. Be diligent about showing up on time and if change your mind to "no" please change your attendance or else I will hold you accountable and bar you after 3 times of being a "no-show". If you do not RSVP and we're full before 1 pm, you will not be included in the game. It is important that we have an accurate attendance as team size and other people showing up are dependent upon RSVPs. Any questions please private message me.

results.description:
Network to Learn How to Design Your Successful MBA Career! Free, EXCLUSIVE Admission for My Meetup Members to the New York MBA event – May 7th. REGISTER HERE: http://goo.gl/5e0I90

The QS World MBA Tour New York will be making a stop at the at the Westin New York – Times Square on May 7th from 1pm -6pm.  

Our event is your opportunity to meet with admissions directors from the top local and international business schools, and network with top tier MBA alumni from Harvard, Wharton and Columbia, who will share their study and career success stories. 

As an attendee, you will be eligible to apply for exclusive MBA scholarships worth $1.7M and attend panels and seminars to have all of your MBA questions answered in one place.

Our goal is to provide ambitious professionals like you with the best tools in order to facilitate your personal and professional development. We ensure that you have access to top business schools and education experts to help make this very important decision.

Attending Business Schools Include:

*Harvard, *Wharton, *Columbia, Baruch College, New York Institute of Technology, Fordham Univ., Iona College, Stevens Institute of Technology, Univ. of Maryland, Univ. of Miami, Vlerick Business School, Univ. of Toronto - Rotman, Southampton Business School, Westminster Business School, Copenhagen Business School, ESMT Berlin, HEC Paris, IE, INSEAD, and more...

*Represented by Alumni

During this event you can:

• Meet face-to-face with admissions directors from top international and local b-schools

• Attend a free GMAT seminar hosted by GMAC - the creators of the exam


• Apply for $1.7M of exclusive MBA scholarships to help finance your MBA


• Network with top tier MBA Alumni members from Harvard, Wharton and Columbia


• Gain advice on the MBA essay, application and interview


Entry is free for my Meetup Members, but places are limited so make sure you Register today.


Looking forward to meeting up with you on Saturday, May 7th: http://goo.gl/5e0I90!


Best wishes,

Zorka Kovacevich
Meetup Networking Organizer

P.S. Don’t miss out! This free opportunity provides you with everything you need to know about successfully pursuing your MBA ambitions. 

If you're limited on time, you can arrive or leave at your own convenience. Plan ahead, take a look at the Schedule of Planned Activities by viewing the Agenda, here: http://goo.gl/5e0I90.

results.description:
EXCLUSIVE FREE ENTRY to the World's Top Business School Event

Please REGISTER FOR FREE for your opportunity to meet with top business schools.

The QS World MBA Tour will be returning to New York on Saturday, May 7th at the Westin New York at Times Square from 1pm. We would like to invite you to attend our event for free (a saving of $15) but places are limited so make sure you register today.

As the competition for top jobs becomes fiercer, an MBA can be a critical success factor, providing you with a competitive edge. Understanding what top business schools want is vital to getting into the MBA program of your choice. Our event aims to provide you with the tools

Take advantage of this exclusive opportunity to speak face-to-face with admissions directors from the top local and international business schools. You will also be able to get advice on your MBA applications from experts. Event attendees are eligible to apply for a pool of exclusive MBA scholarships worth $1.7M

Business schools attending in Spring 2016 includes:

*Wharton, *Harvard, *Columbia, Baruch College - City University of New York, New York Institute of Technology, Fordham University, Iona College, Stevens Institute of Technology, Hofstra University, University of Maryland, University of Miami, University of Toronto - Rotman, Copenhagen Business School (full time and executive programs), ESMT Berlin, HEC Paris, IE Business School, INSEAD, Southampton Business School, Vlerick Business School, Westminster Business School and many more.

*attended by alumni

During this event you can:

Ø  Meet face-to-face with admissions directors from top international and local business schools

Ø  Apply for $1.7M of exclusive MBA scholarships to help finance your MBA

Ø Meet top MBA alumni from Wharton, Harvard and Columbia

Ø Free session by GMAC, the creators of the GMAT exam, all about how to improve your GMAT score.

Ø  Attend pre-fair panel and presentations

Don't forget to register today to guarantee free entry.

We look forward to seeing you there!

Link to register: http://goo.gl/vIXbq5

THE PREVIOUS WORKSHOP WAS SOLD OUT. WE ARE OFFERING IT ONE LAST TIME THIS SPRING.

 Join us and explore the possibilities of living a healthier and more joy-filled life by learning the key nutritional principles and yoga asanas that will transform your body and mind.

In this three hour interactive workshop you will learn how to:

- Make food and lifestyle choices that improve your energy, sleep, digestion and weight.
- Transform your relationship with your body and food.
- Reduce the toxic load and balance body's PH level.
- Make use of foods as supplements.
- Increase your vitality, release physical tension, return body and mind to a sense of ease and balance through 60 minute yoga practice. You will walk away with your personal blueprint for true health and joy!

Space is limited. Please, register here:

https://1234mb.eventbrite.com

------------------------------------------------------------------

WHAT OTHERS SAY ABOUT OUR WORK:

"This is a workshop which treats the body and mind as a whole and it has been more empowering than any therapist or book I have ever encountered". Simon P.

"I totally enjoyed the workshop. You gave me the tools i was looking for at this point of my life, you were a great help with your knowledge, ability to share and listen". Sophie D.

"I learned more than I thought I would, and I finally understood how important the mind-body connection is in this journey". Ann A.

"amazing" Terry B.

“What an amazing workshop! it made all the difference.i have learned that It’s not just about eating better, rather about being in tune with your body, knowing your body and keeping it in balance". Ava D.

"Really great workshop! Met a new friend" - Elisa A.

"What a great experience! Just what I needed. I realized I have been hibernating with worry. Thanks for all the great suggestions" Michelle W.

“Thank you Sophia for helping this old goose realize his swan potential. You and the group have inspired me to reclaim my body. The lesson i have learned this weekend will be the foundation of my new way of living” Massimo M.

results.description:
This is a special extended version of the Free Intro Seminar; it is normally a paid class, being the first part of our Consciousness Development Program (the first 2.5 of 10 hours). We're offering this part of the class for FREE to anyone who would like to take it as a free intro seminar. If you decide you want to stay for the rest of the weekend, the remainder of the class will be from 4pm-6:30 pm Saturday, then 1-3:30pm & 4-6:30pm on Sunday. If you email us at [masked] to sign up for the Free Intro by or before 5/6, we will allow you to pay the pre-register rate ($10 off standard) of $150 for the remainder of the class. 

Detailed description of course below.


This class is part of IAC's main OBE training course, the Consciousness Development Program (CDP). The CDP is designed to provide participants with information for learning to leave the body with full awareness, and to be able to take advantage of all the spiritual-development benefits that may come with it. The CDP has received international acclaim and awards as a transformative and beneficial program in the life of the participant. 

The entire program covers over 25 OBE techniques, several of which will be practiced during the class. The entire CDP (40 hours of work) will be offered in four weekends of 10 hours each. 

If you would like to watch a lecture (on YouTube - 50 mins.), which introduces and explains many of the details of the CDP, please, click here. For a better understanding of the study of the out-of-body experience and some of the transformative benefits it can provide, click here. 

IAC's methods are based on self-mastery. The CDP strives to teach not only the process and techniques for leaving the body, but also all of its possible consequences, in order for the participant to achieve greater awareness and spiritual development. Some of these benefits (in this weekend's class) are: 

Module 1 (CDP1) 

• Research on the out-of-body experience (OBE, astral projection)

• The OBE in history

• Non-physical bodies

• Bioenergy (chi, prana, subtle energy, orgone)

• chakras, 

• aura

• Synchronicity

• Factors that facilitate the OBE

• OBE take-off & landing sensations

• Characteristics of the nonphysical dimensions

• Application of techniques for energetic and psychic development

• PlaceIAC New York center 

Registration Cost before day of class: $150 

Registration Cost on the day of class / at the door: $160

Who teaches this free lecture? 

It is taught by one of IAC’s senior faculty members, depending on who’s available. IAC’s faculty members have years of experience and training in spirituality and consciousness studies, including out-of-body experiences and psychic phenomena. IAC is an educational and research centered organization in the area of consciousness studies, human potential and psychic development, and has offices in over 12 countries worldwide.

How do I attend?

Confirm via meetup that you're attending or email us to register at newyork (-at-) iacworld.org
results.how_to_find_us: 59th and Lex subway is closest. The entrance to our building is under the palace restaurant awning near the corner of 57th and Lex.

results.description:
THE PREVIOUS WORKSHOP WAS SOLD OUT. WE ARE OFFERING IT ONE LAST TIME THIS SPRING.

Join us and explore the possibilities of living a healthier and more joy-filled life by learning the key nutritional principles and yoga asanas that will transform your body and mind.

In this three hour interactive workshop you will learn how to:

- Make food and lifestyle choices that improve your energy, sleep, digestion and weight.
- Transform your relationship with your body and food.
- Reduce the toxic load and balance body's PH level.
- Make use of foods as supplements.
- Increase your vitality, release physical tension, return body and mind to a sense of ease and balance through 60 minute yoga practice. You will walk away with your personal blueprint for true health and joy!

Space is limited. Please, register here:

https://1234mb.eventbrite.com

------------------------------------------------------------------

WHAT OTHERS SAY ABOUT OUR WORK:

"This is a workshop which treats the body and mind as a whole and it has been more empowering than any therapist or book I have ever encountered". Simon P.

"I totally enjoyed the workshop. You gave me the tools i was looking for at this point of my life, you were a great help with your knowledge, ability to share and listen". Sophie D.

"I learned more than I thought I would, and I finally understood how important the mind-body connection is in this journey". Ann A.

"amazing" Terry B.

“What an amazing workshop! it made all the difference.i have learned that It’s not just about eating better, rather about being in tune with your body, knowing your body and keeping it in balance". Ava D.

"Really great workshop! Met a new friend" - Elisa A.

"What a great experience! Just what I needed. I realized I have been hibernating with worry. Thanks for all the great suggestions" Michelle W.

“Thank you Sophia for helping this old goose realize his swan potential. You and the group have inspired me to reclaim my body. The lesson i have learned this weekend will be the foundation of my new way of living” Massimo M.

results.description: Lots to see everything will be in full bloom the Cherry Blossoms , Crab Apple Trees, Magnolias, Dog Woods, PJM Rhoddendrons to name a few. We will start in the Synoptic Garden where will see the different plants and trees. After we will go to the Dwarf Conifer Garden. Then we will walk around the park a bit.  We will then go to the green house. The walk will take  90 minutes. Please do not bring pets.  My cell is[masked]-9165.
results.how_to_find_us: We will meet in the front of the Synoptic Garden.

THE PREVIOUS WORKSHOP WAS SOLD OUT. WE ARE OFFERING IT ONE LAST TIME THIS SPRING.

Join us and explore the possibilities of living a healthier and more joy-filled life by learning the key nutritional principles and yoga asanas that will transform your body and mind.

In this three hour interactive workshop you will learn how to:

- Make food and lifestyle choices that improve your energy, sleep, digestion and weight.
- Transform your relationship with your body and food.
- Reduce the toxic load and balance body's PH level.
- Make use of foods as supplements.
- Increase your vitality, release physical tension, return body and mind to a sense of ease and balance through 60 minute yoga practice. You will walk away with your personal blueprint for true health and joy!

Space is limited. Please, register here:

https://1234mb.eventbrite.com

------------------------------------------------------------------

WHAT OTHERS SAY ABOUT OUR WORK:

"This is a workshop which treats the body and mind as a whole and it has been more empowering than any therapist or book I have ever encountered". Simon P.

"I totally enjoyed the workshop. You gave me the tools i was looking for at this point of my life, you were a great help with your knowledge, ability to share and listen". Sophie D.

"I learned more than I thought I would, and I finally understood how important the mind-body connection is in this journey". Ann A.

"amazing" Terry B.

“What an amazing workshop! it made all the difference.i have learned that It’s not just about eating better, rather about being in tune with your body, knowing your body and keeping it in balance". Ava D.

"Really great workshop! Met a new friend" - Elisa A.

"What a great experience! Just what I needed. I realized I have been hibernating with worry. Thanks for all the great suggestions" Michelle W.

“Thank you Sophia for helping this old goose realize his swan potential. You and the group have inspired me to reclaim my body. The lesson i have learned this weekend will be the foundation of my new way of living” Massimo M.
results.name: STRONG BODY, RADIANT MIND - Nutrition and Yoga for Spring

results.description: Eberron is a world where magic is technology, in which air ships, lightning rails, elemental galleons, and living constructs exist side by side with swords, armor, castles, and monsters. It is a world recovering from a continent wide civil war, where the five nations struggled with each other for the crown of Galifar. The Last War ended with the annihilation of an entire country by a mysterious magical cataclysm. While open war has ended, a shadow war among spies, nobles, dragonmarked houses, cults, and monsters has risen in its place. Join the adventure. Current players are level 4 and include a Warforged Fighter, Shifter Ranger, Human Rogue, and Halfling Bard. Pre-made characters are available for drop-ins. $10 at the door of the Brooklyn Strat to sit in.
results.name: D&D 5E Eberron Campaign

results.description:
I saw a commercial for this today and it looks like fun!

White Plains Cinco de Mayo is an outdoor event, free to public of all ages*. There will be Mexican food, drink and exciting performances throughout the day. First 350 attendees receive a sombrero courtesy of Corona!
*Attendees age 21 and over planning to drink alcohol outside must purchase a $5 wristband at entrance to the event.
1 - 2:30 pm: White Plains Mariachi Club opening for Mariachi Sol Mixteco
2:30 - 4 pm: Performance by Ballet Folklorico Mexicano de Nueva York
4 - 6 pm: Crossover performance and DJ by Larger Than Life

I am planning to go around 1, so we can meet up, or just come whenever you can. Let's meet in front of the Brazen Fox at 1 PM and if you're planning to come later, I'll send updates as to where we are

Here is the link to the website : http://wpbid.com/events/may-7-cinco-de-mayo

And this is the video
https://www.facebook.com/WhitePlainsBID/videos/764580270345186/

Can't wait to see you there!!
results.name: Let's Celebrate Cinco de Mayo in White Plains!

results.description:
The Shadow Shift Experience

Transformation that allows fully living in alignment with your soul’s purpose

With Junie Moon Schreiber- Certified Shadow Work ® Facilitator

If you are a personal growth junkie, achievement addict, spiritual seeker, or find yourself exhibiting behaviors that sabotage your joy, listen up!

Sustainable transformation that allows you to open to your soul’s deepest calling is possible when you get in touch with your unconscious beliefs.  When we shine a light on that which you CAN NOT SEE ALONE, and shift your old stories, change happens. Old patterns of dysfunction melt away and you find the confidence to speak your truth and set healthy boundaries, open to love, and make bold decisions to manifest your dreams. 

Would you like to finally understand why you hold yourself back and sabotage your success in love, health and your career? 

In this Three Hour experience, you will get clear on what you are truly wanting, why you don’t have it and experience a profound shift that will allow movement toward achieving fulfillment in 

what matters most to you.

Please note, you must sign up for this event. you can go here https://www.eventbrite.com/e/the-shadow-shift-experience-tickets-23118617407

$35 early registration, $45 after April 27th, Limited space- only 12 participants and registration is necessary.

results.description:
This class is an 8 week introduction to "New York" style salsa. We will move progressively week to week, while we teach you the basic footwork, timing, turns and how to partner in Salsa On2. The perfect class for absolute beginners, no experience or is partner required.

Dates: 5/7/16-7/2/16

Day: Saturdays Time: 1-2pm

Cost: Salsa Only: $110 for 8 weeks Try bachata, salsa & merengue unlimited for 8 weeks for $165

Location: Rhythmology: 361 Union Ave, Westbury, NY 11590

Registration required. To register email

[masked]

or call[masked]-6677.
results.name: Introduction to New York Style Salsa

results.description:
Join us tomorrow to put a little SALSA in your life. 

Each and every saturday we have a little salsa for all ages and all levels. 

• Latin Kids Ensemble: 1-2PM


Kid's are welcome to join the "Latin Kids Ensemble" from 1-2pm.  In this class kids learn about Latin Culture and its rhythm.  We focus on teaching them the roots of music and how to feel it in their souls. 

• Salsa Level 1: 2-3PM

Two left feet? Never danced before? Want to learn how to salsa? Come join us.. No experience necessary, and no partner needed. Just bring your dancing shoes, and your positive energy y VAMOS A BAILAR!!! WHEPPA!!!

• Salsa Level 2: 3-4PM


Salsa Level 2 requires you to have previous salsa experience. You should know the fundamentals of the basics, and an open mind to learn.  In this class we will cover footwork, partner-work, body movement, spinning, and styling techniques.  


***Note: Please wear comfy attire. WE WILL BE HAVING A NICE SALSA WORKOUT!!!
results.name: Salsita Saturdays

group.name: Bergen County Salsa Dance Lessons Meetup (in Ridgefield)

results.description:
Access WiFi:  AMNH-GUEST

The Museum is open daily from 10 am–5:45 pm.



American Museum of Natural History


http://www.amnh.org

General Admission

Suggested general admission includes all 45 halls and the Rose Center for Earth and Space. If you wish to pay less than the suggested admission, you may purchase tickets at any ticket counter in the Museum.

General Admission + One

General Admission Plus One tickets include admission to the Museum and Rose Center for Earth and Space plus one special exhibition, IMAX or 3D film, or Hayden Planetarium Space Show.



Come join us:

2:00 PM - 3:00 PM:  

The Titanosaur - 2016 Special Exhibit - (Free with museum admission) - Wallach Orientation Center, Fourth Floor

AMNH:  In January 2016, the Museum added another must-see exhibit to its world-famous fossil halls: a cast of a 122-foot-long dinosaur. This species is so new that it has not yet been formally named by the paleontologists who discovered it.


3:30 PM - 4:30 PM:   

Check out the many amazing attractions that you would like to see while there:

• 45 halls and the Rose Center for Earth and Space

• Current Special Exhibits shown above (Buy Tickets)



(Optional)

3:30 PM Screening (Buy Tickets) - National Parks Adventure 3D Film - 2016 Special Exhibit - Samuel J. and Ethel LeFrak Theater

AMNH:  The ultimate off-trail adventure into the awe-inspiring great outdoors and untamed wilderness of America’s national parks.

4:45 PM - 5:00 PM:

Meet us back outside at bottom of the steps in front of statue at AMNH entrance.  


We will then go somewhere local for drinks/food.

If it doesn't rain, we can afterwards take a short (7 minute) Central Park walk to Belvedere Castle.


Group Meeting Location:

For the sixth year running Shaolin Five Animal Kung Fu is honored to bring to the residents of NYC at large our free Kung Fu class in Riverside Park. (See below for full info) This six month course has a brand new and exciting syllabus that will not only get you in great physical shape and teach you excellent forms but additionally will give you the techniques and confidence to be able to defend yourself on the street should the need arise. Sifu Adam Chertoff

results.description:
The NYSC invites you to join us to our monthly Women’s circle where we honor your feelings, honor your soul and call upon your divine being to help you move through this sacred time. Within the circle, women unite to empower their voices, enhance their courage, reinforce their compassion, and connect with their wisdom. We meditate, play music to access our heart's knowledge, remember our mothers and grandmas, share, and enjoy sisterhood! This circle is open to all traditions and levels, and beginners are especially encouraged to attend.
Please arrive on time and bring water to drink, a rattle (you may borrow one at the event), pen & notepad, a scarf, and feel free to bring objects that are connected to your spiritual power. Suggested donation: $20 For more info visit http://www.nyshamaniccircle.org/womens-circle or email [masked] with questions.

If you need to contact us on Saturday, please email us.


"When women gather, Pachamama heals!"
results.name: NYSC Women's Circle

results.description:
"Create What You Want" is free - it's a gift you give yourself. The workshop is for free-spirited, fearless writers who write, create, think out of the box, and want to support other writers in their creativity.  

The workshop features quiet time to write (arrive on time to make the most of your quiet time,) time to read to each other, reflect and support, as well as ample time to creatively problem solve as a writers' community.  What's holding you back?  What do you want to build, but seem to be stumbling getting there?   Some of the challenges and interests mentioned at our past meetings were..  When to stop researching and start writing; blogging topics; concepts; story boarding.  Bring your ideas so you can share and support. 

Bring your journals, laptops, tablets and simple (I mean simple and easy to clean up please) snacks for yourself or to share, and water.  The Library wants a deposit to make sure no crumbs are left behind.   BRING QUARTERS FOR THE METER.
results.name: RSVP "Create What You Want" Audacious Writers Workshop

results.description:
This is a co-ed adult pick-up game 6v6 or 7 v7 depending on attendance. 90 minutes with two 45 minute halves. No slide tackling or rough play. We play with Pugg goals. Pinnies provided.  Shin guards are recommended.


This pick up game is hosted by Coach Moe and is free for those who attended both training sessions with him the same day, $4 for all others.


PLEASE UPDATE YOUR RSVP AT LEAST 2 HOURS BEFORE THE GAME!

• Update your RSVP by 11:30AM

• RSVPs close by 12 NOON

• No shows and those who didn't update their RSVP at least 2 hours before the game will be red carded after the second offense, which means that we have the right to edit your RSVP.

Directions by subway or bus:

2 and 3 trains to Clark St.

A and C trains to High St.


F train to York St.


N and R trains to Court St.


Weather policy:

In case of inclement weather we will send out an email to notify you at least two hours before meeting time.

What to bring:

Please note that Cadman Plaza park is a turf field. Turf shoes are preferred. Please bring water or sports drink. Please bring a ball if you have one.


By RSVP-ing YES you agree to the following:

I certify that I have no known medical or other conditions that could interfere with my participation in Williamsburg Soccer Training activities. I also understand and accept that the practice of soccer, both indoor and outdoor, involves certain risks of physical injury. Therefore, I, individually, hereby release and discharge, Williamsburg Soccer Training Organizer and Assistant Organizers from any and all claims, actions, damages, losses, liabilities, costs and expenses of any kind whatsoever, including but not limited to any claims of negligence, arising out of, resulting from, by reason of, or in connection with my participation in any of Williamsburg Soccer Training programs or activities.

results.description:
There are four pieces currently available for the meeting. If you plan to join us, please read these pieces in advance and be prepared to discuss them. You can download them at this link: http://www.meetup.com/New-York-City-Writers-Critique-Group/files/. Please note that if you are not logged in to Meetup.com, this page will appear blank.

<a href="http://www.meetup.com/New-York-City-Writers-Critique-Group/files/"></a>They are, in no particular order:

Chapter 6 of Jeffrey Baer's "The Strickland File"

Part 2 of Marilyn Williams's "Sarry Ann"

Gidian Beer's "The Trouble With Denis"

Jack Hubert's "Chapter 6"

If you have trouble with any of the files, please let me know. Also note that at present I have no submissions in the queue; if you've sent something that hasn't yet been read by the group, please call my attention to that because it's slipped through the cracks--and if you have a piece ready to submit, send it whenever you're ready!

results.description:
All levels practice. Coached by Granger.

This practice is about water polo. Emphasis is on playing and learning the game by playing. Some of us have been playing since childhood. Others have picked it up as adults. We're friendly and inclusive, but we play hard.

Requirements:

-You have to join New York Recreation. $75 for 6 months for access to all rec centers and pools in the city. If you're under 25, you pay $25 for 1 year. http://www.nycgovparks.org/programs/recreation-centers/membership

-Beginners are welcome, but you must be a good swimmer.

-You MUST bring a lock for a gym locker.

-You should bring an athletic bathing suit, goggles, and a towel. Bring a swim cap if you have long hair.

Hello Everyone,

Let's get together for some fun minpin mayhem!  We will be meeting at my favorite uptown location- J Hood Wright Dog Park on 173rd-175th and Fort Washington.  The A train to 175 will get you right to the park.  The dog run is in the back.  It was  was renovated last year and is really really great. Happy Spring/Summer!!

results.description:
With George
From 2pm-4:30pm (It's okay to arrive late or leave early.)

We'll explore what makes free will impossible, and how understanding the causal and unconscious nature of our human will can benefit us personally and societally.

The Sony Plaza is a large public atrium with plenty of seating, and restrooms. There are Starbucks and Illy coffee concessions, or you can bring your own food and drink.

We'll also be joined by members of the Exploring the Illusion of Free Will Meetup group. Visit their event listing for the rsvp's

I hope you can join us.

George

Our friends at Perdition are planning a special event the day before Mother's Day and we are invited! This event will be a fund raiser for Callen-Lorde Community Health Center and Ali Forney. Lets Explore !!!

==> Planned Itinerary <==

1. Walk Across Brooklyn Bridge

2. Explore Battery Park

3. Snack Break !

4. Take Staten Island Ferry (FREE)

5. Cherish one of the most amazing views of Downtown Skyline - then return back to downtown in the same Ferry

6. Walk to South Street Seaport

7. Water Taxi Back to Brooklyn ($4/person) - (or Subway) 

8. Hangout @ the DUMBO Park! or South St Seaport!

9.  Ice Cream / Coffee Break

10. Go Home, Relax and watch the PICs !!!

(The above plan is surely subject to change)


Please Bring FOOD for the Snack/Lunch Breaks or Purchase it locally en-route!

Expect it to be uniquely awesome views

Expect the Bkln Bridge to be very crowded (if its good weather)

results.description: Writing can be a challenge for anyone, but particularly so if you're a woman writing to speak up for yourself and your experiences (through fiction or otherwise). Let's talk about some of the internal barriers that come in the way of us and our work and figure out what's at the root of them... and let's make this interesting. Then at some point, we'll saddle down and write for an hour (timed). People can come and go as they please, but get there on time if you don't want to miss the good part! And no need to run away when it's "officially over"; come to have a good time & make friends. This will be a joint writing sesh with The Feminist Salon meetup. Women only!

results.description:
Join us for our weekly Underwater Rugby (UWR) practice!

Underwater what? Underwater rugby is probably the most exciting activity you may have ever done. The only 3D sport (apart from Harry Potter’s Quidditch), great endurance, fast, strategic, and above all: extreme fun! Imagine a 13ft-deep pool, 2 baskets on the bottom of each side. Two teams, equipped with fins, mask&snorkel, and a salt-water filled ball. We hold our breath when playing at 3, 5, 13 feet below the surface and pass the ball standing on our heads, swimming sideways and swirling around. Yes, we can tackle the person who carries the ball. But no, no one ever drowned in the 60 years the sport has been around. Ladies and gents are equally welcome - we are co-ed :)

We have all the equipment you need if you want to try. Just let us know and jump with us into the water - we welcome all levels (though you should be able to swim and be comfortable with the idea of swimming under the water - but you don't need to be an expert diver). 

So just send us a quick line and new experiences await - we promise!

Contact Daniel or Rolexi at [masked]

And check out our Facebook profile www.facebook.com/NJ.UWH.UWR/

<a href="http://g.co/maps/ueppk"></a>
results.how_to_find_us: 226 Rome Street, Newark, NJ  Map: http://g.co/maps/ueppk

Lets Explore !!!

==> Planned Itinerary <==

1. Walk Across Brooklyn Bridge

2. Explore Battery Park

3. Snack Break !

4. Take Staten Island Ferry (FREE)

5. Cherish one of the most amazing views of Downtown Skyline - then return back to downtown in the same Ferry

6. Walk to South Street Seaport

7. Water Taxi Back to Brooklyn ($4/person) - (or Subway) 

8. Hangout @ the DUMBO Park!

9.  Ice Cream / Coffee Break

10. Go Home, Relax and watch the PICs !!!

(The above plan is surely subject to change)

Duration approx 5+ hours (anticipated), Lots-n-Lots of Walking

Expect the Bkln Bridge to be very crowded (if its good weather)
