results.description:
This Event: 

The aim of this weekly event is to offer a place where Python developers and learners can come and ask questions or give help. 

Individuals of all programming skill levels are welcome. 

It is suggested that you bring your own laptop. If you don't have access to a laptop and want to attend, please let Paul Logston know and he will see about getting you a laptop for the day.

This event is free. 

This event is not a tutorial. Tutorials hosted by Learn Python NYC are labeled as tutorials.

Resources:

Here are some learning resources and free text editor / IDE suggestions.

https://github.com/logston/NYCPythonSOH/blob/master/resources.rst 

Detailed Directions to us:

As you enter the building located at 568 Broadway, New York, NY 10012 you will need to provide ID and your destination (Fueled Collective, 11th Floor) to the front desk. They will provide you with a sticker badge. Take one of the elevators (located to the right of the front desk) to the 11th floor. We will be in the Deerbrook conference room.
results.how_to_find_us: Show ID at front desk, come up to 11th floor, we are in the Deerbrook conference room!

results.description:
Writing can be a challenge for anyone, but particularly so if you're a woman writing to speak up for yourself and your experiences (through fiction or otherwise). Let's talk about some of the internal barriers that come in the way of us and our work and figure out what's at the root of them... let's make this interesting. Then at some point, we'll saddle down and write for an hour (timed). People can come and go as they please, but get there on time if you don't want to miss the good part! And no need to run away when it's "officially over"; come to have a good time & make friends. This will be a joint writing sesh with The Bushwick Writers Meetup. 
Women only
results.name: Women & WRITING (Joint writing sesh w/ Bushwick Writers Meetup)

results.description:
No Winter Lasts Forever and No Spring ever skips its turn.

April is a Promise that May is bound to Keep.

 It is time to get together, enjoy some great food and drinks and make some new girlfriends. 

How about Le Souk?

A beautiful multi-level space that makes you feel as if you were parading the streets of a Souk in Morocco, amazing Nouveau Moroccan menu, different DJ's playing different kind of music everyday of the week, belly dancers, entertainment. 

It has an open kitchen, little pantry area that patrons can see in action while dining. Also has a beautiful outdoor, ideal for the summer where guests can seat, enjoy their hookahs and dine while listening to beautiful music. Tent area and elevated space that overlooks the whole floor as well as the DJ.

The place is giving us a great deal, which is an entree, a brunch drink and juice for $30 (in cash) including the tax and tip.


Hope to see you all there.

Best

Ana

results.description:
Someone is shouting! Ho! Do you hear? Am I howling in vain? For if one is frightened, everything makes a noise!

 – Sophocles, Acrisius [fragment]

…the sound of a driven leaf shall put them to flight, and they shall flee as one flees from the sword, and they shall fall when none pursues. They shall stumble over one another, as if to escape a sword, though none pursues…

 – Leviticus 26:36-37

What does it mean to be afraid? What are the neurobiological, physiological, behavioral, cognitive/conscious, and unconscious factors involved? Do we experience anxiety and fear in ways our animal cousins do, or in ways uniquely human? Is the problem of anxiety, as Freud averred, “a nodal point at which the most various and important questions converge, a riddle whose solution would be bound to throw a flood of light upon our whole mental existence.”?

*****Free and open to the public 
    Seating is on a first-come, first-serve basis
No registration required!

Participants:

Nouchine Hadjikhani

Associate Professor in Radiology, Harvard Medical School

Nouchine Hadjikhani, MD, PhD, does brain research at the Martinos Center for Biomedical Imaging in Boston, where she directs the Neurolimbic research laboratory. She is also invited Professor at the Gillberg Neuropsychiatric Center in Gothenburg, Sweden. Her initial focus of research was the visual system, which over time developed into several topics, including migraine, emotion… read more »

Robert Kurzban Professor of Psychology, University of Pennsylvania

Robert Kurzban is a Professor at the University of Pennsylvania in the Psychology Department. He received his PhD at the University of California Santa Barbara at the Center for Evolutionary Psychology in 1998, and received postdoctoral training at Caltech in the Division of Humanities and Social Sciences, UCLA Anthropology, and the University of Arizona’s Economic… read more »

Joseph LeDoux University Professor and Henry and Lucy Moses Professor of Science, Center for Neural Science and the Department of Psychology, New York University

Joseph LeDoux is the Henry and Lucy Moses Professor of Science at NYU in the Center for Neural Science. He also directs the Emotional Brain Institute located at the Nathan Kline Institute and at NYU. His work is focused on the brain mechanisms of memory and emotion. LeDoux is the author of The Emotional Brain,… read more »

Francis Lee Mortimer D. Sackler Professor and Vice Chair for Research, Department of Psychiatry, Weill Cornell Medical College

View Papers / Presentations » Francis Lee is the Mortimer D. Sackler Professor and Vice Chair for Research in the Department of Psychiatry at Weill Cornell Medical College, and attending psychiatrist at New York-Presbyterian Hospital. He received his MD and PhD from the University of Michigan, and psychiatry training at Payne Whitney Clinic and completed postdoctoral training, at New York… read more »

Eric R. Marcus Director of the Columbia University Center for Psychoanalytic Training and Research; Professor of Clinical Psychiatry, Columbia University College of Physicians and Surgeons

Dr. Eric R. Marcus is Director of the Columbia University Center for Psychoanalytic Training and Research, where he is a training and supervising analyst. He is a Professor of Clinical Psychiatry at the Columbia University College of Physicians and Surgeons. He was formerly president of the New York County district branch of the American Psychiatric… read more »

results.description:
You are invited on Saturday, April 2, 2016 at 2:30 PM to the Masonic Philosophical Society for our next hosted discussion and study. Each month a different topic, ranging from philosophy and science to religion and metaphysics, is discussed and debated. This group, which is open to the public, is where non-members can learn more about Freemasonry, as well as meet local Freemasons.

Study Topic
March's topic will be conducted by Brother Lylia Gonzalez Frayle on a study of Freemasonry:  What are the Three declared objectives of the Theosophical society and how do they compare to those of Freemasonry? After a short lecture, a discussion and debate by the group will follow.

The object of the Theosophical society was to liberate man from bondage by presenting a philosophy of life that would show him how to find the truth within himself. The literature presented by the Theosophical Society, though a statement in modern form of the ancient wisdom, is not offered as a creed, but it is intended to provoke thought and study. It gives an explanation of the problems in life that every person can verify by himself, if he so will. Belief in, and the wish to promote, the brotherhood of mankind are the only prerequisites for good standing in the Theosophical society. So, what, indeed, is Theosophy? What is the difference between the Three Fundamental Propositions of the Secret doctrine and the The Three declared objectives of the Theosophical society? How do they compare to those of Freemasonry?

Directions:
[masked]th Ave Whitestone, NY 11357

Mission Statement
The Masonic Philosophical Society embraces the concept of learning, not for school, but for life, and believes that all men, who seek it, deserve access to continued education. We further embrace the concept of a community environment, where ideas can be shared and debated in an open forum. From the seven liberal arts to the arcane, we seek to gain and to share the knowledge that is the legacy of mankind.

More Resources
Website: http://www.philosophicalsociety.org

Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/masonicphilosophicalsociety

Learn more about Freemasonry: http://www.co-masonry.org
results.name: What are the Three declared objectives of the Theosophical society?

Join your pals from ArtForward and Wired NY Meetup groups. We'll do a sweep of Williamsburg galleries. We'll have the chance to hear from some gallery directors & artists.

In previous Meetups, we've gone to the following galleries:
The Boiler
Moiety
Ventana 244
Figureworks
Front Room
Cotton Candy Machine
Sideshow
Slag
Journal Gallery
Art 101

For those who are interested, we'll end at a local tavern for some brilliant conversation, and to watch the Kentucky Derby. All of the prep races have been run and now it is time to turn our attention to Derby 2016. Following American Pharoah's Triple Crown success last year, there is more attention than ever on the race.

The 142nd Kentucky Derby, the first leg of the Triple Crown, will be held at Churchill Downs on Saturday, May 7. Two weeks later, the Preakness Stakes will be run at Pimlico Race Course on Saturday, May 21. The Belmont Stakes, the final jewel, will be contested in New York at Belmont Park on Saturday, June 12.

Who is the Kentucky Derby 2016 favorite?

Undefeated 2-year-old champion Nyquist is the Kentucky Derby 2016 favorite. He won the Breeders' Cup Juvenile last year and started his 2016 campaign with victories in the San Vicente Stakes at Santa Anita Park and the Florida Derby at Gulfstream Park.

Other Kentucky Derby contenders include Santa Anita Derby winner Exaggerator, Blue Grass Stakes hero Brody's Cause, and Arkansas Derby winner Creator.

If you are lost, you can text me at[masked]-8453.

Hope to see you all soon!

results.description:
Note: This Is the St. Barts Location.

Session #1 Sold Out & was a big Success so we've added Session #2.

At a family BBQ In 2010, 6 Teens from 2 separate families drowned to death in Louisiana's Red river. There were numerous people standing just feet away, not a single one could swim. The family's comment "None of us could swim, they were yelling, 'Help me, help me. Somebody please help me.' It was nothing I could do but watch them drown, one by one."

That same summer in NYC 7 people drowned to death 4 Adults, 3 children, all of minority descent and all too young.

• 70 Percent of African American Kids & Teens can't swim. (CDC 12')

• If a parent can't swim, there is only a 13% chance that a child in the household will swim. 

• Men are 4 times more likely to drown than women.

• The biggest reason black people give for not learning was hydrophobia "A fear of drowning". I'll let the irrationality of that one sink in.

 Be the change, be the example. Let's burn the Black people don't swim banner!

Argue with the facts all you want it doesn't change them! "I personally hate being a statistic and don't give 2 shits why people including myself can't do something. Just do it I tell myself everything else will fall into place" How about we end the cycle #NotaStatistic #BlackPeopleSwim

Black People Love Outdoors & Adventure aka me has been haggling for months and I've secured us all an amazing deal. Here's the scoop! 

5 Package of sessions @ $22 per (1 hr) lesson = $110


(Beginner Class & Intermediate Class) - (Pay using Venmo or Chase QuikPay to [masked] very easy!)

Saturdays @ 3pm. ST BART'S SWIMMING POOL

• 4/30/16; 5/7/16 ; 5/14/16; 5/21/16; 5/28/16(No Lesson); 6/4/16

• Sign up now limited spots!

• Great private instructors, Nice & Heated 84 deg pool, changing rooms, close to trains. 

Come June we have a Surfing Challenge; Kayaking; White water rafting; Swimming/ Beaching, Paddle boarding; Water skiing and an Open water survival techniques class, heck we'll be finding Nemo too. So Get your life!

Spot not confirmed until payment is received.

Note: As an amazing courtesy to our group you will have the chance to make up missed classes. (Max 2. Please do not abuse this!) 

Let's get wet ;-) ~ Sorry couldn't help myself..blame the Race & Sex comedy show last week.

Recap NYC swim lesson prices: 1. JCC $296 members (~9 Classes), $376 Non-members

2. Nyc Pools Membership cost $75 for 6 months/ $150/ yr. Learn to swim is a lottery System currently session already started and has a very long wait-list.

3. Flushing Meadows Pool Qns - Lottery wait list is 6-8 months long.

4. Vanderbilt YMCA Manh- $140 members (1X/wk for 8 wks), $230 Non-members (1X/wk for 8 wks) Or $235 members (2X/wk for 8 wks), $405 Non-members (2X/wk for 8 wks). Other YMCS's may have different pricing but this gives you an idea. 

5. 92St Y Manh- Lessons ~$315

Put part of your tax refund to use and come down and play some pool! The fun starts at 3PM with UNLIMITED play until 8 pm for only $20! Pay at the front desk and tell whomever is working the desk you're there for the meet up and they'll point you in our direction. All skill levels are welcome! I hope to see you there!

Basic 8-Ball rules:

To avoid confusion and debate, here are some good rules for playing 8-ball. These are not the APA league rules, They're not "Mike's Biker bar" rules, they are the BCA rules which govern most pro pool matches.

-- The table is open (free choice of group) after the break, no matter which ball(s) are pocketed.
-- A scratch or other foul results in cue-ball in hand ANYWHERE on the table for the opponent.
-- Hitting one of your opponent's balls before one of your own on a shot is a foul.
-- Missing or scratching on the 8-ball is NOT loss of game if the 8-ball is still on the table.
-- The ball and pocket must be called unless the shot is obvious.
-- The number of cushions (or other balls) the ball bounces off need NOT be called.
-- The cue-ball or ANY other ball must touch a cushion or be pocketed after a shot or it's a foul.
-- The 8 ball must always be called.

results.description:
Learn to tell the tales of your Peace Corps service, with even more gusto than you already have!

We are hosting our 3rd storytelling workshop for RPCVs, which is led by coaches from The Moth - a syndicated NPR radio show. Join us for an afternoon well spent, honing your narrative skills and sharing your story with other RPCVs. RSVP and get your ticket here: http://www.brownpapertickets.com/event/2544535
$15 online, 20 at the door. We have limited space so don't wait!

And SAVE THE DATE! June 25th will be our 5th Annual Story Slam! Come hear RPCVs take the stage in front of a live audience and tell a tale of adventure. RPCVs who are interested in being in the show are highly encouraged to come to this workshop!
results.name: Story Telling Workshop!

group.name: Returned Peace Corps Volunteers of New York City

results.description: We meet @Michaels -Pelham Manor You  pay $5 at the register when you come in, every first Saturday of the Month from 3-9pm. ....So bring any craft you would like to work on! You will have access to the Cricut and Sizzix machine. There are only 10 spots available!  Bring a snack to share and your own drink.  There are times when we might place an order for something to eat.   We have so much fun!

Every Saturday from 3:00 to 4:00 PM - Advanced level

$15 less than 3 - $12 from 3 to 6 people

You need to register prior coming.

This is an advanced meeting! You should be almost fluent. I'm here to propose a new subject of conversation every week, to manage the discussion and respect everyone's speech time as well as to correct mistakes (if you allow me to do so).

Au plaisir de faire votre connaissance!

Ingrid

results.description:
Our friend Liz at Cool Mom Picks is helping with this Mother's Day event, and we thought it sounded like a fun (and free) way for a family to spend an afternoon at the Samsung 837 flagship technology experience center in the Meatpacking district.


RSVP here to get on the list: http://bit.ly/samsung837moms

More details:

*Visit the technology playground including a virtual reality tunnel, interactive art installations, a three-story screen, and more!

*Get fun and easy family tech tips from Cool Mom Tech publisher and family tech expert Liz Gumbinner

*Peek at some of the mind-blowing new technology made just for families.

*Kids enjoy on-site entertainment, a children's play area, and a Mother’s Day card craft and printing station

*Free snacks and sweet treats at the Samsung 837 café

Location: Samsung 837 Technology Center, 837 Washington Street

RSVP: http://bit.ly/samsung837moms
results.name: Samsung Technology Experience

The street action will begin around 3:00pm and end close to 630pm. This week's action will be followed by an important business meeting and/or continued action at locations TBD.

results.description:
Greetings Fellow Tennis Players!

It's time to play!!! 

This Meet-up notification serves only as a notification reminder of the 
Spring league registration dates and format. RSVP's only serve as 
notification that you intend to participate in the spring league. To 
officially register visit us http://acestodeuces.teamopolis.com­.  League play starts May 14th. See league details below.

Sessions to come out an play tennis are titled Hitting Sessions and are 
typically held on Monday, Wednesday and Saturday weather permitting.

The league operates as follows; once registered you will receive a roster of whom you're scheduled to play within the 8 week regular spring schedule. The roster will include each members contact information so that you can determine a time and place to play that is suitable for each of you. If a place can not be determined a default midpoint location will be provided. 


 The league consist of 5 divisions; 


 Beginners ( Ranking[masked]) -Green group


 Women's Intermediate (Ranking[masked]) -Yellow group

Men's Intermediate (Ranking[masked]) -Yellow group # 2

Mixed Doubles (Combined Ranking of[masked])- Orange group

Advanced (Ranking[masked])-Red group


There will be a total of 5-7 members per division.

The Winner of each Division will receive a Trophy !!

The Spring season is <a>from </a><a>May 14th to June 25th</a><a>.</a> 

Spring Registration is <a>from April</a><a>1st to May 14t</a><a>h</a>

The cost per participant is 50$. 

To Register go tohttp://acestodeuces.teamopolis.com, Select Division tab on the lower right hand side of Page.


Let's get out there and have some fun this Spring!!!

See You on the Courts!!

League Administrator

Nitsa Mikell
results.name: Aces to Deuces Spring Registration 04/01-05/14/2016

group.name: Aces to Deuces of Bergen County the Affordable Tennis League

results.description:
Spring is here at last everypony! Now that winter's all wrapped up it's time to celebrate; all the schools that are about to start their break, all the open window weather! So take a walk in the park with Bronies-NYC this May as we celebrate the return of the sun.

For our second time we'll be moving on up to the Harlem Repertory Theatre, just across the river from all the blooming blossoms on Randall's Island- We need a big venue for our big show, and this month our meetup will be better than ever.

We will have present again the Art Corner for all those who want to get creative and submit their OCs to our pony collage!

Come on over to the other side of the bend to test your skills and luck with our various board games we have for everyone to enjoy. Speciality game this month is SECRET CHANGELING!

This is the monthly that is way too cool for April!

So with a stage, a huge screen, a powerful projector and lots of ponies - I think we have the prerequisites to summon an AWESOME RAVE! The types which only the legends speak of these days. You can look forward to an absolutely boomin' sound system to play back all the latest episodes (in case any were missed) and to drop some amazingly phat beats.

Volunteer

We always need helping hooves to pull off another great meetup. Go to http://goo.gl/kjoPku to sign up. As always, thank you! ;)
results.how_to_find_us: The Tito Laviera Theater
results.name: The April Monthly in May!

results.description:
Please read carefully: This event is being hosted by Dave Cervini's newyorksocialnetwork.com and several of their partner Meet Up groups.  The number of people you see registered on your Meet Up represent only a portion of those actually attending. If you have any questions or want to know how many are attending from all groups please contact the event host at [masked].

<a href="http://www.newyorksocialnetwork.com/wp-content/uploads/2013/11/pastapark-0132.jpg"></a>If you are a novice or love art, our Chelsea Art Gallery Tours are a fun and casual way to explore a great part of the city while socializing and making new friends and connections.

With over 300 art galleries in Chelsea, our Gallery Tour  Led by Rafael Risemberg with a Ph.D. in arts education  finds the most innovative art, and leads you on an insightful, entertaining and affordable journey through the contemporary art scene.  Rafael explains the art in ways that makes the experience meaningful to those who don’t know a lot about art as well as those who do.

Our tours take place RAIN, Snow or SHINE, as we’re indoors over 90% of the time. You will be amazed at how much you will learn and enjoy both the art and the people on the tour!

The group will meet at a local cafe prior to the tour.  Following the tour many from the group stay together for a drink or a bite to eat.

Pay $25 when you arrive (PLEASE BRING EXACT CHANGE)

DO NOT REGISTER FOR THIS EVENT UNLESS YOU WILL ACTUALLY ATTEND.

Can I come alone?  Yes 99% of the people come to this event on their own to meet new people and check out some cool art.

What do I wear? Dress for the weather.  Be casual and comfortable.

What to expect: We are piggy backing on a larger tour.   We will have 10-15 from our group.  The age range for our people is 20's -40's ( the larger group is 20's - 60's)

How long does it last? about 2 hours

How do I know who is leading the group?  We meet separate from the main tour at a local cafe.  Our tour host will have a sign at the bar and you will have a chance to have something to eat or drink before we start the tour.  If you are not hungry just socialize.  When we are finished we walk over together to join the main tour.


If there does not seem to be a lot of people registered on this Meet Up, are there more people going?

Yes as explained, this event is being promoted by several Meet Up groups and

www.newyorksocialnetwork.com

.  If you only see a few on your Meet Up don’t worry you won’t be alone!  If you want to know exact numbers or have any questions you can contact the event organizer directly at [masked] or call[masked]
results.name: NY's #1 Chelsea Art Gallery Best Exhibits Guided Tour: Socialize and Explore!

group.name: New York Social Network, Events and Adventure Group - NYC

results.description:
This is a class in technique although, when you've conquered a song technically, then I will coach musicality and performance. Class size is limited. Fee is $20/per. You may audit the class once (without participating) for $10. Let me know when you sign up if that's your intention.

People at the front desk are helpful and friendly and the Cafe on the floor has great coffee and cookies, sandwiches, <a>pizza</a>, etc.

I've been asked to post this:

Dear Members: This is the first you have heard from me. I am Mr. Harrington's agent/rep. Mr. Harrington teaches privately coaching established actors and singers. For years his private rate has been $120/hr for this service. He started teaching through Meetup earlier this year and has as his goal to bring professional level instruction to the public at a rate that leaves no one behind. This demands tight scheduling of both his time and the room rental with Ripley-Grier Studios.For these reasons, I will be insisting to him that "no shows" be dropped from the group. The policy is this: If you RSVP you better show up. If you cancel you better do this by 4:00 pm the previous day.A word to the wise...Michael T. Harvey
results.how_to_find_us: Check the electronic billboard opposite the elevators on floor 16.

• If you can already have basic conversations, such as exchanging personal information, talking about your jobs, hobbies or life experiences, then you can join this group.  We will select a topic, read a short article together and then discuss it.  This week the topic will be Cellphone Dependence Syndrome. 

• We will talk about how and why people rely on their cellphone so much and what 's your opinion about it. 


Note: We are open about the suggestion of the topic, if there is any topic you would like to talk about feel free to leave the comment below. 


Bring your iPad or other tablet, or smartphone will be good too, we will read the article online. We may have additional materials that I will send you once we have 4 people RSVP.

venue.name: Prospect Park Parade Grounds

results.description:
****READ THIS FIRST || Parade Grounds Game Standards ****


Meet on field 8!!!

The game is scheduled to start at 3:30. We typically start 15 minutes after 3:30. Your RSVP is good if you come on time. If you come after teams are divided then you run the risk of not playing. Those who have RSVP’ed get first preference to play (This does not apply to anyone on the waiting list). Also, please  Un-RSVP if you will not be attending. That gives other people a chance to play.

Rules and guidelines:

These games are geared towards advanced to intermediate players.

Teams are divided by two team captains (captains pick players in turns in an attempt to keep teams balanced and competitive)

Physical play is allowed as long as it isn't overly aggressive or dirty.

Slide tackles are allowed only to block a shot on goal or to intercept a pass  NO slide tackling on a player with the ball.

Ball hogging is absolutely not tolerated

Keep in mind as we don't have permit, we need to be flexible.
results.name: Saturday Pick-up Parade grounds 3:30 PM

results.description:
MEETUP UPDATE - 05/06/2016 (11:30 AM)

THE COMMENT BELOW WAS POSTED BY ONE OF OUR MEMBERS.  PLEASE READ IT SO THAT WE CAN ALL USE THE PROPER ENTRANCE WHEN WE GET THERE:

"The Stuyvesant Park dog run has been under construction and closed off, but the parks department made a temporary park in a nearby space that is filled with wood chips instead of concrete. It's a bit smaller too. The entrance is on 17th Street between 2nd and 1st Avenues."

*************************************************************

Many of you have been asking for a Manhattan MeetUp, so here's the FIRST of THREE for this month!


We sent out a short, 10-question Member Survey via an email blast to all of our Members on April 13, 2016.  Based on the results of that survey we are filling the May, 2016 calendar with the "top picks" of favorite dog runs... not only in Manhattan, but also in Brooklyn, Queens and even New Brunswick, New Jersey!

If you have not responded to that survey yet, by all means do so and let us know where your favorite dog runs are so that we may schedule future MeetUps there too!  

Our primary goal for 2016 is to schedule many MeetUps during each month at locations convenient to our Members... wherever they may live.  


Now a few words about the Stuyvesant Square Park Dog Run...

Some of this data came from our Members and some from reviews on Yelp.com:

This dog run is large and square in shape, with no separate areas for S/M/L dogs.  It is considered one of the best dog runs in NYC!

Half of the area is under renovation at present, but it is still large enough to accommodate a comfortable dog run, based on the typical space allocated to dog runs at other NYC parks.

The ground is a combination of asphalt pavement and stone pavers (no grass, but minimal or no dust!) so dogs tend to stay much cleaner here when they leave the run as opposed to other sites with huge dirt areas and fine pebble/sand.

There is ample shading offered by mature trees (see photos below) and plenty of seating benches for the humans.

The main entrance is double-gated, but there are also single door "side entrances" that are occasionally used by patrons which may pose a problem if they are not closed properly or if a nearby dog gets too curious to see what's on the other side.  We just need to be aware of this and be very careful for our canine kids.  This is not the dog run to lose yourself in a newspaper while your dog "does his own thing".

There is no water inside the dog run, but there are water fountains and a doggie water fountain nearby.  Best advice: bring your own water or a container to hold water which you can carry easily.  No poop bags on site either.

Nearest pubic restroom facilities are at Union Square.

Saturdays appear to offer the best chance for on-street parking near the park, but if you can avoid driving... do so!

Rusty and I will be driving from Brooklyn (no choice!) and we hope to meet many of you there! 

Here are a few photos for a preview of the park:

IMPORTANT: 


Attendance at this MeetUp event is purely voluntary and you do so at your own risk. 

By attending this MeetUp event you agree to hold harmless MeetUp.com, The Beagle Pack!, its Organizers and its Members, who assume NO liability for any injury, accident, loss of property or loss of life resulting from the use of this facility, or traveling to and from this facility, nor can they be held responsible for the actions of any aggressive dogs, irresponsible dog owners or patrons, or any hazardous conditions at the facility.

results.name: 2016's Manhattan Beagle Bash #1 at Stuyvesant Square Park Dog Run!

results.description:
Come on down to the Colorado Cafe, New Jersey's premiere country dance club and sports bar.  This event usually sells out and is a night you won't want to miss!

When 8minuteDating gets started, you'll have four 8-minute one-on-one conversations with singles in your age group followed by a 20-minute intermission where you can mix and mingle with other singles (from this and its sister events - ages 35 - 49 & 45 - 59) that might have caught your eye. After the intermission, you'll have four more 8-minute dates. That's 8 great dates in one fun night!

You'll enjoy delicious complimentary appetizers, ice breaker games, a cash bar and lots of raffle prizes.  Plus after you've met all of your dates, you can be our guest (a $10 value) in the dance hall for a great night of country dancing.  There will be free dance lessons, a country dj, a live rock band in the sports bar and an amazing night for everyone!

It's sure to be a great night and we guarantee you'll meet someone you want to see again or your next event is on us!  So sign up soon because space is limited and advance registration at 8minuteDating.com is required.

Click here to register: http://www.8minutedating.com

My meetup group members can receive a $5 discount by entering promo code 8mdnynj5 in the appropriate space when registering at 8minuteDating.com!
results.how_to_find_us: We will be in the dance hall
results.name: 8minuteDating at the Colorado Cafe in Watchung

results.description:
If you are learning English or if you are a native speaker of English, join us for relaxed conversation and to make new friends! All levels are welcomed!

This meetup is for:
-Students that want to improve their speaking & pronunciation
-New arrivals to the U.S.
-People looking to make new friends, discuss and learn about language & culture

Topics we are open to discussing
-Weather
-Hobbies
-News
-Politics
-Anything you want to talk about

Aspects of English we focus on
-Speaking: Pronunciation, Accents
-Listening: Definitions, Vocabulary, Synonyms
-Slang, common ways Americans express themselves

Please only sign up if you are serious about attending, we remove members that do not honor their RSVP!
It will be $2 to join. Also, Please support the venue by purchasing a coffee or something to eat when you attend.

Write what your native language is in the comments section!

venue.name: Met Museum - Ruth and Harold D Uris Center For Education, 81st Street Plaza Entrance

results.description:
Let's explore the Met together every other Saturday with as little pressure as possible. Be prepared to ask strangers if they're part of the Meetup and don't stop asking others if some say no.

Go in the *81st Street entrance* (*not up the big stairs*), and head straight back to the Uris Center for Education. At 4 PM sit in or stand by the *first row of the #8 benches* inside the Center For Education room, which is straight ahead past coat check. At 4:15 PM we'll decide who will go see what with whom and wander galleries. 

At 5:30 PM sit on or stand by the *left bench on the 2nd floor balcony* as you face the main entrance. Once everyone has gathered or at 5:40 PM (whichever comes first), we'll get tables in the Balcony Bar for cocktails, mocktails, and small plates to chat. We'll get tables at 5:40pm.

Everyone is responsible for their own admission and tab. I recommend you bring cash for your tab to make settling the check easier.

*If you miss the group at the first meeting, post in the Meetup comments (if you can) that you will meet them at the bench on the 2nd floor balcony at 5:30 PM.*
results.how_to_find_us: 81st St entrance: 4 PM Sit in or stand by the first row of the #8 benches inside the Center For Education room, which is straight past coat check. At 5:30 PM sit on or stand by the left bench on the 2nd floor Balcony as you face the main entrance.

results.description:
Please join us for this week's sit at 4pm this afternoon at B'nai Keshet (99 South Fullerton Avenue, Montclair), where a small but dedicated group is practicing mindfulness meditation in a Jewish context every Shabbat. There is a beauty and peacefulness when we sit together as a group and support each other's ability to practice.  


The sit leaders alternate each week.  


We frequently begin with a chant, followed by two separate sits with kavvanot (intentions) inspired by the calendar, the weekly Torah portion or our daily lives. All are welcome and there is no cost to attend. We look forward to seeing you. more information at: http://www.jmcmontclair.com

results.description:
General rules of the game:

No called balls/strikes.  You get three swings to put the ball into play.

No taking leads.

Sliding is allowed but be careful.  Be mindful of who is covering the base if you choose to slide.

Game is capped at 24 to ensure those that sign up will get a lot of playing time and at-bats.

Unless someone wants to play C the entire game, the position will be rotated amongst all team members equally.

Unless someone wants to pitch the entire game, the position will be rotated amongst all team members equally.

If 24 people sign up, the defense will be rotated so that each team member plays 4 innings in the field for each 1 they sit.

Fee structure:

First game free.

$5 per person per game

$25 for the season.

Please arrive promptly by 4pm.

I'll email/post in the event of inclement weather potentially impacting the game.  Alternatively you can call the hotline at[masked] x111

results.description:
*change of plans I will NOT be attending*


Hey peeps who wants to come join me at a drum circle on the beach? I have gone to these before and they are really awesome and trust me your soul will love it if you let your rational brain take a back seat for a bit. 

Below I am including the Facebook link so you can also RSVP there if you like. They are starting at 4 pm but I plan to go at 5 and I also plan to get a bite to eat after before heading home if anyone wants to join me. 

Of course this is all weather dependent so please do check in before heading  out. Please read all  the info below from their site, there is a $7 fee, and bring a snack or drink to share. You do not have to have a drum you can dance if you want to but try to bring something to bang, shake or wave!  LOL

Hope to see YOU there!      Love, Cassie

*if you can not make it no need to post why we understand and will catch you another time*


https://www.facebook.com/events/1559020644425850/

Join us for the first Beach drumming event of the year!!!!
Woot woot! :)
We will be meeting at Sandy Hook State Park for a beautiful fun filled day of drumming ,dancing and going CRAZZZZZYYY on the beach! This is pre season so feel free to come earlier and enjoy the surroundings...

Location: Parking lot "E" park to the left by the building and showers,follow the sand path,we will be to the left of the walkway or sandway :)

This event is for all ages however it is suggested that children be over the age of 7 for safety reasons...delicate ear drums..Of course all children will need to be properly supervised by their parents....or....they might be EATEN for cuteness :)

So bring you Djembes,Doumbeks,Percussion instruments,hand drums,zills,scarves and beautiful selves to a day to remember of Love,light and Peace for all nations and all humanity..

Fee for this event is 7$ to cover park fees.
Since it is preseason the 15$ entrance fee is waived.

Bring: Your beautiful energetic souls
Your love of life
Your passion
and
a chair,suntan lotion,water,a hat,a light jacket,a garbage bag for your garbage that you will be leaving with,swimsuits(for the truly bold) and something to share...Some suggestions are fruit,cheeses,chips,dips,last year I bought chicken wings,some brought pizza,so whatever you'd like to share is cool :)

If anyone has a small portable table that would rock too! I have a small 30" x 30" table but two would be better as it fills up with goodies quickly :) we are bountiful :)

Rules:We don't need no stinkin rules!
********But environmentally********
1)Everything you bring in,GOES OUT with you,so please bring a small garbage bag and take it home with you:)There are No garbage cans at the park.
2)Be mindful to the rules of the park,visit their website,STAY OFF OF THE DUNES....there are many nesting birds and we don't want to disrupt their homes :)

Other than that,let's get together and DRUM BABY!!!!!!
See yawl there!
results.how_to_find_us: follow the drumming
results.name: Beach Drumming @Sandy Hook

results.description:
Welcome!

If you love to play basketball, but height is not your advantage, come out and play with people who aren't excessively tall! In the tradition of Spud Webb, anyone under 5'8", male or female, is welcome to join us on the court. We'll get some teams together and play some competitive, but relaxed bball-- and without any giant hands in our faces! :-p

We rent out the gym from 5:00-8:00pm. Please arrive at least 5-10 minutes early as the sooner everyone arrives, the sooner we can begin playing. Note that all games stop at 7:45pm as we must be out of the gym no later than 8:00pm. (If you get there late, please only ring the bell once. It is very loud! And it takes us a few minutes to get downstairs.) The gym is on the 10th fl. & has adjoining bathrooms, lockers, and water fountains.

Don't forget:


* You must be no more than 5'8" to play!

* You must RSVP on the site in order to attend!

* To be eligible to play we ask that you sign an annual waiver, which can be found here.


* If you have any problems with the prepay, just shoot one of the organizers a message. 

The Rules:

1. Play by ones and twos to 11 - win by one point.

2. Make it - take it.

3. Backcourt if the ball hits the rim or backboard. Air balls are fair game to put right back up.

4. Jump balls/disputed calls will be determined by a three pointer since the laws of basketball physics are very clear that "the ball never lies."

5. Walls, half-court line, and ceiling are out of bounds. 

6. Usually each team has 1-2 subs. Subs should enter mid-game (one of the teams reaches 6 points) and should start the following game. Teams can regulate themselves but let's just make sure everyone plays!

See you on the court! B-)

***SPECIAL NOTES***

Please do not show up unannounced (without RSVP):

This gym is small and 22 is the maximum number of players we can realistically allow. There is a waiting list if all spots have been taken. If you do show up unannounced we will have to ask you to leave. 

Refund Policy:

A refund/credit is available if you change your RSVP at least 24 hours in advance OR, if you change your RSVP within 24 hours, as long as you post a comment on the event page and someone picks up your spot (BOTH are required).

Lastly...

Feel free to bring your own basketball for shoot-around. And don't forget to clip your fingernails prior to game day. We tried playing with Edward Scissorhands once - it didn't turn out so well.

The Afterparty: 

We'll hit up McSwiggans (393 2nd Avenue @ 23rd St) later!
results.name: Indoor bball warm up & pickup games

group.name: [New York Co-Ed]  Basketball for the Vertically Challenged

results.description:
A Conversation About Happiness

Alternating Hosts: George, Priyo, & Michael Y

</a> CitiCorp Atrium Lower Level
153 E 53rd street (Between Lexington and 3rd ave)

Look for our red Meetup Sign.

Get ready to get happier simply by talking about happiness! The theory behind these events comes from a classic psychology study showing that by simply talking regularly about happiness we can become much happier.

While we'll depart from them however much we may wish, like by talking about gratitude, acts of kindness, meditation and other happiness techniques, the following list of 14 topics will serve as a backdrop for our discussions.

1. Keep busy and be more active
2. Spend more time socializing
3. Be productive at meaningful work
4. Get better organized and plan things out
5. Stop worrying
6. Lower your expectations and aspirations
7. Develop positive, optimistic thinking
8. Become present oriented
9. Develop an outgoing, social personality
10. Work on a healthy personality
11. Be yourself
12. Eliminate negative feelings and problems
13. Close relationships are the number one source of happiness
14. Put happiness as your most important priority.

Here's some background on the research our group is based on.

In 1980 three New Zealand researchers found that after eight 2-hour conversation sessions about happiness over four weeks, their subjects reported a 22 percent increase in their happiness. Continuing their twice-weekly sessions, by the sixteenth week they reported being 42 percent happier.

Our list of topics comes from Fort Myers, Florida psychologist Michael Fordyce's "14 Fundamentals of Happiness." In 1977, Fordyce pioneered the science of happiness-increase with the world's first experiment designed to boost individual happiness.

That's the group. It's important that our events be fun! So with that in mind, let's get serious about ramping up our enjoyment of life!

(photo of atrium and location of meetup table)

(photo of atrium entrance at the corner of 53rd and Lex.)


At the NE corner of 53rd and Lex., walk down wide steps (see photo) leading to lower outdoor patio. Pass entrance to the subway station on the right, and walk through the revolving door. Walk straight about 30 yards, down a few steps; the Atrium is on the left.

Resources:

For those interested in learning about the major findings from social science research about happiness, and becoming happier, here are links to several excellent peer-reviewed articles that can be downloaded as pdf files for free. (Note: Although these classic articles are somewhat dated, decades of research on happiness reveal that findings on happiness tend to be extremely stable over time.)

<a href="http://citeseerx.ist.psu.edu/viewdoc/download?doi=10.1.1.335.9655&rep=rep1&type=pdf">Pursuing Happiness: The Architecture of Sustainable Change
By S Lyubomirsky, KM Sheldon and D Schkade, 2005.  21 pages

In Pursuit of Happiness: Empirical Answers to Philosophical Questions
By P Kesebir and E Diener, 2008. 9 pages.

Subjective Well-Being: Three Decades of Progress
By E Diener, EM Suh, RE Lucas and HL Smith, 1999. 27 pages
results.how_to_find_us: At the NE corner of 53rd and Lex., walk down wide steps leading to lower outdoor patio. Pass entrance to the subway station on the right, and walk through the revolving door. Walk straight about 30 yards, down a few steps; the Atrium is on the left.
results.name: A Conversation About Happiness @ Citicorp at 53rd and Lex. - Host: George

results.description:
The first Saturday of every month we meet at 5 pm, instead of the normal weekly Saturday meeting time of 2 pm.

After our meditation program, which ends by 7 pm, we enjoy a healthy potluck dinner.  Please join us!  It's really a great way for us to get to know each other better. 

Log onto www.perfectpotluck.com to let us know what you'd like to bring. Type in Administrator: Fitzpatrick, password: Ananda. You can see what others are bringing to help you decide! Call Linda Fitzpatrick at[masked] if you have any questions or need help entering your food selection on the perfectpotluck.com site.

The potluck goes on until about 9 pm; although you can leave anytime you like.  It's all very informal and friendly.

We meet at the Wilson House of the First Baptist Church, 456 North Street (corner of Bryant Ave.) in White Plains. Email Merrill Harmin, [masked] if you have questions.

Our typical agenda:

- We orient new visitors and then chat a bit, as by sharing what's new or good in our lives.
- Then we meditate together chanting mantra followed by the beautiful sounds of a gong.
- And finally we share thoughts and questions, learning something new sometimes, generally supporting each other best we can.

The group has been meeting for some time before Meetup began. The Meetup page is not a reflection of the group's attendance as it shows only the Meetup members that are planning to attend a particular meeting. The special potluck meeting we hold the first Saturday of each month has an average attendance of about two dozen members.
results.name: American Meditation Society  - Monthly Meditation and Potluck Dinner

results.description:
How to be unconditionally happy?

A mind that is calm, without anticipation and agitation is the birth right of all individuals. A mind that is in the present moment will be happy.


What can get you to that state?

The rest you gain by reposing in yourself is deeper than the deepest sleep. The deeper your rest, the more dynamic your activity is. By being peaceful and happy you can turn your body into a power-house by generating an inner source of energy.


Meditation is simple and is a practical way to recharge and rejuvenate; empowering you to do more of the things you love.

Come join us for free guided session and experience the power of meditation.


Workshop Contents:

- Understanding the nature of the mind!
- Relaxing Breathing Techniques
- Guided Meditation
- Introduction to the Happiness Course and Sudarshan Kriya

results.name: Yogic Breathing & Meditation for Deep Stress Relief

results.description:
Join us for Target First Saturdays and enjoy engaging and eclectic free art and entertainment every month (except September), 5 to 11 p.m. BKM Café offers artist-created sandwiches, as well as salads, sweets, and a variety of beverages. Parking is a flat rate of $6 starting at 5 p.m. (All other Saturdays, we close at 6 p.m.)

Some Target First Saturday programs take place in smaller and more intimate locations, so you’ll need a ticket. Lines often form 30 minutes before ticket distribution at the Admissions Desk. Members can pick up tickets from the Membership Desk while supplies last. While we do our best to keep listings as up-to-date as possible, sometimes last-minute program changes are unavoidable.

May:

PERFORMANCE: IFETAYO YOUTH ENSEMBLE

5:00 p.m.
The young artists of Ifetayo Youth Ensemble reimagine cultural traditions through dance and drumming performances. Presented by Brooklyn Dance Festival.

CURATOR TALK

6:00 p.m.
Kevin Dumouchelle, Associate Curator, Arts of Africa and the Pacific Islands, unmasks how global African masquerade of the past, present, and imagined future reveals hidden realities about power, class, and gender. Free tickets (25) at Admissions at 5 p.m.

FILM: SHAPESHIFTERS

6:00 p.m.
Short films and a discussion cast a gaze on age-old and contemporary instances in which gender fluidity is embraced and celebrated. Presented by AFRICA'SOUT!, a cultural and activist organization founded by Kenyan artist Wangechi Mutu. Free tickets (310) at Admissions at 5 p.m.

HANDS-ON ART

6:30–8:00 p.m.
Get inspired by the masks and costumes on view in Disguise and create your own power accessory to take you into the future.

PERFORMANCE: IN TOUCH

6:30 p.m.
Djassi DaCosta Johnson performs Brendan Fernandes’s In Touch, using costume and gesture to question how we interact with art in museums.

MUSIC: JOJO ABOT

7:00 p.m.
Transcontinental artist Jojo Abot mixes Afrobeat, jazz, and electronica to sonically translate the multiple worlds she belongs to.

POP-UP GALLERY TALKS

7:00–8:30 p.m.
Enjoy ten-minute discussions about art in Double Take: African Innovations.

FILM: PARIS IS BURNING

7:30 p.m.
Paris Is Burning (Jennie Livingston, 1990, 78 min.) chronicles the ball culture of New York City’s black and Latino LGBTQ community in the late 1980s. NOTE: This film is rated R for mature content.

BOOK CLUB

8:00 p.m.
Authors Nnedi Okorafor and N.K. Jemisin read from their novels, with audio and visuals by performing arts collective Bklyn Zulu. Followed by a discussion that explores the use of speculative fiction by people with marginalized identities. Free tickets (310) at Admissions at 7 p.m.

MUSIC: DJ TUNEZ

8:00–9:00 p.m.
Brooklyn’s DJ Tunez serves up Afrobeat with a side of reggae and soca.

KIDS CORNER: STORYTELLING

8:15 p.m.
Join Brooklyn-based storyteller Gage Cook in our Education Gallery for a family-friendly and interactive evening of folktales and myths from Africa!

PERFORMANCE: LAARA GARCIA

8:30 p.m.
Laara Garcia choreographs and performs a ritual dance that activates Saya Woolfalk's artwork ChimaTEK: Virtual Chimeric Space.

VOGUE BALL

9:00 p.m.
AFRICA'SOUT! hosts a vibrant vogue ball, featuring work by multimedia artist Jacolby Satterwhite, followed by a DJ set.

results.description:
-posted by Jennifer G.-

If you want to participate next month (Sunday June 5th) in the NYC NARD ceremony, you need to RSVP and order a shirt by this Saturday, May 7th.

Ceremony participants must RSVP by joining this Facebook group: https://www.facebook.com/groups/980089042077343/

The general Facebook event page is here: https://www.facebook.com/events/739083972859808/

Organizer Mikey Dee says: "RSVP DEADLINE!  I am sending all the t-shirt size requests to the printer on Sunday May 8th! If you want to be guaranteed a shirt then I need you to RSVP before then! If you want to be a part of the ceremony, you MUST join this group (even if you already have a shirt) and RSVP by giving me the info I ask for: https://www.facebook.com/groups/980089042077343/"

Established in 2011 by the "Our Planet. Theirs Too." Foundation in New York City, The National Animal Rights Day (NARD) has become an annual tradition in cities across North America. 

On this day, we remember, and give a voice to, the billions of animals who die by human hands in this country every year.

We mourn their loss, reiterate their rights to live happy and free, and celebrate their existence in our lives.

Workers Unite Film Festival will be showing work by two NWU members: Profiled by Kathleen Foster and a trailer of The Green Book Chronicles by Calvin Ramsey.

Both films will be followed by a conversation with the filmmakers and invited guests.

results.description:
[LAST OPEN SLAM OF THIS SLAM SEASON]

5:30 PM -- Writing workshop. Come and write with us! 

6:30 PM -- Doors/signups for the slam are OPEN.

7:02 PM -- POETRY BEGINS. 5-person open mic, followed by three round, 8 poet slam. [Slam is performance poetry competition judged by audience; if you want to compete, have at least three poems of at least three minutes in duration because it is a 3-round slam. all work should be your own work. no props, costumes, animal acts, fire, backing tracks, etc.]

Come for the poems,stay for the love. Or vice versa.

$5 at the door.

Ten dollar prize for the winner of the slam.

RULES FOR THE OPEN MIC: you get 5 minutes to do whatever.


RULES FOR THE SLAM: you get 3 minutes to do 1 original piece, sans costumes, musical accompaniment, props, animals, etc. Anyone can sign up to perform; first 4 slam spots are first-come, first served; last 4 spots will be determined randomly from anyone else that wants to compete. Judges will be chosen from the audience. Top scoring poets advance to the second round and the third round. Different pieces needed for each round so bring three poems!

Any poem you slam with this month cannot be used the next time you slam with us.

Parking is free from 6 PM to 11 PM in the public lots.
results.name: May Poetry Slam @ Casa del Sol in Nyack

New York, NY">


This event is being hosted by Dave Cervini's New York Social Network and several of their partner Meet Up Groups like yours.  The number of RSVP's listed on your Meet Up Reflect only a portion of those actually attending.  If you have any questions about the event contact your host [masked]

The Kentucky Derby is known as "the most exciting 2 minutes in sports"!   Experience those 2 minutes plus a whole lot more as we get together to socialize, eat drink and watch the race live from the Churchill Downs.  We will have a special private area set aside for our members and friends.  Come for a drink, come to socialize, come to eat or all of the above.  The group will begin to gather at 5:30pm.  We will have special Kentucky Derby Ice Breakers and contests to see who can pick the winning horse!

Here is how it works:

- Arrive any time between 5:30-6pm for the contests, socializing, drinks, etc

-Stand at the bar or sit with others and order from the vast menu.  Separate checks no problem.

-The race begins around 6:30pm.

-After the race you are invited to head over to The World Bar for our New Members Welcome Party for FREE!!

The night will feature:

-Drink specials all night (Mint Julips)

-Games and prizes

-Private space for group.

Can I come alone? Yes 98% of those attending would be coming on their own.

Dress code? If you are staying out for the entire night, keep it neat otherwise if you are coming just for the race keep it casual
results.name: Kentucky Derby Party & Optional Dinner

results.description:
Chanting is used ancient cultures all over the world as a way of celebration.  The chanting that we do on Bhakti Nite is based in Sanskrit chants, which have a vibrational effect on the heart and mind.  If you enjoy music, meditation or just meeting new people come try it out.  The chants are simple and are repeated over and over so that anyone can join in, no knowledge of Sanskrit is necessary.

Cost: None, donations are happily accepted.

Bring yourself and a friend if you wish!
results.name: Bhakti Nite- Meditative Chanting (Kirtan/Satsang) at the Art of Living

Let's get together and play some board games. My husband and I have over a dozen board games. Including Betrayal, Family Business, Arabian Nights, Pathfinder, The Panda Game, Pandemic and many more. But feel free to bring your own! 

We will be hosting this at our place, and we will be providing some light refreshments and some chips. Please feel free to bring snacks for yourself or for the group, as well as anything to make you comfortable such as pillows or blankets for we will be playing on the floor. We are open to ordering pizza/tacos/whatever for those who want to chip in. 

We do own cats, if you are allergic/not cat friendly please let me know before the day of the meetup and I will do my best to accommodate you (by which I mean they will be placed in the bedroom away from everyone).

Let the games begin!
results.name: Let's meetup and play some board games!

results.description:
During weekly meetings on Saturday evenings in the East Village of New York City, Atmanivedana das (Atma) and Subhangada devi dasi (Subhie) teach how to hear and chant sanskrit names for God in kirtan and teach a systematic study the Bhagavad-gita As It Is.  Kirtan meditation consists of hearing and chanting sanksrit names for God to the accompaniment of melodious and rhythmic music in order to invoke God's divine mercy and presence.  Bhagavad-gita As It Is is studied according to the ancient, yet unbroken, chain of teachers, as taught originally by Krishna and eventually Sri Caitanya Mahaprabhu, Rupa Goswami, and more recently A.C. Bhaktivedanta Swami Prabhupada, the Founder-Acarya of the International Society for Krishna Consciousness.   

Our focus is a systematic and thematic, but not difficult to understand, study of the Bhagavad-gita As It Is.  Everyone will read verses together from the Bhagavad-gita, copies of which will be provided for attendees to reference during the meetup.  Atma and Subhie will together explain the Bhagavad-gita verses according to the ancient tradition that they have studied and lived by for almost fifty-five years, combined.  We will learn about various fascinating topics, such as karma, reincarnation, the soul, the material energy, the Supreme Soul, time, and the relationship between the soul, the material energy, and the Supreme Soul.

Hard cover copies of the beautiful Bhagavad-gita As It Is with the original 700 sanskrit verses, translations, and elaborate purports by A.C. Bhaktivedanta Swami Prabhupada, will be available for any member who might choose to take one home for a suggested donation of $10.

This meetup is intended for everyone who is interested without discrimination and regardless of one's familiarity with the subject matter.  Please come and relish this most wonderful discussion and kirtan, celebrating the glories of bhakti yoga, i.e., devotional service to God, who is known according to the Bhagavad-gita by the name Krishna.

Here is the general schedule of our meetups: we begin the evening with a kirtan that lasts about half an hour -- until about 6:00 p.m.  Then, we have a class on Bhagavad-gita As It Is, which lasts for about an hour and a half.  In the class, we will go through verses of the Gita in order, continuing from where the last class left off, with questions pertaining to those verses being encouraged throughout the class.  By about 7:30, the last kirtan begins; it lasts for about 30 minutes.  A sumptuous and nutritious vegetarian dinner is served after that.

Admission to each meetup is free.  Donations for the meetup's expenses are welcome, but not at all required!

Atma is an initiated priest who since 1990 has been studying, teaching, and living according to the teachings of the Bhagavad-gita as taught and followed by A.C. Bhaktivedanta Swami Prabhupada. After living in a monastic setting for eight years, Atma resumed his undergraduate education at Brown University, where he hosted weekly programs that focused on kirtan and Bhagavad-gita.  He then enrolled at the University of Chicago Law School from which he graduated in 2004 and from which he received a merit scholarship.  Atma practices law in courts throughout the country, with his office in Long Island, and his concentration in securities and derivative litigation.  His primary goal is to imbibe in his own life the devotional teachings of the Bhagavad-gita and to share the same with others as a humble offering to God.

Subhie has been living her life according to the teachings of the Bhagavad-gita since 1991 and is also an initiated priest.  Subhie lived in a monastic setting until 2005.   From 1991 to 2005, Subhie taught Bhagavad-gita in Croatia, Serbia, Greece, Germany, and United Kingdom.  Subhie spent several years studying Vedic knowledge in India, primarily in the holy town, Vrindavana.  After 2005, Subhie resumed her undergraduate education in religion at the University of London -- and then locally at Queens College, after she moved to New York and married Atma.  Subhie completed her Master's degree in teaching at Queens College and is a school teacher.
results.how_to_find_us: The meeting is at 26 2nd Avenue, between 1st St. and 2nd St. You can take the F train and get off at the 2nd Ave. stop (and use the 2nd Ave. exit at that station).
results.name: Bhagavad-gita Class & Kirtan @ 5:30 p.m. on Saturdays at 26 2nd Avenue, NY, NY

results.description:
Hey members, time for a spontaneous "out-of-the-box" experience should you be looking for something to do early this Saturday evening:  

We meet at 5:45pm outside the Starbucks in the heart of Sunnyside, Queens -- one of the city's most diverse neighborhoods. Sunnyside was a rural hamlet through the early 20th century and then developed pioneering and experimental garden communities.  We will stroll around these historic areas and learn about the neighborhood before the featured attraction:  a One Woman Show, "Felicitas" at the Sunnyside Reformed Church which starts at 7pm and runs until about 8:15pm.

The walking tour and theatre piece are FREE with the usual voluntary donation to your organizer.

Felicitas portrays the true American immigrant journey of Felicitas Sofer, a nurse and social worker who leaves Nazi Austria to nurture order and harmony in the lives of American mothers and infants - celebrating the love, discipline and nobility of a life in service. Libby Skala portrays the life of her great aunt in what is Part III of a trilogy about three remarkable refugee sisters. Featuring live mandolin music by Steve May. Here's a link for more details about the show:


http://sunnysidenyc.rcachurches.org/felicitas.html


Afterwards, we should have the opportunity to meet Libby and possiblyt a prominent member of the Sunnyside Gardens Prservation Alliance for an insider's perspective.  Optional dinner in the neighborhood as a group is a distinct possibility or options will be providing for exploring on your own or in a smaller group - which we may need to do on a Saturday night if we have a large turnout.


Feel free to invite a guest (+1).  If you end up on the wait list for the tour and the show interests you there should be seats for the show.

Cheers from Hank

[masked]
results.how_to_find_us: #7 train to 46th Street in Queens.  Starbucks right there at street level.
results.name: On the Sunnyside of Life:  Evening Walking Tour and Live Theatre!

Come join us for an evening of Indian Folk Dance, Indian Folk Music and More...

The following artists will perform at the festival -


Lalitha Cosme: A dancer, instructor and choreographer trained in Kathak, Odissi, Indian Folk, Ballet and Contemporary dance styles. The Lalitha Dance Troupe brings Indian Folk to the forefront, throughout the Tri-State area and beyond.

Mallakhamb Federation USA will present Mallakhamb which is a combination of Yoga, Martial Arts, and Gymnastics. Mallakhamb Federation USA is a not-for-profit organization promoting Indian Culture in the USA.

Ninaad Haarsole of Dhol Tasha has since his school days has done choreography and performed various form of dances.

Yoga by Pradnya Navalgundkar. She participated in International Yoga Day last year and at the Boston Children's Museum during the Diwali celebrations.

Somreeta Mukherjee: A software designer who works in the Finance Industry she is trained in Indian classical music and Rabindra Sangeet.

Dr. Bindeshwari Aggarwal teaches Hindi at New York University and is a famous Hindi poetess known for her satirical work. She is a member of Akhil Vishwa Hindi Samiti which hosts Hindi Poetry festivals in New York.

Neena Wahi teaches Hindi at Boston University. Born and raised in India she completed her Master's Degree from India and did Master's of Education Degree in the US. Her poems have been published in various publications including the book "Pravasini Ke Bol"  which was published in 2006. She also enjoys painting.

<a href="http://www.brownpapertickets.com/event/2525851"></a>
results.name: NINTH ANNUAL NATRAJ FOLK ARTS FESTIVAL

results.description:
All registrants must live in either Manhattan, Queens, The Bronx, or Brooklyn

Online dating is great. But how many times have you chatted with someone just to have them fade or never make plans to meet? How many dates have you had that you thought went well and then ended up confused because you never heard from that person again?

Meet other members for a brief happy hour mingle while guests arrive.  Once everyone has checked-in you'll be seated for your series of four minute "mini-dates." On your dating card that you receive at check-in, you'll select who you wish to see again. You can choose Dating or Friendship as your preferred connection.

We will collect everyone's dating cards at the end of the event and email you your mutual matches within 48 hours.

While this event is geared towards helping people meet potential romantic matches, you can also mingle with all the guests and find new friends as well.

On average, 80% of those who attend end up with at least one or two mutual matches.

* We run 3-5 Meetup Groups, plus maintain our own outside Dating Advice & Events Website. We advertise on Facebook, Twitter, Blogs, etc. Most registrations come through our outside events website, not Meetup. Therefore the number of RSVPs reflected here are NOT the total number of men or women registered.

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

PAYMENT POLICY:
$24  - PAY IN ADVANCE ONLY - WE DO NOT ACCEPT PAYMENT AT DOOR

*You must register with a valid, correct email address.

REGISTER AND PAY HERE: https://2016atwysnycspeeddating.eventbrite.com

(SEE MORE FAQ's BELOW)

ABSOLUTELY NO REFUNDS FOR LAST MINUTE/DAY OF CANCELLATIONS

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~


FAST FACTS - PLEASE READ:

*We can not accept payment at the door for these events. All registrations must be done online via the Eventbrite link below before the event. No exceptions.

*RSVPing through meetup does not guarantee admission. You must pre-pay to secure your spot in the event.

*Business casual attire requested. No sneakers, t-shirts or active wear, no ripped jeans.

*We limit our events to 12 couples/24 people. (See reason below)

*Matches are tabulated and emailed to attendees 48 hours after the event.

*Event lasts about 90 minutes give or take 10 minutes between check-in and all speeddating rounds.

*You must register with a valid, correct email address.

*There are no refunds for cancellations, late arrivals or no-shows.


OUR METHOD:

The upside of online dating is that it provides us with so many options. The downside is that people start to believe that their options are endless, which leads them to move on quickly seeking that "perfect" match.

This is where speeddating comes in. To try and combat the "shopping cart" mentality of online dating, we limit the number of attendees to 10-12 per gender.  Fewer choices to distract us means that people are more likely to make a connection. Face to face conversations result in fewer flakes. That means fewer people get put on the back burner.


FAQ'S

The Organizer RSVPD with X amount of people. What does that mean?

That number represents the RSVPS (not registrations) that have come in through our other pages listed below. It is NOT the total number of people pre-paid. The typical number of people per event is 16-20.

What should I wear?

Business casual attire is perfect. No sneakers or athletic wear, please.

What if I want to give someone my contact info at the event?

Go for it! That's the whole point. Do whatever you are comfortable doing.

Can I see photos of other attendees?

Most people do not RSVP on meetup for privacy reasons. They only pre-pay and therefore do not share their photo.

Where are all the RSVPs?

About 50% of the registrations come through Eventbrite and our main events website. They are not Meetup members. Many people prefer not to post their Meetup profile or photo for privacy reasons. We often remove the event from the calendar once it has started so that people can't contact attendees without the attendee's expressed permission.

What's The Refund Policy?

Since we need to try and ensure a gender ratio as close to even as possible, our policy is that all registrations are final. We can not offer refunds or transfers to last minute cancellations. However, if you notify us at least 3 days in advance, we can give you a credit to another event.

Can I bring a friend for moral support?

You'd be surprised how many people arrive alone. We actually prefer that guests do not bring friends or "spectators." It makes the other attendees uncomfortable. Fun fact: The people who sign up and arrive alone tend to get more matches than those who attend with friends.

Will there be equal numbers of men or women?

That's the goal. We constantly monitor registrations and amp up promotion to try and ensure and equal gender ration. Sometimes there's  more men or women. Sometimes it's even numbers. This is heavily dependent on the age range and weather. 

*This is not a guaranteed number of dates.

See other RSVPS posted on our other groups. Please note that many people opt NOT to RSVP through Meetup for privacy reasons.
results.name: City Singles  SpeedMeeting - Ages 32-47 - 2F/3M SPOTS LEFT

Lalitha Cosme: A dancer, instructor and choreographer trained in Kathak, Odissi, Indian Folk, Ballet and Contemporary dance styles. The Lalitha Dance Troupe brings Indian Folk to the forefront, throughout the Tri-State area and beyond.

Mallakhamb Federation USA will present Mallakhamb which is a combination of Yoga, Martial Arts, and Gymnastics. Mallakhamb Federation USA is a not-for-profit organization promoting Indian Culture in the USA.

Ninaad Haarsole of Dhol Tasha has since his school days has done choreography and performed various form of dances.

Yoga by Pradnya Navalgundkar. She participated in International Yoga Day last year and at the Boston Children's Museum during the Diwali celebrations.

Somreeta Mukherjee: A software designer who works in the Finance Industry she is trained in Indian classical music and Rabindra Sangeet.

Dr. Bindeshwari Aggarwal teaches Hindi at New York University and is a famous Hindi poetess known for her satirical work. She is a member of Akhil Vishwa Hindi Samiti which hosts Hindi Poetry festivals in New York.

Neena Wahi teaches Hindi at Boston University. Born and raised in India she completed her Master's Degree from India and did Master's of Education Degree in the US. Her poems have been published in various publications including the book "Pravasini Ke Bol"  which was published in 2006. She also enjoys painting.

<a href="http://www.brownpapertickets.com/event/2525851"></a>
results.name: NINTH ANNUAL NATRAJ FOLK ARTS FESTIVAL

Speed Dating seats sell out quickly - Preregister via Paypal today to ensure your seat is reserved by visiting  

</a><a href="https://www.paypal.com/cgi-bin/webscr?cmd=_s-xclick&hosted_button_id=LWZGN3X2EER9E">https://littlegaybook.com/events/lesbian-speed-datingnetworking-2/ 

How would you like to go on 30+ micro dates in one night? Oh, the possibilities! Spend your evening with me while I guide you through each round of dates.  

</a>

Join Melissa and meet some of NYC & NJ’s most eligible single women for speed dating and networking! Would you rather make friends instead? Come join the fun – there is no pressure. Make romantic, friendship, and even business connections. You can speed-date, speed-friend, or speed network!  

$20 if you preregister for a speed dating seat or 
$25 to sign up at the door (both includes entrance to our singles mixer)

and we provide you with everything you need including pen, clip board, score card and optional questions! 

ATTENTION: Speed Dating rounds start at 7pm SHARP! Arrive no later than 6:30 to receive your materials. 

$7.00 Specialty Cocktails Specials! 
$7.00 Beer!! 
$25.00 Hookah!!! 
Yummy Tapas Menu!!!! 

It’s okay if you’re feeling nervous about speed dating because I will guide you from start to finish and give you all the tools you need to succeed! 

<a href="https://www.paypal.com/cgi-bin/webscr?cmd=_s-xclick&hosted_button_id=LWZGN3X2EER9E">

Preregister now by clicking here!!

*This is not just a speed dating event - This is a singles mixer too!!*

$5.00 cover to attend mixer only 
6pm - 10pm

Don't want to speed date but still want to have fun? Join us at our singles mixer where we will drop our inhibitions and go out on a limb for love! While the women are speed dating, you can mingle with one another and see what all the speed dating fuss is about! I will be there to help break the ice and make introductions. You never know who you'll meet! Once speed dating rounds are done, we ALL GET TO PARTY TOGETHER and dance the night away! 

If you're nervous about attending a singles event, don't be! Fearless women from all spectrum of the rainbow attend my events and make fun, quality connections - Why Not You?! 

Let's dance the evening away and make lasting connections at this beautiful space tailored for a grown and sexy FUN time! 

**Free admission to our After-Party at the Legendary Henrietta Hudson!!!! What?! Password will be provided** 

How it works: 

• Rounds will last approximately 3-5 minutes depending upon the number of participants. 
• Scorecards and assigned numbers will be handed out to all speed dating participants. In addition, suggested questions  will be provided to help the tongue-tied and we encourage you to ask your own! Be creative with your questions and more importantly HAVE FUN! 
• At the end of the event submit your scorecards to Melissa. She solely will review scorecards. 100% private & confidential! Client privacy is of top concern. When two singles indicate the same level of interest toward each other (2nd date, friendship, business), we will provide each with the other’s contact information via email.

and Voila! 

This event is being cross-promoted over several meetup groups and all over Facebook. The RSVP represented here is NOT indicative of actual participation!

results.description:
Note: YorkShire Towers Location

Session #1 Sold Out & was a big Success so we've added Session #2.

At a family BBQ In 2010, 6 Teens from 2 separate families drowned to death in Louisiana's Red river. There were numerous people standing just feet away, not a single one could swim. The family's comment "None of us could swim, they were yelling, 'Help me, help me. Somebody please help me.' It was nothing I could do but watch them drown, one by one."

That same summer in NYC 7 people drowned to death 4 Adults, 3 children, all of minority descent and all too young.

• 70 Percent of African American Kids & Teens can't swim. (CDC 12')

• If a parent can't swim, there is only a 13% chance that a child in the household will swim. 

• Men are 4 times more likely to drown than women.

• The biggest reason black people give for not learning was hydrophobia "A fear of drowning". I'll let the irrationality of that one sink in.

 Be the change, be the example. Let's burn the Black people don't swim banner!

Argue with the facts all you want it doesn't change them! "I personally hate being a statistic and don't give 2 shits why people including myself can't do something. Just do it I tell myself everything else will fall into place" How about we end the cycle #NotaStatistic #BlackPeopleSwim

Black People Love Outdoors & Adventure aka me has been haggling for months and I've secured us all an amazing deal. Here's the scoop! 

5 Package of sessions @ $22 per (1 hr) lesson = $110


(Beginner Class & Intermediate Class) - (Pay using Venmo or Chase QuikPay to [masked] very easy!)

Saturdays @ 5pm. YORKSHIRE TOWERS (UES)

• 4/30/16; 5/7/16 ; 5/14/16; 5/21/16; 5/28/16(No Lesson); 6/4/16

• Sign up now limited spots!

• Great private instructors, Nice & Heated 84 deg pool, changing rooms, close to trains. 

Come June we have a Surfing Challenge; Kayaking; White water rafting; Swimming/ Beaching, Paddle boarding; Water skiing and an Open water survival techniques class, heck we'll be finding Nemo too. So Get your life!

Spot not confirmed until payment is received.

Note: As an amazing courtesy to our group you will have the chance to make up missed classes. (Max 2. Please do not abuse this!) 

Let's get wet ;-) ~ Sorry couldn't help myself..blame the Race & Sex comedy show last week.

Recap NYC swim lesson prices: 1. JCC $296 members (~9 Classes), $376 Non-members

2. Nyc Pools Membership cost $75 for 6 months/ $150/ yr. Learn to swim is a lottery System currently session already started and has a very long wait-list.

3. Flushing Meadows Pool Qns - Lottery wait list is 6-8 months long.

4. Vanderbilt YMCA Manh- $140 members (1X/wk for 8 wks), $230 Non-members (1X/wk for 8 wks) Or $235 members (2X/wk for 8 wks), $405 Non-members (2X/wk for 8 wks). Other YMCS's may have different pricing but this gives you an idea. 

5. 92St Y Manh- Lessons ~$315

Hallo everybody.  This is an informal Meetup to keep the group active.  We are not going to have any specific plan or formal introductions.  We are just going to meet at a bar in the Turtle bay area and see what happens.  Come and see who shows up and make some friends.

I have chosen the Turtle Bay area because it is located near the American Scandinavian Foundation, the Norwegian Seaman's Church, and the Swedish Seaman's Church.

We are not currently affiliated with any specific bar, so the host may or may not know the group is meeting.  We meet at the bar (literally at the physical bar in the location) and are easy to find.

Takk,

Erik
