results.description:
Take A Risk: SEX! is an experiential event where you take a risk to share and explore an aspect of your sexuality . 


When we experience ourselves as sexual beings, open to our full flow, pulsing with life energy through our body, we become more creative and feel more deeply connected to ourselves and to others. In this dynamic, interactive evening combining individual work with group process, you will learn techniques to liberate this energy and access more pleasure in your life. These techniques will be demonstrated through individual body readings with select participants who choose to take the risk of revealing a sexual issue and are willing to work through it in a supportive environment with expert guidance. 

Dr. Kincaid uses the teachings of Integral Evolutionary Tantra and the principles of Core Energetics to open up physical blocks and places where life energy doesn’t move. In Integral Evolutionary Tantric teachings and in Core Energetics -- a powerful body-based process -- sexual energy and life force energy are one and the same. Join us with body readings, deep truth, wild goodness, radical personal transformation and, if you dare, the evolution of your own personal enlightenment.

Note: This workshop is for both couples and singles. It does not include nudity or explicit sexual touch. All genders and sexual preferences welcome.

Led by Kristina Kincaid in conjunction with

The Institute of The Integral Evolutionary Tantra

Assisted by Tara Urszula Pietrzykowska

Admission: $20 

Tickets: https://www.eventbrite.com/e/take-a-risk-sex-with-dr-kristina-kincaid-tickets-24536829317

When you register or attend, please make a point to tell the facilitator that you heard about this event from the Pleasure Without Borders Meetup.


Dr. Kristina Kincaid is the Director of The Institute of Integral Evolutionary Tantra, New York City. Kristina is on faculty at The Institute of Core Energetics and holds an M.A. in Energy Medicine and a Doctorate in Theology from Holos University. She is also a graduate of the Institute of Core Energetics and Barbara Brennan School of Healing. Her journey has taken her into deep explorations and healing around sexuality. She has a healing practice in NYC.

Connect with us:

results.description:
OK, Kiddos, I've changed this meetup to mix with Tyler's Rockland 20's and 30's meetup at Stickey's they're doing today. More people more fun I figure.

Stickey's BBQ is this cool place in Hillsdale that really had trouble opening for quite a while. At one point during construction a car ran into the store! (or something like that)

It's BBQ, but they DO NOT DO GOOD RIBS, this place is not about the ribs, it's about the BRISKET. Their ribs are weird, firm and with membranes still attached; you gotta get brisket or pulled pork, we'll ask Tyler, he knows.

One really cool thing about this place is that they have these large bins where you can bring your beers and they provide the ice! Soon after writing this I'm gonna go to total wine and get some good beers. You all bring your own fancy beers, too.

I figure after that we can go bowling. Montvale lanes is one of the few bowling places that doesn't mandate ear-raping you with loud ass music on the weekend bowling hours. Or we could go to a movie, I still haven't really gone to the new Nanuet mall.

!!!DRIVING/SPOTTING!!! It's pretty simple, it's on Broadway, in the section where the Shop-Rite is. I always recommend making a left onto Broadway from Kinderkamack once you hit those Hekemian apartments and the medical building no matter where you're going in the area, I find Broadway is always faster. Going north, the place is in a strip mall on the left just before you pass the Shop-Rite

Stickey's BBQ website:

http://www.stickeysbbq.com/

http://www.stickeysbbq.com/#!menu-/czjn

results.description:
Rawiya presents In Her Absence I Created Her Image, an exhibit of documentary photography at Open Source Gallery.

In Her Absence I Created Her Image will explore the lives of communities and individuals in the Middle East through documentary photography, focusing on social, political, and human rights issues across Arab countries. At a time when Islamophobia in the U.S. runs rampant and many view the Middle East with suspicion, efforts to create understanding are of the utmost importance. This exhibit, the title of which is inspired by a poem by Mahmoud Darwish, includes work by photographers Laura Boushnak, Tanya Habjouqa, Myriam Abdelaziz, and Tamara Abdul Hadi, members of the Rawiya photography collective. Rawiya aims to dispel stereotypes about this often misunderstood and underrepresented region by shining a light on the everyday hardships and shared experiences of its inhabitants, thereby encouraging a more compassionate and empathetic worldview. Within In Her Absence I Created Her Image, individual projects and varied themes contribute to an overarching theme of humanity, dignity, and empowerment.

In I Read I Write, Boushnak delves into issues surrounding access to education, exploring the role of literacy in improving the lives of Arab women. Her photographs span across Tunisia, Yemen, Jordan, Egypt, and Kuwait, capturing arresting portraits young women for whom education is the first step in improving their lives. In Occupied Pleasures, Habjouqa explores the everyday existence of Palestinians who, with the threat of violence often overhead, seek out simple joys. Pain and pleasure are often opposite signs of the same coin and Habjouqa explores the paradoxes and humor resulting from everyday existence within a 47-year occupation. Abdelaziz strives to expose harsh child labor conditions as a result of the Egyptian economic crisis in Menya’s Kids. Her young subjects emerge in a white haze of dust from the limestone quarries that they must cut with dangerous machinery, often prone to premature death from electrocution or injury. Finally, Abdul Hadi’s Picture an Arab Man seeks to fight hypermasculine stereotypes surrounding the Arab male. Abdul Hadi provides the viewer with a portrayal of sensual beauty and vulnerability, defying the violent narrative that afflicts these men. The artists of Rawiya come together to show the world what it cannot always see: people not as caricatured victims, but intensely human, with an entire spectrum of vulnerabilities and intricacies they hold wholly their own.

Rawiya, meaning “she who tells a story,” is the first all-female photography collective from the Middle East. Members of the group include New York- and Cairo-based photographer Myriam Abdelaziz, Beirut-based photographer Tamara Abdul Hadi, Sarajevo-based photographer Laura Boushnak, and East Jerusalem-based photographer Tanya Habjouqa. As a group, Rawiya has exhibited at places such as the Empty Quarter Gallery (Lebanon), Contemporary Art Platform (Kuwait), Ernest G. Welch Gallery (USA), Bildmuseet Museum (Sweden), Modem Museum (Hungary), New Art Exchange (UK) and the Louisiana Museum (Denmark).

This exhibit is supported by the National Endowment for the Arts.
results.name: OPENING RECEPTION: In Her Absence I Created Her Image

results.description:
Exhibitionists who don't know how to draw. Artists curious about exploring public nudity. Gay/Straight. All those who seek a free and encouraging environment to explore the human form. You will learn something. You will make a friend. Come with a mind open to new experiences. This is a safe space.

No cover - Donations greatly appreciated
RSVP - space is limited

1) What IS Naked Drink n Draw?
*** It's an immersive study in figure drawing while under the influence. In short, you get naked, have some drinks, and draw each other. Sound fun? It is! I will generally start off the night as the first model. After that, we take a volunteer from the pool of artists. We'll continue to take turns as models while everyone else draws. The parlor will be set up for drawing, the work room will be set up for painting, and if enough people are in attendance, the bedroom may be made available for additional drawing space.


2) I can’t draw...
*** I can't draw either. It's not about that. Nobody's going to laugh at you if you suck. You could be god awful, but you may find you're better than you think. I can guarantee you won’t be the only shitty artist in the room. Besides, the only way to improve is with practice, and what better way to learn?!

3) Are the drawings judged?
*** There will be a period at the end to critique each others' work, but nobody has to participate. No obligations to share your work. If you are comfortable with your work being photographed, I would like to post it on the group pages.

4) How much is it?
*** It’s free! Of course, tips are greatly appreciated for snacks and supplies. It's normally $20 each but, if you can't afford it, we won't let that keep you from participating. it's called "struggling artists" for a reason.

5) Can I model?
*** You are more than welcome to model. Take turns! Ideally, if we're all naked, we all stand an opportunity as model if we so desire. The only rule I have is you must be nude to pose. That is sort of the point, after all.


6) What do I bring?
*** Bring supplies and booze. I will provide some supplies for those without, but I'm afraid I can not supply free booze. But hey, tip generously and I'll think about it ;P

7) Can I take photos?
*** Nope. You can draw pictures, but you can’t snap them. Why, you might ask? It's kinda creepy, in a room full of naked strangers, to pull out your camera. Even if you ask, putting one "No" on the spot in a room full of "Yes" is the sort of intimidation and alienation I'm hoping to avoid. Respect this rule, please. Don't be a creep.

8) Who can come?
*** Anyone! with some conditions
-If I do not know you, and we have never spoken, shoot me a message first.
-If you want to bring a guest or three, let me know.
-If you want to come but not get naked, you better be the life of the party.


9) Anything else I should know?
***This is a safe space with supportive people and a free and encouraging energy. While people will be naked, don't just assume that's license to read someone's ass like it's brail. Please be respectful, consensual adults. If you start to creep people out, you leave. Also, please be quiet in the stairwell. My neighbors are real sweet people, you guys.

10) Where is it?
*** Ocean ave at Parkside Ave in Brooklyn. Parkside ave Q stop. Three buildings from the subway, on Ocean, across from the park.

11) My boyfriend is not comfortable with me coming to this thing. Is this a sex party?
*** This is my home. Keep sexpectations to a minimum, and know the line between sex and sexy. We also have couples come to every event. If your significant other is jealous, bring them! That said, if anything grows while you pose, don't sweat it. Appreciate it.

12) How many people will be there? Will it be crowded?
*** I'm saying maximum capacity is 30. Won't be crowded.

13) What kind of poses are we doing?
*** ENTIRELY up to you. You can go anywhere from Venus De Milo modesty to spred out and comfy. We're just naked people sketching naked people. For the first few hours we'll be working with short poses. After that we'll move on to longer poses. You can do couple/group long poses or individual 10 minute poses.
If you have questions feel free to call or text me at[masked]

Please read carefully: This event is being sponsored by Dave Cervini's newyorksocialnetwork.com and several of their partner Meet Up groups.  The number of people registered on this Meet Up represent only a portion of those actually attending. If you have any questions or want to know how many are attending please contact the event host at [masked].

The New York Social Network (NYSN) has been planning events in and around the city since 2004!  There is something to choose from almost every night and several options each weekend!  It can be hard to figure out which ones may be best for you, especially if you have never been out before.

If you are new to the group or a long time member, this is a fun night to meet others and find out what what we have planned in the coming months. NYSN founder Dave Cervini will be on hand with our staff to welcome all New Members and introduce you to our long time members.  You will enjoy drink specials,  complimentary hot and cold appetizers and lot's of room to socialize network and connect.

This will also be a great opportunity to see what we have in store for 2016.

The World Bar is a nice lounge with lot's of room to sit or wander around while meeting others.

Other Meet Up and Social Networking groups/organizations often invite their members so you also get to network with people from similar groups.

The night will include:

- Complimentary hot and cold appetizers until 9pm

- Drink specials until 9pm

- Music played at conversational levels

Can I come alone? Yes, 95% of those attending tend to come on their own.

What to expect: 60-80 people fairly even split of men and women ages 20's -40's, singles and some couples. Most are there to network and connect.

What to wear: trendy, neat, business casual

How do I get there? take any of the green line trains to 42nd Grand Central or 51st street. Then a short walk towards the East River

How long does it go?  We usually start breaking up around 11:30-Midnight

General Admission is $10.00 Please bring exact change at the door.

Once again, this event is being promoted by several Meet Up groups and www.newyorksocialnetwork.com.  There will be tons of people attending.  If you have any questions you can contact the event organizer directly at [masked] or call[masked]

results.description:
The wildly fun Dave Eisenstadter will be calling a lively program of contras accompanied by The Contrapolitans, CDNY's all-volunteer orchestra!

The Contrapolitans are: 

Linda Haelters, Flute

Rachel Givner, Clarinet

Jonathan Brandt, Oboe

Matthew Christian, Fiddle

Meghan McKay, Fiddle

Jake Moskowitz, Banjo

Trudy Williams, Bass

John Allgood, Mandolin

Paul Morris, Guitar

Anne Marie Edden, Piano

Penny Jones, Percussion

Come dance to a live caller and band with Country Dance New York.  We are an intergenerational, multiethnic, smoke and alcohol free, inclusive community with one thing in common:  we love to contra and English country dance! 

Contra dance is a high energy American folk dance accompanied by live string music and taught by a caller.  No partner or experience required.  All dances are taught in advance and the figures are easy to learn.

Please bring a pair of clean, soft soled shoes {no spike heels} to dance in, and a water bottle.  We ask that you not use strongly scented grooming products as the smell can become overwhelming on the dance floor when things start to heat up. 

Country Dance New York has been hosting contra dances most Saturdays, and English country dancing most Tuesdays, at Church of the Village for almost 70 years.   COV is located at 201 W. 13 St., on the northwest corner of 7th Avenue.  

Beginners' session on Saturdays {for contra} is from 7:30 to 8:00.  Dancing for all from 8:00 until 10:45.  Hang out with us at a local diner after the dance.

Beginner's session on Tuesdays {for ECD} is from 7:00 to 7:30.  Dancing for all from 7:30 to 10:30.

Cost:  $15 for general public; $12 members and for full time students with ID.  Be sure to tell the people at the door if this is your first time dancing with us.  They will give you a free pass to return as our guest!

To see what contra dancing looks like, click here:

http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=mM5vNzFxxBs 

To see what English country dancing looks like, click here:

http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=rB40AvJnMUY 

Join us on Facebook:  https://www.facebook.com/groups/2449906414/

For a complete schedule of our upcoming season, and for more information, visit our website.

See you on the dance floor!

SWING REMIX


SATURDAY May 7th, 2016


The Blue Vipers of Brooklyn


plus Special Guest Vocalist Vanessa Raci


DJ Ryan Swift

Our Third Dance Party of our SPRING season will feature for their Fifth time appearing with us - The Blue Vipers! The Blue Vipers of Brooklyn are an acoustic Dixieland, early swing, gospel and blues band, composed of homemade washboard percussion, upright bass, resonator guitar, trumpet with the occasional addition of violin/fiddle & tenor saxophone. Their repertoire of witty songs with moving yet often bawdy lyrics and catchy 4 part vocal harmony always draw large crowds.

PRE-DANCE WORKSHOPS


6:30 – Connection Is For Winners Swing Workshop*


Dive into the details of partner dancing through connection. Smooth out your dancing through exercises and moves that celebrate flow.


Gaby Cook & Bobby White

7:30 – The Creative Partner Lindy Hop Workshop*


Learn how to work with your partner as a co-creator of ideas. Through observation learn how to sync up with your partner's ideas and create great phrases together!


Gaby Cook & Bobby White

DANCE TIMELINE


7:30 General Admission Doors Open


7:45 BEGINNER Dance Lesson (FREE with dance admission)


8:30 LIVE MUSIC & SOCIAL DANCING


10:45 Dance Performances, Announcements, Give Aways


11:00 LIVE MUSIC & SOCIAL DANCING


1:00AM END


All Ages

Tickets: $16 early bird (Thursday before event) / $18 Door


*specialty dance workshops extra

Notes on our teachers:


Bobby White is known worldwide for his individual dance style, expressive teaching methods, and floppy hair.

He is a passionate dancer of Balboa, Lindy Hop, and Solo Jazz and has won many national and international championship placements in those dances, which he teaches all over the world. His welcoming nature and humorous personality are complemented by his passion for the dance and in-depth instruction.

http://bobbykate.com/about-us

Gaby is an internationally-renowned dancer and instructor who loves all things Swing. Her unique style of movement balances power and dynamism with clarity and razor sharp turns. She brings great care to lines, shapes and balance in her personal performance, as well as her choreographic work. She holds 1st place titles in lindy hop, balboa and solo jazz from events such as International Lindy Hop Championships (2012), Stompology (2012), Ultimate Lindy Hop Showdown (2011), Lindy Focus (2013), Lonestar Championships (2012) and Balboa Rendezvous (2009). She is a strong supporter of female-dance traditions and has worked over the last 7 years to create and foster growth for Chorus Girl Troupes. She is passionate about lindy hop traditions and works to share the joy of swing with new audiences.

http://gabycook.com/about

results.description:
Blind sailors race across open water learning not to fear what cannot be seen, on boats or on land. Life turns unpredictable as the wind when one of them gains something different than a trophy and must learn to live and to sail with new sensibilities. Highlighting Ability, not disability, this 54 min documentary tells the remarkable story of four individual who share a unique bond - each is vision Impaired and striving to race in Japan's 2013 Blind Sailing World Championship while navigating all the other challenges in life. They are diverse in backgrounds, age and skill but all share a passion to excel and find camaraderie and community. Produced over 6 years, Sense The Wind was recently competed and has begun it's festival and outreach preview phase. This film is suitable for all ages, Junior sailors and families are encouraged to come. The response from our outreach preview screenings across the board has been fantastic. It is already becoming an engaging tool to spread awareness and illustrate what is possible to achieve. We are eager to share the film with a broad audience to inspire and promote inclusion. Trailers of the film and information may be seen on the film website home page: http://www.sensethewind.com. And please visit and like our FaceBook page: https://www.facebook.com/STWChristine/
$10.00

results.description:
Single? New in town? Just looking to get out and meet new people?

Join us for our multi-group member happy hour! ATWYS along with New York Social Network organizes a monthly Saturday night get together for all of our new and existing members.

If you are new to our Meteup group or a long time member, this is a fun night to meet others and find out what what we have planned in the coming months. Event Host, New York Social Network  founder Dave Cervini will be on hand with our staff to welcome all New Members and introduce you to our long time members.  You will enjoy drink specials,  complimentary hot and cold appetizers and lot's of room to socialize network and connect.

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

All ATWYS members who pay in advance for this event will receive a promo code for $7 off a speeddating event as well as $5 off our Mix & Mingle Happy Hour. Please be sure to check your eventbrite order confirmation for the promo codes to use to redeem your discount.

$10 in advance only

Prepay here: http://atwys2013member.eventbrite.com/

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~


The night will include:

-complimentary hot and cold appetizers until 9pm

-Drink specials until 9pm

Can I come alone? Yes, 95% of those attending tend to come on their own.

What to expect: 60-80 people fairly even split of men and women ages 20's -40's, singles and some couples. Most are there to network and connect. 

What to wear: trendy, neat, business casual

How do I get there? take any of the green line trains to 42nd Grand Central or 51st street. Then a short walk towards the East River

How long does it go?  We usually start breaking up around 12:30-1am.

results.description:
Full-Field Soccer - 11 v 11 - Large Goals - Beautiful Turf Field - Friendly but competitive game. 

RSVP's open 3 Days before the Meetup at 8:00pm - 


RSVP's close at 6:00pm the night of the game.

I am not reserving 2 spots per game for any new players who have not played with us yet.

Main goal is the have fun, play hard, and have a good time. 

Game Time Officially Starts at 8:15. If you are not on the field ready to play, or are literally changing to play, your spot MAY BE GIVEN AWAY to a member on the wait list if they show up.

(1) we are keeping an 11 v 11 game, with 1 substitute per side; rotating new players in every 10 minutes.

(2) Please only RSVP if you will come. No shows ruin the game for everyone on the field, as well as those who would have come and played in your spot.

(3) Games will be 40-45 minute halves; switching sides at the break. 

• If you are on the wait list and come to the field, and a no show occurs, by 8:15 you will be given their spot.

Fee is $4.00 for the night - Payment will be taken at Half-Time. Please have cash available to pay. If you do not have cash, please go to the ATM prior the game. All players will receive a 1-time exception.

results.name: North Jersey Chorus Concert: Pro tenor & a choreographer/dancer guest artists

venue.name: Van Riper Ellis Broadway Baptist Church

results.description:
Yet another NON-TENNIS event..... 

THE NORTH JERSEY CHORUS, a 50-member mixed choral group, originated in 1948.   If you're a music-lover, this will be a very INTERESTING spring concert with 2 professional guest artists....

CIARAN SHEEHAN - Dublin born, Ciaran Sheehan is an acclaimed actor, singer who has many professional credits, most notably playing the role of The Phantom in "The Phantom of The Opera" for over 1,000 performances on Broadway and in Toronto.  Ciaran sang the National Anthem at the inauguration of NY Governor George Pataki and was a soloist at the funeral service for Beau Biden.  Ciaran will sing a few pieces with the chorus in addition to performing several solo selections.

SCOTT SCHNEIDER - a professional choreographer/dancer - will perform an original dance to one of the chorus' selections.

Hope you can come hear us sing and ENJOY our fabulous guest artists.

results.description:
Prepay required HERE 

This event is being co-organized with Let My People Go 

JEWISH Males ages: 27-43 
JEWISH FEMALES:  25-39 


Cost: $35.75 - $40.75 

Part 1-

Informal mingle to meet others attending and make some new friends as our host introduces you to others during this group aspect of the event . 

Part 2- Up to 15 connections in one night, each lasting 4-6 minutes long.  After each round, you will circle yes or no on your scorecard as to whether or not you would be interested in corresponding with that person further.

Part 3- Everyone is welcomed to stay and mingle get to know each other more.  Besides meeting potential people for romance potential, many attendees have made some terrific new friends and business potentials. 

At the end of the evening you will turn in your scorecard for us to tally.  The next morning you will receive an email letting you know who you matched with.  The email will provide you with the person's first name and email address and they will get your first name and email address.  We even let you know the one way matches (they picked you, but you didn't pick them), just in case you change your mind.

Prepay required HERE

Entered by: Jay Rosensweig

Presents

BOLLYWOOD BEATS

Desi Saturdays is one high society DesiParty. Wow factor everywhere. Beautiful people, beautiful venue, beautiful ambiance, and did we mention beautiful people? High energy, amazing music and a packed house are just some of the traits of what you would expect at this weekly desiparty.

This event is the talk of the town amongst young socialites. So don your best, and you may just be lucky enough to party out on Saturdays Nights at Lexicon!!

results.description:
Please be there on time so you can get set up, and bring a white and a red t-shirt.

If this game is full click here for our calendar and see other game slots!

Thank you,

Paul

Details Below:

------------------------------------------------------

Game style and Rules:

1. HAVE FUN!!! It's SOCCER :)

2. We'll play (2) 30-minute games.

3. We will divide into teams based on everyone's experience and skills.

4. No ball hogging.

5. Please use turf shoes or sneakers. You will not be allowed to play with cleats.

6. The games are very laid back; rough play, tackles or sliding are not allowed and will not be tolerated.

7. We'll play with corner kicks and ground kick-ins and pop-up goals.

8. If you arrive late to the game, you would have to wait until the game in progress is finished to join your team. Inserting people in the middle of the game disrupts the flow of the game, and it's not fair to players that arrived on time.

Field Location:The field is located on 173 West 108th street , The entrance gate is located on west 108th street and Manhattan ave.

Check the MTA's website for any service changes: www.mta.info

Time: Please be there 15 minutes earlier so we can get set up.

Late arrivals:

If you arrive late to the game, you would have to wait until the game in progress is finished to join your team. Inserting people in the middle of the game disrupts the flow of the game, and it's not fair to players that arrived on time.

Fee:

Please pay the fee through paypal. Part of the proceeds go to NYC SOCCER KIDS (we already donated new soccer balls). It also goes to pay for the site admistration, meet-up fees, cones, soccer balls, and the new goals.

Please bring:

A white t-shirt and a red t-shirt to differentiate players of each team. The filed is turf so please bring turf shoes, sneakers or all terrain shoes; cleats are not allowed!

Cancellations/Refunds:

If you won't be able to make it to the game, please change your RSVP to "NO" 48 hours before kickoff time to receive a full refund. This is done to give other members a chance to take your spot. Thank you!

Waiting List: If all the spots are taken, please get on the waiting list. If a spot opens up and you are on the waiting list, you will be sent an automated e-mail letting you know that a spot has just openned :). If this game is full click here for our calendar and see other game slots!

Weather Policy: Games will be cancelled if the weather conditions are severe such as snow, sleet or thunderstorms. If the game is cancelled I will send out an e-mail the morning of the game. Please check your e-mail. If you are unsure, or can't get to your e-mail, you can also text me or call me at[masked]-5725.

See you on the field.

Paul.

results.description:
THE GAME

Informal Meet Up. 8 vs 8, no subs. No Permit. Be warned - there may or may not be a permitted event at the location which could cancel our game.

This game is ideally for intermediate to advanced players, not for beginners.

RSVP opens on Friday at 8:30am and closes at 9pm on Saturday evening.

RSVP GUIDELINES. IMPORTANT:

- If you RSVP and don't show, you'll be benched from this group for the next two weeks. 

- Rmbr, it's a early morning game. Therefore, if you can't make it, change your RSVP well BEFORE Saturday 9pm to give enough notice for anyone on the waitlist. Changing your RSVP after 9pm will also mean a 2 weeks ban.

- If you turn up late and the game has already started with 16 players, then you won't play.

Absolutely no exceptions to these rules.


PLAY GUIDELINES

- No slide tackles.

- Respect your teammates and opponents.

- If you fight, you will be banned from the group, permanently.

- If you dribble more than you pass - you annoy everybody and will be banned from the group.

POSITIONS:

Being a pick up game, there are no permanent positions. If you've been playing forward for half the game and someone who's been playing the back line wants to play up front, give up your position and play some defense. When your team lose the ball, don't just stand and watch. Please support your teammates by get back on your side and play some defense.

Thanks.

**INJURIES & DISCLAIMER**:

Group Organizer(s) and Group Organization Assumes NO Risk Or individual Liability For Personal Injuries Incurred By Members/Players On The Field Or During Any Of Our Activities: Pick Up Games, Or Other Events. By Agreeing To Play, You Are In Receipt Of This Information, And Thereby Warrant That You Are In Good Health And Assume Personal Responsibility For ALL Physical And Accidental Risks Involved With Playing In Our Group, Including But Not Limited to Falls, Injuries, Contact With Other Players, and Field Conditions.
results.name: Sunday at McLaughlin park 8:00 AM

results.description:
Hello Mums - join us in this fun, invigorating early morning workout with Personal Trainer - Andra Roig. Set in the beautiful Arthur Ross Pinetum (entrance at 85th & CPW)this weekly get together is just $20 and a great opportunity to meet other Mums, get your heart-rate up and have a laugh! Its early so that we can get back to our loves and get to that hearty brunch ;-)

All levels of fitness are welcomed and included - even if you haven't worked out for a while don't be put off, we've all been there. He will push you to just the right level but this is not Military Fitness so give it a try! Andra will work with each individual giving dedicated guidance and support to increase your fitness levels. He uses great equipment including battle ropes, TRX bands and kettle bells to make the work out varied and interesting. Please check out his website www.roigragefitness.com and get in touch with him prior to joining so he can add you to the weekly announcement messages.

I look forward to meeting anyone who fancies joining!
results.name: Brit-Mums Sunday Central Park Workout 8-9am. $20

results.description:
PLEASE READ!!!

It is getting nice out. We are getting a lot more people showing up than usual. For that reason we have added an earlier game to allow everyone who can only play on Sunday to have a decent game.  Please do not RSVP for both games and decide to show up whenever. If you are going to RSVP for the early game, please be on time. The game will start at 8:30 sharp and we will play 2 (30 min) periods. You may decide to stick around for the second game if all the slots were not filled. 

DONT FORGET to bring a white t-shirt under your regular shirt. That will allow us to easily form teams. 

Turf shoes and cleats are both allowed but you all should know that we play on turf field. As usual no slide tackle allowed.

Have fun and enjoy the game

Come join us for outdoor tennis at Washington Park in Union City, which is off of the 9th Street light rail station. Bring your sweats, your racquet, plenty of water and balls and we'll see you there! As this event is not designed to match up folks, courts are assigned on first-come first-served basis. So get in early and grab a court.

You can find each other in the waiting area and/or looking on the courts. It would help if you make a mental note of the profile picture of those attending.


Although we won't enforce attendance, it would be polite to attend if you commit because others are looking to find others to hit with.

Cross your fingers that it won't rain as inclement weather cancels the meetup.

If you have any questions, feel free to email the organizer.

results.description:
This event is proudly brought to you by Soccer Beyond!

Learn more on SoccerBeyond.com or Facebook.com/SoccerBeyond.

Details - Fun, interactive, effective.

90min. This is a Coed Soccer Lesson. Please bring a ball if you have. Sneakers, running and turf shoes are fine. Bring some water or sports drink and maybe sun blocker. Please note our Waiver of Liability and 24hr Cancellation Policy below. More details follow.

Rain or Shine - If you don't hear from us, the session is on!

Our sessions will be held as scheduled if weather allows. Thunder or snow and ice are among the reasons for sessions to be canceled/ moved. BUT: Don't make assumptions - you will always get notified if a class is canceled/ moved. As the weather changes quickly in NYC, occasionally we may make the final decision about 90min prior to session start. If you don't hear from us, the session is on!

Cancelled/ Moved Sessions - You will always get notified!

Every time we have to cancel a session, if possible, we move it to the same day and time of the following week. In this case, all players keep their spots. Please email us prior to the rescheduled event, if you can't make and wish a refund or credit. The 24 hours cancellation policy applies. You will always get notified if a class is canceled/ moved.

Requesting a Refund

To request a refund 1) change your status to "not going" and 2) send us a note with the Paypal transaction number related to the payment for the respective session. Refunds are processed once a week - please be patient.


24 Hours Cancellation Policy

A full refund/ credit will be given if cancellation is received at least 24 hours prior to lesson start. Full payment is required thereafter. Our cancellation policy also applies to package holders.


Waiver of Liability and Hold Harmless Agreement

By RSVP'ing for this event you certify that you are physically fit such as you are able to participate in this program. You therewith voluntarily release CoachFrankNYC/ Soccer Beyond, LLC from any and all liability resulting from or arising out of your participation and/ or receipt of instruction. You read and agree to the WAIVER OF LIABILITY AND HOLD HARMLESS AGREEMENT to be found on SoccerBeyond.com/pages/waiver.

Please let us know if you have any questions or suggestions.

Coach Frank  
M. [masked]

Feel free to like us on http://www.facebook.com/SoccerBeyond.

results.description:
Let's head out for a MidPackers Long, Slow Distance (MPLSD) Run.

**Special Start and Finish this week: We'll meet at 9am near the Parkside Ave. Q train station--just across the street on the corner of Parkside Ave. and Ocean Ave., near the entrance to Prospect Park!**


Details:
There will be several pace groups, depending on who attends. Typically we have 8-minute, 9-minute, and 10-minute-per-mile groups. Please let your leaders know which group you'll be running in! We'll run the last 7 miles of the Brooklyn Half Marathon, then back up to Parkside Ave. There are many subway stations along the way in case you'd rather run a shorter distance. Just bring your Metrocard!

Watch the comments section for details about this week's MPLSD, including route, total distance and any other specifics that you'll need to know. Please make sure you are able to run the posted distance, and familiarize yourself with the posted route map. This is for your safety and to help keep the group moving at a consistent pace. It's a good idea to bring your Metrocard and some cash in case you need to cut the run short.

IMPORTANT: Be sure to bring along any fluids and/or nutrition you may need to successfully complete this distance as we'd like to make minimal stops. This is for your health, safety, and comfort.

- - - - - -  
Please see our full calendar of events 
http://www.woodsidesunnysiderunners.com/events/calendar/
connect with us on Google+ 
http://www.google.com/+WoodsideSunnysideRunners
like us on Facebook 
https://www.facebook.com/WoodsideSunnysideRunners
and follow us on Instagram 
https://instagram.com/woodsidesunnysiderunners/

results.description:
Konnichiwa minna-san!

(こんにちはみんなさん！)

My name is Kaze Iwa (AKA Hayashi-San), and I've stepped up to be organizer of Japanese Language Meetup Group to help relieve the load of our beloved organizer Yoihojo who is super busy (isogashii 忙しい) ! 


Quick introduction: I was founder and organizer of Mandarin Mondays Chinese Language Meetup Group and also have access to many venues, which can be helpful experience for our group.  I took a year or two of Japanese in college, and can say that I am novice of novices, with lots to learn - I'm expecting to go to Japan for the first time later this year expanding an online business based in mobile & technology, and excited!

Apologies: My apologies ( gomen nasai ごめんなさい) for the lack of group activity this winter and early spring, but let's kickoff spring the right way with the 10th Annual Japan Day in Central Park!


http://www.japandaynyc.org/


*Please RSVP, and spread the word the the right positive people who have interest in Japanese language and/or culture, and we can keep you posted on any updates within the next five days leading up our meetup!

Meeting place: We will be gathering at the Tea (Ocha) Tent from 9:30AM - 10:00AM which is near Okonomiyaki & Ramen Tents, as well as near the volunteers & restrooms near the south side of the festival! If you can only come later, we will be there all day, please text me[masked] directly to meetup!


Note: Brown Rice Family is #1 world roots band and will be performing at 3PM - I know one of the band members Richardson-san whose multicultural and multidimensional musical genius has been covered in mainstream US and Chinese/Japanese media, and who speaks good Japanese and has been known to surprise Japanese tourists as a street musician with nostalgic tunes! =)  I will try to create an opportunity for us to meet him at one point during Meetup or later!

Lastly below are rules for the festival unfortunately that is best for us to follow so we represent well!


**********


Shows are RAIN or SHINE.

Admission is first come first served for free events. Admission to the venue closes for the remainder of the event once capacity is reached.

The following cannot be brought into the Central Park venue: glass bottles, cans, coolers, folding chairs, bikes, rollerblades, scooters, skateboards, beach umbrellas, video cameras, selfie sticks, musical instruments, professional camera gear or pets.

Strollers are prohibited in the venue.

We aren't responsible for prohibited items left outside the venue.

Bags are subject to search.

Alcoholic beverages are forbidden in NYC Parks & the distribution/sale of unauthorized materials is banned. 

Factory sealed plastic water bottles and refillable bottles are allowed into the Central Park venue.

Smoking is prohibited in all NYC parks.

First-come, first-served limited seating will be offered.

**********


Have any general feedback? Feedback is WELCOME for our future direction of our community, but we generally need to go with what the majority of people in our community want, so can not guarantee anything, until we have a general consensus about things!


************


With all this said....ikimashou!

Thanks,

Hayashi-San

results.description:
Please read carefully: This event is being hosted by Dave Cervini's  newyorksocialnetwork.com and several of their partner Meet Up groups.  The number of people you see registered on your Meet Up represent only a portion of those actually attending. If you have any questions or want to know how many are attending from all groups please contact the event host at [masked]

A great present for your mom!!! Enjoy a fun and relaxing day out of the city! The Hudson Valley is America’s oldest wine making and grape-growing region.  Less than an hour and a half from New York City, a visit to to the Hudson Valley Wineries and wine trails offers hospitable winery tasting rooms, where you can often meet the owners and taste award-winning wines made from classic European varieties, regional hybrids and even delicious fruit wines. Join us for this fun day where you will enjoy a spectacular spring day out of the city, taste great wines and meet a fun group of NYSN members and friends.

-You will start your day with the beautiful train ride on Metro North from Grand Central alongside the Hudson.  Along the way you will be treated to spectacular views of the Hudson Valley. You may also drive or meet the group there if you live north of the city. 

Please contact [masked] to make arrangements.

-Your guide will meet you in Poughkeepsie then bring you to several local wineries including one that the group will sit and eat lunch at.

-We will also have a chance to stop at a local farm stand for those who would like to bring home some fresh fruits and veggies.

$55 includes: Transportation from train to all wineries and attractions. (Wineries will likely include many of the following: Robibero, Nostrano, Benmarl, Stoutridge and White Cliff ) Since everyone will not be drinking, winery fee's are not included. Some wineries are free and some charge $6-$8 for a flight of samples (5-6 samples at each depending on the winery).

What to bring:

-bag lunch

-Dress for the weather.  Casual and comfortable.

-a large backpack or bag if you wish to bring home vegetables from local farm stand or bottles of wine. 

Can you come alone?  Yes 98% of those attending will be on their own. 

What to expect: 8-14 fun and friendly people 

Who is the host:  Dave Cervini 

What is not included? Lunch, train fare, winery fee's (budget $12- $18 if you plan to drink at more than 3 wineries) tips for the servers (optional)

When we are finished, your guide will bring you to the Poughkeepsie train station for the relaxing ride home.

We go rain or shine. Estimated return time to Poughkeepsie train will be 5:50pm.
results.name: Mothers Day Hudson Valley Spring Wineries Day Trip: 5 Wineries, Awesome Views

results.description:
Please be there on time so you can get set up, and bring a white and a red t-shirt.

If this game is full click here for our calendar and see other game slots!

Thank you,

Paul

Details Below:

------------------------------------------------------

Game style and Rules:

1. HAVE FUN!!! It's SOCCER :)

2. We'll play (2) 30-minute games.

3. We will divide into teams based on everyone's experience and skills.

4. No ball hogging.

5. Please use turf shoes or sneakers. You will not be allowed to play with cleats.

6. The games are very laid back; rough play, tackles or sliding are not allowed and will not be tolerated.

7. We'll play with corner kicks and ground kick-ins and pop-up goals.

8. If you arrive late to the game, you would have to wait until the game in progress is finished to join your team. Inserting people in the middle of the game disrupts the flow of the game, and it's not fair to players that arrived on time.

Field Location:The field is located on 173 West 108th street , The entrance gate is located on west 108th street and Manhattan ave.

Check the MTA's website for any service changes: www.mta.info

Time: Please be there 15 minutes earlier so we can get set up.

Late arrivals:

If you arrive late to the game, you would have to wait until the game in progress is finished to join your team. Inserting people in the middle of the game disrupts the flow of the game, and it's not fair to players that arrived on time.

Fee:

Please pay the fee through paypal. Part of the proceeds go to NYC SOCCER KIDS (we already donated new soccer balls). It also goes to pay for the site admistration, meet-up fees, cones, soccer balls, and the new goals.

Please bring:

A white t-shirt and a red t-shirt to differentiate players of each team. The filed is turf so please bring turf shoes, sneakers or all terrain shoes; cleats are not allowed!

Cancellations/Refunds:

If you won't be able to make it to the game, please change your RSVP to "NO" 48 hours before kickoff time to receive a full refund. This is done to give other members a chance to take your spot. Thank you!

Waiting List: If all the spots are taken, please get on the waiting list. If a spot opens up and you are on the waiting list, you will be sent an automated e-mail letting you know that a spot has just openned :). If this game is full click here for our calendar and see other game slots!

Weather Policy: Games will be cancelled if the weather conditions are severe such as snow, sleet or thunderstorms. If the game is cancelled I will send out an e-mail the morning of the game. Please check your e-mail. If you are unsure, or can't get to your e-mail, you can also text me or call me at[masked]-5725.

See you on the field.

Paul.

results.description:
Special Mother’s Day Event: Tara Puja

The Tara Puja, Liberation from Sorrow, which includes a special prayer, Praises to the Twenty-one Taras, composed by Buddha, is performed regularly at Kadampa Buddhist centers worldwide.  Tara is a female Buddha, a manifestation of the ultimate wisdom of all the Buddhas.  Temporarily Tara saves us from the dangers of rebirth in the three lower realms, and ultimately she saves us from the dangers of samsara and solitary peace.<a href="http://meditatenj.org/newsite/wp-content/uploads/2014/11/Tara.gif"></a>

If we rely upon Mother Tara sincerely and with strong faith she will protect us from all obstacles and fulfill all our wishes. Since she is a wisdom Buddha, and since she is a manifestation of the completely purified wind element, Tara is able to help us very quickly.

As a community we will recite the twenty-one verses of praise receiving inconceivable benefits. These praises are very powerful because they are Sutra, the actual words of Buddha. It is good to recite them as often as we can.

Everyone Welcome.  No previous meditation experience necessary. You may bring an offering of (vegetarian) food or (non-alcoholic) drink if you wish.

Free event
results.how_to_find_us: Meditatenj.org

DESCRIPTION:
We will make our way to the top North Mountain and continued through to Stoppel Point. We will walked into a small saddle for a short distance until we started up toward the top of Stoppel Point. Once we are on top, we will decided to look for the view point facing north which brought around the top of the mountain onto a plane crash. After a short stay at the plane we turn around and started back. A hundred feet from the crash site we stopped at a small view to view the Blachkhead Mountain range to our north.

We will make our way back to North Mountain where we took a brief moment for snacks then started off the ledges back toward the car.

results.description: service at North Church Queens starts at 10 am and goes till 11 am. then there is fellowship which i like to call snacks and a low key party. the gardens are beautiful to visit. the bible is read by someone in the congregation. passages are the same for many of the churches regardless of the denomination- some set calendar thing that many Christian Churches go by. we sing some songs which is fun cause our organist really rocks! then there is the sermon which are most often, very interesting. we say some prayers, get forgiven for our sins~ as we forgive others who sin against us. communion is every first sunday. it is bread and grape juice in those individual small plastic shot glass type things.

results.description:
Hi there! I started this group last year, and I want to keep it going, as sharing meditation with others is my passion. We'll meet Saturdays and Sundays at 10am under the big shady tree at the Great Hill in Central park (the entrance is Central Park west and 103rd street). Take the path leading into central park, and go left (up the slope) until you get to the clearing at the top of the hill. If it's rainy or bad weather, I won't be there, but if the suns out, you can find me under the hill. I will let the group know ahead of time if I have to cancel in advance. The session starts 10am, running till around 10:45 or 11am. Bring a towel to sit on, and some water to drink. Beginners and experienced meditators welcome. I try to incorporate a range of styles, as different methods suit different people. I practice vipassana (the practice of calm abiding and observing) and qigong (the art of moving the body's energy), which mold quite well together. Look forward to seeing all of you!

This meditation is free. A $5-10 donation is suggested, but not at all necessary.
results.how_to_find_us: At Central Park West and 103rd Street, take the path into Central Park.  Immiditately after entering, turn left and take the stairs up the path leading upwards.  After reaching the clearing at the top of the hill, find us under the big shady tree
results.name: Meditate

results.description:
About This Walk

Note: after this walk, attendees will have the option to receive discounted admission to One World Observatory. Also, we'll be right at the site of the America's Cup warmup races, which are happening on the Hudson at 2 pm each day!

Hello! On this walk, with the aid of numerous images, we will first discuss the Downtown West neighborhood before the original WTC was built. Then we'll delve into the design, purpose, and impact of the original WTC. We will briefly review the events of 9/11 and its effects on downtown Manhattan. 

Next, we'll discuss the competitions and proposals to rebuild: which would you have chosen? We will learn about the direct influence that Jane Jacobs' ideas had on the rebuilding plan, and we'll talk about the results so far. Is the plan successful? Is the area more or less welcoming and “user-friendly” than in the past? All opinions are welcome! 

Our walk will take us in or around the Memorial Plaza and pools, the new WTC Transportation Hub and Oculus, the finished Towers 1, 4, and 7, and the unfinished Liberty Park, Performing Arts Center, and Towers 3 and 2. Particular emphasis will be placed on the design and construction of One World Trade Center (Freedom Tower), the tallest building in the Western Hemisphere and the most expensive building on Earth. 

We will discuss what makes today's skyscrapers safer for their occupants than those of the past, and what compromises and costs are necessary to ensure that safety. 

Finally, we will look at the dramatic impact the new World Trade Center is having on the rapid evolution of downtown Manhattan.

Taking Public TransitClosest: E Train to World Trade Center. Or, 1, 2, 3, A, C trains to Chambers Street. Or J, Z, 4, 5 trains to Fulton Street. Or R train to Cortlandt Street
results.name: World Trade Center Walking Tour ! FREE!

results.description:
Platform presentation by Jennifer Greene, spokesperson for Beyond Carnism.

What is carnism ? It is the invisible belief system that shapes our perception of the meat and animal products we eat, so that we love some animals and eat others without knowing why. Carnism is sustained by complex, hidden social and psychological mechanisms, and it is most harmful when unrecognized.  (The slideshow will include powerful imagery; therefore parental/guardian discretion is advised for younger attendees.)

Jennifer Greene is a member of the Unitarian Universalist Food Justice Ministry team and an active volunteer with Citizens’ Climate Lobby. Jennifer holds a master’s degree in sociology from the University of Michigan, and is the author of two food-education curricula.

Ethical Education classes for children today.

9:30 a.m. - Colloquy - Self-reflection and meditation on a chosen subject within a nurturing, protected group environment.  Leader's Study.
results.name: Why We Love Dogs, Eat Pigs, and Wear Cows: An Introduction to Carnism

results.description:
http://www.nysec.org/sites/default/files/styles/medium/public/images/Fascism.png?itok=pVm3CRtq Leader Joe Chuman

Dr. Anne Klaeysen, Leader presides 

 "I am not the only one to believe that we are in a dangerous political moment. The mainline press has become comfortable in describing utterances characteristic of this election cycle as "demagoguery."  Some have even invoked "fascism" to describe the disposition, ambiance and positions of Republicans who are vying to become the leaders of the free world. It is this that I feel impelled to discuss in that our times don't permit me to remain silent. Clearly we detect resonances to fascism. But just as clearly fascism is an emotionally explosive term drawing a direct line to Mussolini and Nazism. 

The philosopher, George Santayana, said, "Those who do not learn history are doomed to repeat it."  But how to employ history to the present, or to predict the future, is very tricky business. Though there are enough similarities to make us very uncomfortable, mid-twentieth century Europe is not twenty-first century America, and the differences should forestall rash conclusions. Yet...  In my address of May 8th, I will take a look at fascism as I seek to determine whether the category fits the current aspirants to the world most powerful office."


<a href="mailto:[masked]"></a>

Entry to our 100-year-old building and meeting rooms is available for most wheelchair users with prior arrangements. Please call ahead  [masked] x 107) for setup of our portable system and plan to arrive one hour before start time.

results.description:
"Even after all this time,
the Sun never says to the Earth, 'You owe me.'
Look what happens with a love like that,
It lights the whole sky." -- Hafiz
We recognize that sometimes bad things happen to good people -- but also that sometimes, good things happen to us, even without our "deserving" them. Is there a better word than "blessing" for those unearned gifts of life? We'll explore what this idea might mean -- in an ethical humanist context. How and why pay more attention to those undeserved good things that happen to us?
We'll also explore what it means to be "a people of blessing." Used as a verb. People who are able to give and receive. People who attribute human worth and work to bring that out in others (and thereby in themselves) -- rather than just seeing others in terms of how useful they are to us. People willing to "pay it forward" and be kind, whether or not we get a reward for that from the recipient. People who "light the whole sky." And, people who are grateful for the unearned good experiences that come to us, from people and from life itself.
Join Interim Clergy Leader Jone Johnson Lewis in exploring the term "blessing" from the perspective of Ethical Culture.
results.name: Sunday Platform: Blessings of This Life: An Ethical Perspective W/Jone Lewis

results.description:
Gargi Padki, a graduate of our Ethical Culture Sunday School, has developed and presented research on the marginalization of midwives. In South Africa she interviewed and worked along side midwives, doulas, and nurse-midwives. She has studied and focused her education on health equity and the impact of race and class as barriers to access of dignified health care. In South Africa racial divisions were clearly outlined during the Apartheid era, but the legacy of Apartheid has continued to endanger the lives of women and girls who become pregnant.She hopes to compare and contrast the healthcare system in the United States and abroad to cultivate a deeper understanding of how race and class intersect in the United States.

Everyone is invited to Sunday Platform meeting.

The Sunday School at the Ethical Culture Society of Bergen County helps children aged 2-14 explore and develop their moral and critical thinking skills through fun and interactive lessons and field trips. We meet weekly at 11am on Sundays for 1.5 hours while the adults of the Ethical Culture Society are attending the platform meeting. Our wide ranging curriculum allows kids to examine themselves, their community and the world in general. We teach about different cultures, philosophies and religions. We encourage our students to ask questions, think for themselves and make up their own minds about the bigger questions in life. Our children develop strong values and ethical standpoints. The Sunday School Graduation Rite of Passage, completed by our 8th graders, allows them to present to the community how their Sunday School experience has informed their moral and ethical development.
results.name: Gargi Padki on the Marginalization of midwives in South Africa

Sunday, May 8 with Sophie Cazeneuve
11:30am – 1:30pm

Take on any latin dance social party with these two popular dance styles!

The Salsa/Mambo basic step is defined by a “quick-quick-slow” to the rhythm of the percussion. The “break step” can be done on any of the 8-beats of the music. In Classic Style Salsa “On 1,” the break step occurs on the 1st beat of the music.

Bachata is very rhythmic & it’s danced in a close embrace. Ignored for many years because it was considered the poor people’s dance, it has now become very successful.

results.description:
WEATHER UPDATE:  

AS OF 11:30 PM, SATURDAY, MAY 7, FORECASTS CALL FOR 40% CHANCE OF RAIN UNTIL 10 AM, SUNDAY AND ZERO PERCENT AFTER 11 AM, SUNDAY, WITH CLOUDY SKIES PRESENT UNTIL AROUND 2 PM, MAKING WAY FOR A LITTLE SUNSHINE IN THE AFTERNOON. 

THAT'S GOOD ENOUGH FOR RUSTY AND I TO GO FORWARD AS SCHEDULED! 

***************************************************************

Many of you have been asking for a Manhattan MeetUp, so here's the SECOND of THREE for this month!

We sent out a short, 10-question Member Survey via an email blast to all of our Members on April 13, 2016.  Based on the results of that survey we are filling the May, 2016 calendar with the "top picks" of favorite dog runs... not only in Manhattan, but also in Brooklyn, Queens and even New Brunswick, New Jersey!

If you have not responded to that survey yet, by all means do so and let us know where your favorite dog runs are so that we may schedule future MeetUps there too!  

Our primary goal for 2016 is to schedule many MeetUps during each month at locations convenient to our Members... wherever they may live.  

Now a few words about the Carl Schurz Park Dog Run at Gracie Square...

Some of this data came from our Members and some from reviews on Yelp.com:

This dog run is one of NYC's best kept secrets, located in Gracie Square, which also houses Gracie Mansion... our Mayor's residence.  It is located in an idyllic setting, overlooking the East River.  Hey, if it's good enough for our Mayor, it should be good enough for our Beagles too!

Aside from the awesome views, this dog run is fully enclosed by a perimeter fence and comes complete with doggie water fountains, seating for the Beagle People, shaded areas and even public restroom facilities nearby.

The ground surface is primarily composed of fine sand and pebble.

There are actually TWO dog runs at this venue, however the "small dog" run is reserved for canines under 23 pounds and is provided with a very low perimeter fence which will not hold any Beagle who has visually "locked on" to a squirrel 50 yards away!!

By default, we will meet at the medium/large dog run.

Here are a few photos for a preview of the dog run and the park itself:

IMPORTANT:  

Attendance at this MeetUp event is purely voluntary and you do so at your own risk. 

By attending this MeetUp event you agree to hold harmless MeetUp.com, The Beagle Pack!, its Organizers and its Members, who assume NO liability for any injury, accident, loss of property or loss of life resulting from the use of this facility, or traveling to and from this facility, nor can they be held responsible for the actions of any aggressive dogs, irresponsible dog owners or patrons, or any hazardous conditions at the facility.

Join us at YM Monthly - an initiative to introduce Young Members to each of the outdoor activities offered by AMC's New York-North Jersey Chapter. Each month, a fun and educational excursion is organized for Young Members of all skill levels - from the beginner exploring a new hobby to the seasoned veteran interested in volunteering as a leader. 

The YM Monthly in May is co-organized with the Sailing Committee: 

We'll meet for an intro session to learn about the chapters sailing program, which offers the excitement of sloop and sunfish sailing on the Great South Bay. Previous participants will talk about their sailing experience at the Learn to Sail weekends. 

Then, we will head to the event space of the 35th America's Cup World Series at Brookfield Place Waterfront Plaza to watch the best sailors in the world racing on catamarans. Big screens near the stage will also broadcast racing live, and audio commentary along the waterfront will keep fans up-to-speed on all the action.

Registration is required for this activity:


http://activities.outdoors.org/search/index.cfm/action/details/id/90375
results.name: YM MONTHLY - AMERICA'S CUP RACE FINALS & INTRO SESSION TO SAILING

results.description:
Last week, the Supreme Court refused to block a Texas law that requires voters to have photo ID. Several other states have enacted similar laws. Democrats tend to view these laws as a back-door attempt to suppress Democrat voters. Republicans tend to see them as common-sense protection against voter fraud. Is voter fraud a problem? How will this affect the general election? And relatedly, did you have trouble voting during the primary?

I was planning to not cover the presidential race, because the primaries didn't seem to have any new developments, but now that Trump has won the Republican nomination, let's discuss the Trump vs Clinton general election. What shape do you think the race will take? Will enough Republicans support Trump? Will Clinton be able to inspire the Democratic base?

A New York State audit of the MTA recently showed that train delays are worse than they've been in a long time. The L train is going to be shut down for years. Plus, the MTA went billions of dollars over budget to build just two new stations in lower Manhattan. What is causing these problems? Can the MTA be improved? Are there any alternatives?

If we have extra time, maybe we can discuss the recent North Carolina law to ban transgender bathroom usage. There have a been a few developments recently.
results.name: Voter ID Laws, Trump v. Clinton, and the MTA

results.description:
There's a new board game shop/cafe/hangout in our area! Aether Game Cafe in Hoboken NJ. Let's give it a try.

Like the Uncommons, this cafe offers a wide stock of games for play throughout the day for a $5 cover charge. And it has more space and less noise and crowds.

To get there from NYC, take the PATH subway to the Hoboken stop. On weekends, this is easier from the midtown Path line along 6th Ave; from WTC you will have to change trains to Hoboken. I can also offer sleepover space at my apartment nearby in NJ after the monthly meetup on Saturday.

We stay and play all day, come and go anytime. This shop serves snacks but not meals, but there are plenty of places to eat nearby in Hoboken.

Driving/parking: Get there early and you can probably find a parking space in Hoboken; later in the day that can be tough. Look on a map for Sinatra Drive which has metered parking.

Come have fun!
results.name: Board Games, New Destination Edition

results.description:
Silence is Golden

This Improve with Improv Workshop will focus on nonverbal communication. Many actors feel uncomfortable when they are not talking. There is often a rush to find things to do when there is silence. This can become frantic and take away from the truthfulness of the scene.

In this workshop you will engage in exercises and scenework that restrict or limits verbal communication which encourages the performer to discover other ways of communicating.


A fun safe and non-competitive environment is created in which each participant will learn how to work through inhibitions and tap into their imaginations.


Suggested Donation: $15 (or whatever you can pay)*

*free drink with $15 donation

*most improv classes in NYC cost approximately $35-$50 per session

_____________________________________________________________________

THE BENEFITS OF IMPROV


Improv can help you reduce stage fright, perform with more ease, increase your emotional range, build rapport with your scene partners, and have more fun on stage.


Many actors get “stuck in their heads” and as a result feel paralyzed and/or disconnected when performing. Improv skills give the actor tools that will get them out of their heads and into the scene.
results.name: Silence is Golden

results.description:
Religiously motivated obstructionism disrupts and undermines important scientific research. / NYC ATHEISTS BRUNCH & SPEAKER / MAY 8TH (SUNDAY) / 12 NOON                                                                                                     ------------------------------------------------------------------

SPEAKER: Elizabeth Raymond, MD, MPH

Elizabeth Raymond, MD, MPH,  For over two decades, has been a prominent researcher in two fields, contraception and abortion, that have both been primary targets of relentless religious interference. She will share her insider perspectives on the current struggle over the labeling of mifepristone and will also relate many other experiences that illustrate the ways in which religiously motivated obstructionism disrupts and undermines important scientific research.

Dr. Raymond is a senior scientist for Gynuity Health Projects in New York City, a leading international research organization. Over the past 20 years, she has published over 75 peer-reviewed scientific papers in women’s health and has served as an expert witness in multiple high-profile legal cases involving abortion and contraception. Her research has been pivotal in support of FDA approval of various contraceptives and has led to numerous significant policy changes in reproductive health.

SUBJECT: Conducting Scientific Research in a Religion-Infused World
 A Scientist’s Behind-the-Scenes Insight into the Struggle to Conduct Science in the Face of Religious Opposition

On March 30, 2016, the FDA approved an update of the package label for mifepristone, the primary drug used to induce medical abortion. This important revision was long overdue as knowledge about the drug had advanced substantially since its initial approval in 2000. Within mere weeks, U.S. Rep. Chris Smith of New Jersey, a leading advocate for “God-given rights”, and Senator James Lankford of Oklahoma, who believes that freedom is “given to us by God”, rallied the support of 73 fellow Congressional legislators to launch an effort to harass both the FDA and the scientists involved in the research under the pretense of concern for women’s health.

-------------------------

LOCATION: The Press Box Restaurant, 932 Second Avenue (bet. 49th & 50th Sts.) -2nd Floor.


 COST: BRUNCH is $20, which includes a selection of Buffet Entrees, salad, one soft drink, coffee, tax and tip.

results.description:
Hey everypony, there is yet another cool event happening in NYC called Japan Day@ Central Park. This event is to bring awareness of cool community events happening in NYC for those who would like to check it out, learn a bit more of other cultures, or would like something to do for the day. This is great also for those who weren't able to attend the Sakura Matsuri you can now enjoy and learn of Japan's culture and have a great and fun experience! Japan Day is about bringing the Japanese community closer and having a stronger cultural understanding of Japan and the U.S. It is rain or shine but hopefully this time around its shine ^^!

*Website: japandaynyc.org

~In terms of meeting up I myself will be inside the main entrance(69th street and 5th avenue, pictured below) 

...for around 30mins, from there we can decide what to check out as a group for a bit and then later on we can scatter around for those who'd like to see other things or take a break for there is a lot of different events happening all day! Also no one has to feel committed to stay all day, it is Mother's Day! :)

**Admission= Free!

*Events that take place: 

A huge stage in Rumsey Field will have ongoing performances throughout the day such as drumming, dances, karate demonstrations, music, and much more!

*Various tents!:
Food tents with free samples of delicious Japanese Cuisine!
Calligraphy learning!
Photo booths!
Technology which will feature train demos, electron microscopes, and robots that are being created to help with various medical practices!
Kid friendly activities for those who would like to bring a filly or two ! ^.^

*Water bottles are ok but there is a list of prohibited items including bikes,pets,selfie sticks, instruments, and more so please check out their website for the listing of do’s and dont's before entering. (All the way at bottom of first page: japandaynyc.org ) Feel free to message any questions or concerns.
results.name: Japan Day @ Central Park!

results.description:
Updated March 5, 2016

WINTER (Dec-Feb)

As the city gets cold we play two times a week. We use Riverside Park with Morningside Park as a backup.

- Saturdays at 10am, Riverside Park (103rd & West End) 
- Sundays at 12pm, Riverside Park (103rd & West End)

This is one of three sites/listserves that promotes weekly games that have been going on for many many years. Stall counts are used on occasion, cleats are optional, boundaries are flexible, and all skill levels are welcome!

There are two ways to stay in touch outside of Meetup.com:

- Follow us on Twitter: http://www.twitter.com/nycultimate
- Like us on Facebook: http://www.facebook.com/nycultimate

Damien 

[masked]

RIVERSIDE DETAILS

The Riverside location is all the way West just off the water between 102nd and 108th Streets. You can only enter the park at 103rd and 108th. The best way to get there is to take the 1 local to 103rd Street. Walk West until you see an entrance that takes you down to the fields through the park. After walking down the steps from the street, you will see a path that goes left and another that goes right. Walk down the left path until you see a stone wall and stairs that go down to the fields. From South to North there will be one small soccer field surrounded by a track (red 'A' on map), another field with two softball fields (closer to 103rd/104th st) and another that is a giant soccer field (closer to 106th st). After walking down the steps, you will see the small Soccer field on your left. Start from this Southern-most field and walk North on the path to find our game. If you see no one, the meeting spot is the South side of the large soccer field. This spot is identified on the map below, a small square with little dots around it. On days when we can't find space at Riverside, we will move the game to Morningside Park (West 110th St and Manhattan Ave).

MORNINGSIDE DETAILS

The Morningside location is at the corner of 110th Street and Manhattan Avenue. The best way to get there is to take the C local (B on weekdays) to 110th Street. You can also take the 1 train to 110th street at Broadway and then walk East. We will play at the South end of the baseball field parallel to 110th street so that we're not in the way of the baseball/softball games. Riverside will be our backup if for some reason we need to change locations.
results.why: It's fun and you like it...

results.description:
Hey Peeps, We're going to do a beginner ride at Blue Mountain - its probably the best place to ride in our area.

If the ride is full, RSVP anyway to get on the waiting list. We may open it up to more riders or have a second group if we get more guides.

Blue Mountain is train accessible - You can take Metro North from Grand Central Station to the Peekskill, NY train station. It is then about a 20 minute bike ride to The parking lot at Blue Mountain where we will meet. The ride will start at 12:15 pm so you will need to catch the 10:43 AM train out of Grand Central to arrive at Peekskill at 11:48 AM. You will also need to buy a bike pass at Grand Central (I think its about $5) so you can take your bike on the train.


We'll ride for about an hour or two. Those that want to continue can, the rest can head back to catch he train home.

See this map to find the route you can take from the train station to the Blue Mountain parking lot and trail head:

Also feel free to contact other members to see if you can catch a ride. If you're driving, when you post your RSVP please let us know if you are willing to give others a ride.

Check out this link to see what we define as "beginner."
http://www.meetup.com/NYCMTB/messages/boards/thread/10167809

Check out this link to see what you should bring/wear for the ride:http://www.meetup.com/NYCMTB/messages/boards/thread/48856143

You will need a fat tire mountain bike in good working condition for this ride. This means that the chain is well lubricated, the gears shift well without skipping and you have good working breaks - trust me you will need them. Full suspension mountain bikes are best, but hardtails are also okay.


We ride as a group, no one gets left behind and there are no egos about riding - its all just about having a good time.

Waiver...

**By signing up for a meetup, I agree to the following: Mountain Biking can be dangerous and cause serious bodily injury or even possibly death. The organizers of this group and it's members will not be held responsible for the actions of any participant at any event. Each rider attends an event at their own risk and is solely responsible for any damage to their equipment or themselves.


YOU MUST FULLY UNDERSTAND THAT MOUNTAIN BIKING INVOLVES RISKS AND DANGERS OF SERIOUS BODILY INJURY, INCLUDING PERMANENT DISABILITY, PARALYSIS, AND DEATH. FULLY ACCEPT AND ASSUME ALL SUCH RISKS AND ALL RESPONSIBILITY FOR LOSSES, COSTS, AND DAMAGES. HEREBY RELEASE FROM ALL LIABILITY, CLAIMS, DEMANDS, LOSSES, OR DAMAGES ON MY ACCOUNT CAUSED OR ALLEGED TO BE CAUSED IN WHOLE OR IN PART BY THE MEMBERS OF THIS GROUP.


I HAVE READ THIS AGREEMENT, I FULLY UNDERSTAND ITS TERMS, UNDERSTAND THAT I HAVE GIVEN UP SUBSTANTIAL RIGHTS BY ATTENDING AND HAVE ATTEND FREELY AND WITHOUT INDUCEMENT OR ASSURANCE OF ANY NATURE AND INTEND IT TO BE A COMPLETE AND UNCONDITIONAL RELEASE OF ALL LIABILITY TO THE GREATEST EXTENT ALLOWED BY LAW

-Peter
