results.description:
We'll be meeting deep in Brooklyn, at 25th St and 5th Ave, outside the Greenwood Cemetery and one block East of the 25th St stop of the R train. Stay at the corner and don't go to the big gothic gate until we have assembled the group.  We'll do a zig-zag course of several miles through the hilly cemetery (see pictures http://www.meetup.com... ), after which we'll walk out and over to Prospect Park, and do several more miles there. We'll finish up at the F subway stop at 7th Avenue and 9th Street, Brooklyn, after which those interested can come to a delicious and affordable Thai dinner. You can get an entree and beer for about $18 + tax&tip. Note that we will be ending 1.4 miles from where we began, so if you drive make sure you have figured out how to hike or ride the subways back to the starting point.

Walkers should realize that if I (the leader) am interested in getting to know you, I am powerless to do so unless you'll walk at the front and talk with me, since I'm stuck at the front of the pack.  So by all means, walk up front and join in the conversation.

It's important that people be able to keep up with the group and not get lost -- the gates to the cemetery will be locked at 4pm, navigation within the cemetery is difficult, and the fence is high and basically impossible to climb, so if you fall behind and get lost and can't find a gate, you could wind up spending the night locked in with the ghosts. Actually, there are security guards driving cars around the cemetery, so if you sat and waited long enough by a gate, they would probably come by and let you out.

There are bathrooms at the beginning, halfway, and at the restaurant.  Other than that, we go 4 miles at a stretch with no bathrooms.  There aren't even suitable bushes along the way.

I expect we will be reaching the end and starting dinner at about 5:30pm.

For the trip home, you can take the F train, which will be at 7th Ave & 9th St, and 50 feet from the restaurant.  Or if you parked a car at the start, walk west on 9th St to 4th Ave for the 9th St stop on the R, and take the R train back to 25th St, where the hike started.

We'll aim for getting everyone out of the cemetery by 3:15pm, but if people get lost, it just isn't practical to go looking for them. So it's important that you be able to cope if you do get lost. All participants will be required to sign a release waiver that basically gives up any right whatsoever to sue, to the fullest extent possible by law. You can read the current draft of this waiver http://bluejacket7.com/legal/WalkingWaiver.doc
results.how_to_find_us: We should be the only group at that corner; I (Bill) look like my picture
results.name: Brainy 8 Mile Brooklyn Hike; Greenwood Cemetery, Prospect Park, and Dinner

results.description:
If you find yourself in the Big City on Mother's Day, join us  in the glorious Gramercy Park neighborhood!

Let’s say right out: Nope, we don’t have the keys to get inside the park, but there’s so much to say about the extraordinary people that have lived along it over the years, that you won’t miss that one bit!

The only private park in Manhattan, Gramercy Park was conceived as an exclusive enclave for the elite of the city, particularly in the mid to end of the 19th century. These four small blocks forming the park’s perimeter have held much more than their share of movers and shakers. We’ll hear from perennial diarist George Templeton Strong, and about Peter Cooper, Edwin Booth, and Thomas Edison, just to name a few.  And throughout it all, there are flashes of the genius of the tragically flawed architect Stanford White. Stroll back in time with us to visit mayors and governors, book publishers and inventors, philanthropists and alleged murderesses. It may seem tranquil here, but what stories there are to tell.

Where to meet: Meet in the front of the Gramercy Park Hotel, at 2 Lexington Avenue, between East 21 and 22 streets. Take the 6 or N/R trains to their respective "23 Street" stations.

When to meet: 12:45 pm for a 1 pm start. I will be holding a sign that says "Gramercy Park". There are restroom facilities inside the Gramercy Park Hotel; please be sure to take a visit there if necessary before the tour starts.

Fee: $20 cash, $15 for seniors 65 + with proof of age; exact change appreciated! Please bring bills, not coins. Sorry, please do not bring dogs or minor children age 17 or below on the tours.

The tour is 2.5 hours long.  For sunny days, be sure to bring a hat and a bottle of water. Check the weather reports on the day of the tour; if there is a chance of rain, please bring your own umbrella.  While Friendly Native tours usually do take place on the date and at the time they are scheduled, on occasion they will be postponed in cases of high temperatures or high probability of rain,  and an email sent out to that effect to all who have registered for the event.
results.how_to_find_us: I'll be holding a sign reading GRAMERCY PARK
results.name: TALES of GRAMERCY PARK, for MOTHER'S DAY!

Another option would be to do a nice, big picnic at Prospect Park. It could be a little more casual, intimate, and less structured than a brunch.

I'm really looking forward to turning this dreaded day into something positive and supportive.

results.description:
Note: Only RSVP if you are planning to show up.

First Timers, READ details before you RSVP. 

Where: The Cliffs at LIC, [masked]th Drive, Long Island City, NY

When: We usually climb between 1:00pm and 4:00 pm. There is no strict start time and the organizer(s) tries their best to be there around 1:00pm. We will pair off around 1.15ish and start climbing. 

Transportation: Subway: E, M trains to 23rd St-Ely Ave (1/2 block from gym) 7, G train to Court Square (2 blocks from gym)* N, Q train to Queens Borough Plaza (10min walk) *Walk to the E & M track for those bad weather days 

Metro North & LIRR: From Grand Central take 7 train 3 stops From Penn Station take Uptown E train to Court Square

Cost/Discount: $24 Day­pass during the meetup. For monthly/yearly membership, the Initiation Fee (currently $99) is waived (no discount on monthly dues, for yearly membership please inquire with the Cliffs for discount). Just mention "Rock & Ice" at the front desk in order to receive your discount. Gear rental is FREE for first-timers ONLY (first time visit to the facility). Regular gear  pricing info can be found here: http://thecliffsclimbing.com/lic/climbing/pricing/ 
For Beginners, Climbing 101/Top-rope basic class is offered 50% Off. Must sign­up and pay in advance by calling the Cliffs at 718­729­76125.</a>

How to meet us:  After you checked-in, to the right of the front desk there's a sitting area.If you see a group of people in there that's probably us come and say hi. If you are running late or can't find the group leave a message in the Comments section.  Food/drinks apres-climb at John Brown Smokehouse next door (or whichever resto the group decides). Even if you only want to have a beer with us, that is also acceptable :)

Notice to Beginners: If you have never climbed before, we encourage you to take the Climbing 101 class there before attending the meetup. We get a discounted price of $25 for the class (that's 50% Off original price if you do it the same day as the meet up and has to be scheduled in advance with them). This will also cover your day pass + gear for the day. Unfortunately we can't teach you how to belay or let you try to belay at the gym if you are not belay certified yet. We leave the teaching to the experts.  Check out Cliff's website for more details.  What to wear - comfortable clothes (think yoga).

Notice to newcomers: You need to pass a belay certification. If you had belayed before, the test takes couple of minutes. If you need a refresher, a test partner or belay partner, please see feel free to see me. Here is the link to The Cliffs LIC <a href="http://thecliffsclimbing.com/lic/">http://thecliffsclimbing.com/lic/

If you decide to stick with the sport, please peruse our message boards for good deals on climbing shoes and other gear.  Also if you find this group invaluable, please donate and pay your voluntary membership due ;) the Organizers will love you more ;)
results.name: Weekend Climbing at the Cliffs LIC

results.description:
Two twin brothers, both renowned gynecologists, descend into madness after becoming romantically involved with the same woman in this disturbing, horrific drama. Jeremy Irons delivers a bravura performance as both Beverly and Elliot Mantle, Toronto-based surgeons who operate an exclusive gynecological clinic and share a reputation as brilliant innovators. They also share lovers, as the more aggressive, confident Elliott seduces women and later secretly allows the shier, more intellectual Beverly to reap the benefits. This arrangement is disturbed when Beverly falls in love with their newest conquest, Claire Niveau (Genevieve Bujold), a famous actress with an unusual gynecological deformity. Beverly's relationship with the hard-living Claire leads to him to turn away from Elliot and begin a dangerous involvement with drugs and alcohol. Elliot senses his brother's rapid decline into addiction and paranoia and attempts to save him, only to start falling victim to the same urges. DirectorDavid Cronenberg adapted the loosely fact-based tale to his own creepy purposes, tapping into primal fears regarding the uncanniness of twins and male sexual panic. His notorious gore was used sparingly here, however, with the film's most disturbing moments coming through suggestion, as in the display of a group of terrifying surgical instruments created by Beverly in his madness. Cronenberg's expertise with special effects proves crucial, however, as he and his regular cinematographer Peter Suschitzsky seamlessly combine Irons' two performances in a manner unrivalled by any previous depiction of twins. This visual achievement is more than matched by Irons, who delivers what may be his career performance, delineating the twins' differences and similarities and embodying their collapse in frighteningly believable fashion. The subject matter and chilly tone may be too intense for some viewers, but the brilliant central performance and intellectually provocative approach will prove thoroughly absorbing for others.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=_xmheE3L19c

results.description:
What does your mother really want for Mother's Day? The opportunity to help build a community oven that will last for generations, of course! Join us for a special Mother's Day afternoon session of oven bricklaying.

The core of the oven is built, but we're not done yet! Learn the basics of masonry and lay bricks to build the outer facing of the oven.

Join the team to lay the beautiful red brick facing that will make this oven a twin to the Old Stone House and protect it for generations to come.  We'll also be beautifying the oven area.

This final phase of oven construction will extend over several weekends throughout the month of May. Feel free to join all day long or for just a couple of hours. No prior bricklaying experience is required!

Also, when you come help build the oven, we'll add your name to the brass dedication plaque that will be put on the finished oven. You'll go down in history as a Builder of the Oven!

We'll provide work gloves and tools.  Please wear closed-toe shoes and clothes that can get dirty.

See you there!
results.name: Community Bricklaying Day: Oven and Fireplace Facing

results.description:
Have you always wanted to try art journaling?  

Or are you someone that has more paints, papers and sprays than you want to admit? 

Are you looking for a creative, artsy community? 

http://designmemorycraft.typepad.com/.a/6a0134896f7ad2970c01a51171a0cf970c-800wi

*We will meet to create together and learn from each other! Heidi will share techniques as we go along but this event is more for the social aspect of making art together. There are no "set" projects or techniques-work on what you want to. Heidi will be creating art, too! 

*You will have access to Heidi's stencils, paints, sprays, etc. ($10 fee)

Please bring these supplies each week: 

*art journal

*adhesive-Matte Medium/gluesticks

*gesso

*something for color-acrylic paints, watercolor crayons, collage papers, watercolors, spray inks

*permanent pens/markers

*paintbrushes

*pencils for drawing

*stencils 

Check out Heidi's ART on her blog at: Gotham City Stampers

Hello Artists! Do you have those packs of paper with tons of sheets that you will never use up? How about great napkins with 100 in the pack? Tons of collage that you can't possibly use up? 
I thought it would be fun to bring along things that you want to share with the others at our ART JOURNALING CLUB EVENTS. (You certainly don't have to!) New art journalers are trying to build up their stash of goodies. Those of us that have been doing it for a bit love getting our hands on new things! You could also bring those supplies that you don't use-see if they can find a new home with someone from our group. 
I recently picked up two awesome packs of napkins that I love to use as background layers on my pages. I can't possibly use them all so everyone will be getting some. 
Again, no pressure to bring something but I wanted to put it out there as something fun to add to our already great time together!
results.name: May Art Journaling Club (read description carefully)

results.description:
Join the Jewish Outdoors Club as we go hiking the super scenic Mount Minsi on May 8th.

DISTANCE:
5.4 miles 

LEVEL:
Moderate to Moderate Plus:

HIKE OVERVIEW:
Although somewhat dwarfed by the imposing Mt. Tammany, Mt. Minsi offers views of the Delaware Water Gap at least equally as spectacular as those experienced from the top of Mt. Tammany and you might find the trails a bit less crowded.
http://www.nynjtc.org/hike/mt-minsi-loop-appalachian-trail 

SCHEDULE:
We will meet in the parking lot at around 12:30 pm . We are about 95 minutes from the city. Give yourselves some extra time in case you get stuck in traffic. The hike should take about 4 to 5 hours.

PACKING LIST:
3 bottles water !!!
Hiking boots (or good Sneakers if you don't have hiking boots - Flip-flops or CROCs are NOT okay)
Sunscreen
Bug spray
Camera
Binoculars
Snacks for along the trail
Lunch

So, how do I get there if I don't have car? 

Post a comment on this event that you are looking for a ride with your location so that drivers in your area can contact you and offer you a ride.


Don't forget to reimburse your driver $16 to cover gas, tolls, wear and tear and your kvetching :) (Please bring exact change BEFORE they ask for it, don't make them beg)


Trailhead GPS Coordinates:

[masked], [masked]

Driving Directions:

Cross the toll bridge into Pennsylvania, stay to the right at the tollbooth and immediately take PA Exit 310. Follow signs for Route 611 south down a circular ramp. At the end of the ramp, turn right on Broad Street At the next light turn left onto Route 611 south. Continue a few blocks to the Deerhead Inn on the right. Turn right immediately after the inn on Mountain Road. Take the next left into the Lake Lenape parking area. From Interstate 80 eastbound from Pennsylvania:Take PA Exit 310. At the traffic light at the end of the ramp, continue straight on Broad Street. At the next light turn left onto Route 611 south. Continue a few blocks to the Deerhead Inn on the right. Turn right immediately after the inn on Mountain Road. Take the next left into the Lake Lenape parking area.

Looking forward to seeing ya on the trails.
Moshe and Chaim

results.description:
Today is the 2nd of 3 time trials to Qualify for the following:


On May 20th we've organized FPV races and a Final to be held on Pier A in Hoboken at the 2016 annual Propeller Festival, that will also be live streamed on the Web, and where the overall winner gets bragging rights and takes home our Engraved Trophy.


It will be a part of this day long Music meets Tech event, which culminates in an evening of music under the stars.

       =-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=


TIME TRIAL:

1:15   Pilot's briefing
1:30  Walk the course
2:00  Practice runs start


         2  Practice Runs each


3:30 - 4pm  Time Trials start


           2 Attempts ( your fastest time is used )

RULES:  To qualify for the main races, you must be an experienced FPV racer and show proof of liability insurance coverage (AMA membership, homeowners etc.).
•  Any UAV over .55lbs must be FAA registered and labeled.
•  You will then compete in one of our Qualifying events for the top 12 spots with a engraved Trophy for the overall winner


The fee to compete will be $25 ($10 admin and $15 refundable if you crash out) payable by cash or check before you enter today's Qualifying time trial.

We need Marshals and Helpers. _ Spectators are welcome.

Once the Qualifying is concluded, we will continue the meeting (time allowing) as a regular Fly-In _ so don't forget to bring your non-racing birds to fly too.

If you have any questions, please eMail before the event starts.


(details are subject to change)
results.name: FPV Qualifying for the Propeller Quad Races

Have you ever tried Zumba? You have a chance to take free Zumba Gold and Zumba classes this summer with Yurie Yoshida! These free classes are held in Central Park on every Sunday from May 1 to Oct 30. Zumba Gold starts at 1:30 to 2:00 pm and Zumba will be 2:00 to 2:30pm. Locations will be announced in advance on meetup.com or facebook.com/zumbawithyurie. Please register in advance, since we can only take up to 25 dancers per class. All classes are video taped so please make sure you sign the release form before each class. Looking forward to seeing you in the Park!

*Due to the weather having  an impact on outdoor classes, make sure to regularly  check my Facebook to see if the class is being held or canceled.

*Make sure you wearing sneakers for the class, and bringing a bottle of water is always a good idea.

Come experience the Healing Power of Sound & Vibration from a range of wonderful instruments in a circle designed to open our hearts, relax our minds, and inspire our spirits. Utilizing Native American Flute, Celtic Harp, Singing Bowls, Didgeridoo and Shaman Drums & more! 

Sound Healing helps to:

• Relieve Stress 

• Calm Emotions

• Clear Your Thoughts

• Deepen Self Awareness

• Enhance Well Being

• Strengthen The Immune System

• Enhance Your Connection To Your Purpose

Sage Logan: is a Musician, Composer. He was raised with family practices of African American folk magic known as Rootwork. He is also a Shamanic Practitioner, and has learned sacred ceremonies, and healing techniques first hand from indigenous healers, from the Lakota & Cherokee traditions, healers from Peru & Ecuador, the Maori of New Zealand, South African Sangoma’s & many more. 

Dress comfortably for meditation, movement and relaxation. Please bring a notebook & pen, bandanna & water to drink. Musicians please feel free to bring and instrument with you to join in, meditative Instruments are especially welcome!

results.description:
Join DM Evan Lonergan in his encore presentation of Brotherhood of the Phoenix: Spires of the Embershade, his adventure for six 3rd level characters. Evan has been playing D&D at Wildpig since we started running RPGs, and his game was so popular among players that we're bringing it back for another round.

Welcome to the Brotherhood of the Phoenix: the most powerful adventuring guild in all of Aria! You're about to embark on your first job as initiates. A village near the Embershade Mountains has reported goblins attacking and kidnapping their villagers, and has asked the Brotherhood for help. Will your first job with the Brotherhood turn out to be as simple as it seems?

results.description:
CMNYC, in partnership with group member and Cuddlist CEO Adam Lippin, is hosting its 5th cuddle party of 2016! Come join us for an easygoing, safe and spirit-lifting introduction to the power of positive physical touch!

Steps to attend:


1) Read and understand the code of conduct, to which there are no exceptions.

2) RSVP here on Meetup

3) Pay the required attendance fee by credit card via EventBrite at: 

Please pay in advance. Walk-ins are not permitted.

This event is for Men that want to Cuddle Other Men.  All who identify as Male are welcome.

All other rules of Cuddle Party APPLY. 

Tom and Adam will be hosting a Men's only Cuddle Party at Big Buddha Studio on Sunday afternoon, Feb 28th 31st from 2:00 to 5:30 PM.

You MUST purchase a ticket at EventBrite to be sure you are registered to attend this Meetup. The Meetup announcement is serving *only* as an announcement and an easy way to communicate.

There is lots of information about Cuddle Parties on the official Cuddle Party website (www.cuddleparty.com), so if you are curious, be sure to check out the FAQ section and some of the articles too.Cuddle Party has been around since February 2004. If you are coming to the Cuddle Party, PLEASE arrive at 2:00 PM to check-in and change into your Cuddle Clothes so we can start the Welcome Circle by 2:30PM.

Sorry - but after the Welcome Circle begins, no late arrivals can enter

As a reminder, these are the Cuddle Party rules.

1) Pajamas (or cuddle-clothes) stay on the whole time.

2) You don't have to cuddle anyone at a Cuddle Party, ever.

3) You must ask permission and receive a verbal YES before you touch anyone. (Be as specific in your request as you can.)

4) If you're a yes, say YES. If you're a no, say NO.

5) If you're a maybe, say NO.

6) You are encouraged to change your mind anytime you want.

7) Respect your relationship agreements and communicate with your partner.

8) Get your Cuddle Lifeguard On Duty or Cuddle Caddy if you have a question or concern or need assistance with anything during the Cuddle Party.

9) Tears and laughter are both welcome.

10) Respect people's privacy when sharing about Cuddle Parties and do not gossip.

11) Arrive on time.

12) Be hygienically savvy.

You MUST purchase a ticket at EventBrite to be sure you are registered to attend this Meetup. The Meetup announcement is serving as an announcement and an easy way to communicate, but RSVPs here don't count.

The cost is $25

Get tix's here: 

https://www.eventbrite.com/e/mens-only-cuddle-party-tickets-24429237507

WHAT TO WEAR: Athletic Wear/Yoga Clothes/Pajamas. 

WHAT TO BRING: Just bring your smiling self.

Your Cuddle Host (that's me) will provide light snacks and beverages.

Looking forward to Cuddling with you soon,

Adam & Tom

www.cuddlist.com is a proud sponsor of Cuddle PartyNYC

Please leave a message or message me if you have further questions etc
results.how_to_find_us: Buzz for the 3rd floor and head to room 302 at the end of the hallway

I'm planning a game where doing a dramatic reading of part of The a Final Problem allows you to not have to take a block that time (the rest of the group will determine if you really made it dramatic!) and correctly answering a trivia question allows you to make SOMEONE ELSE take a block for your turn. There will of course be other games and drinks and fun things. Remember that Pioneers does allow us to bring in outside food, so we do ask that everyone purchase at least one drink while they are there (it need not be alcoholic! They have soda and juice as well!)
results.name: Reichenbach Day!

results.description:
This week we will focus on the role that information plays in physics, both classical and quantum.  Dr. Jeff Jones will go through the history of Maxwell's demon (where information first entered physics), leading to the Landauer limit (minimum amount of heat dissipation required for erasing a bit of information) and the idea of reversible computation.  This will lead into a discussion of how information is defined in quantum mechanics, and how entanglement entropy is related to thermodynamic entropy.  If time permits, we may also touch on the idea of a "fast scrambler" which has become important for understanding black holes.

References:

Charles Bennet's classic paper "The Thermodynamics of Computation" is a wonderful read, especially Chapter 5: http://www.pitt.edu/~jdnorton/lectures/Rotman_Summer_School_2013/thermo_computing_docs/Bennett_1982.pdf  


A review of Maxwell's demon from 2008 that covers applications to lots of different subjects.  They even have a very nice short simple proof in it that modifying the Shrodinger Equation to be either non-linear or non-unitarity would violate the 2nd law of thermodynamics: http://arxiv.org/pdf/0707.3400v2.pdf  


Holevo's bound (the connection between information and entropy in quantum systems): https://www.cs.berkeley.edu/~vazirani/s07quantum/notes/lec17/lec17.pdf  


And a good history (a lot more readable and less technical than the other links) of Maxwell's demon: http://splasho.com/blog/essays/maxwell-thermodynamics-meets-the-demon/  

DIRECTIONS:

From NYC by car: take the Holland Tunnel; after tunnel at 2nd traffic light turn left into Marin Blvrd; 1st traffic light turn left into 6th street/Thomas Gangemi Dr; 3rd traffic light turn right into Washington Blvrd; 2nd traffic light turn left into 2nd street; the Portofino is the 1st building on the right. Total distance from the tunnel ~1 mile.

From NYC by PATH train: take the PATH train to Hoboken/Journal Square from 6th Ave and 9, 14, 23 or 32 street; get of at Newport/Pavonia (2nd stop in NJ). Train ride just under 20 minutes. Cross the small park in front of the station, go left on Washington Blvrd about 0.2 miles; left into 2nd street; the Portofino is the 1st building on the right.

Tell the concierge you are going to the quantum theory meeting in the 5th floor community room.

Any questions: call me on[masked]-2004.
results.how_to_find_us: DIRECTIONS:  From NYC by car: take the Holland Tunnel; after tunnel at 2nd traffic light turn left into Marin Blvrd; 1st traffic light turn left into 6th street/Thomas Gangemi Dr; 3rd traffic light turn right into Washington Blvrd; 2nd traffic light
results.name: Information, Entropy, and Entanglement

results.description:
Brooklynites and other New Yorkers! Come out to Ange Noir Cafe and play some Magic the Gathering, whether you are new to the game or an experienced player. I bring a bunch of cards and some pre-made decks, so we always have enough stuff for all. Feel free to bring your own decks (Commander aka EDH, Modern, Standard, etc.) along if you want. And invite friends ... the more the merrier.

***The given time-slot can be shifted or extended to fit schedules or we want to play longer but please let me know a little in advance so we can schedule properly.*** 

*UPDATE REGARDING FINANCIAL INPUT: we have now gone to a yearly dues format, which if everyone in the group pays, we will have more than enough to cover the cost of being on Meetup. If not everyone pays, it may have to increase, but only slightly (right now at $2/yr.) The real purpose of why this group is here is to provide a non-financially demanding option for learning and playing/practicing the game.

results.description:
Be aware: There is no entry system at Mark's apartment, so go to the upper entrance, knock on the door or a window to the left of the door, and if no one answers, call[masked]-3368.

This group is dedicated exclusively to novels. Please read the Novel Group Intro and FAQ before attending. Be prepared to read back through previous chapters of a novel-in-progress before committing to this group. Deadline for submission of stories to be critiqued is Friday, eleven days prior to the Meetup. On that day, I'll send out an email listing the stories to be critiqued and in what order, with a link to the Google Drive folder where the stories live. That list will also appear under Discussions and will be edited as changes occur.

To submit, Email your submission to [masked]

SUBJECT: The Title of the group you're submitting to and your name. EXAMPLE: Cam's Novel Group December 8th, Spidercam

MESSAGE: Name, Title, Word Count, any additional info. EXAMPLE: Spidercam, Glory Chapter 2, 7,000 words. This is a rewrite.

Send to [masked]

Please make sure your manuscript is properly formatted. See our Procedures, located under the Pages tab, for guidelines and an example, as well as advice for a constructive critique. Having manuscripts already formatted makes the critiquing process easier.

Most of the meeting will be spent critiquing work of group members. There is a structure in place to make sure the critiques are as helpful as possible for everyone involved, and that the writers leave with a clear idea of what to do with their stories next.

We'll also spend some time talking about writing, sharing news and information, and getting to know one another. It's always easier to take constructive criticism from someone you know, so the social element of the group is as important as the work itself!
results.name: Brad's Novel Group

https://github.com/logston/NYCPythonSOH/blob/master/resources.rst 

Detailed Directions to us:

As you enter the building located at 568 Broadway, New York, NY 10012 you will need to provide ID and your destination (Fueled Collective, 11th Floor) to the front desk. They will provide you with a sticker badge. Take one of the elevators (located to the right of the front desk) to the 11th floor. We will be in the Deerbrook conference room.

results.description:
Get tickets at: https://www.eventbrite.com/e/paint-drink-cocktails-event-tickets-25177265880

(No tickets will be sold at venue. You must Pre-Pay online - This event almost always  sells out by the event day so get your tickets now. It's unlikely tickets will still be available by the day of the event)

Come Alone, With A Friend Or Bring Mom For Mother's Day!

So what's this event all about? Come on out and sip cocktails, mingle and paint a great canvas under the guidance of a master artist! During the event, you'll be crafting your masterpiece while sipping drinks that are available at the cash bar. We supply paint and brushes, canvases, easels, and aprons.

BY THE WAY... YOU DON'T HAVE TO HAVE ANY ARTISTIC ABILITY TO ENJOY THIS EVENT. FOR MANY PEOPLE ATTENDING IT WILL BE THEIR FIRST TIME PAINTING ANYTHING IN YEARS. THE ARTIST WILL WALK YOU THROUGH EVERYTHING STEP BY STEP.

* WE DO DIFFERENT PAINTINGS AT EACH EVENT SO IF YOU'VE BEEN TO ONE OF OUR EVENTS BEFORE... HAVE NO FEAR... YOU'LL BE PAINTING SOMETHING NEW!


This event is mostly for singles but we don't gender balance it... meaning that sometimes we have more of one gender at the event. You'll have a great night out meeting like-minded fun new friends (Wing men/women to do other fun things with and who knows, you may even end up meeting that special someone). Typically about 75% of attendees of this event come alone and 25% bring friends. All ages are welcome to attend.

WE RECOMMEND GETTING YOUR TICKET AS SOON AS POSSIBLE AS WE HAVE LIMITED SPACES AVAILABLE FOR THIS EVENT AND MANY TIMES IT SELLS OUT.

* This is a multi-Meetup group event. Over 10 Meetup groups have been invited to attend. The RSVP list on this page is only a small portion of actual attendees.

THERE IS A 2 DRINK MINIMUM AT THIS EVENT...
YOU HAVE TWO OPTIONS FOR DRINKING:

OPTION 1: ENDLESS LIQUID BRUNCH!!
This is our most popular choice. For just $18 (paid to the waiter at the venue) you get unlimited Mimosas and Bloody Marys for the entire event! That includes your tip! You can't beat that deal!!

OPTION 2:
If you don't want to go with the endless liquid brunch option, the waiter will bring you a check for $15. That will get you 2 drinks (and includes your tip so that is the maximum you need to spend). The drinks can be non-alcoholic (Of course, you are welcome to order more if you'd like).

Get tickets at: https://www.eventbrite.com/e/paint-drink-cocktails-event-tickets-25177265880
(No tickets will be sold at venue. You must Pre-Pay online - This event almost always  sells out by the event day so get your tickets now. It's unlikely tickets will still be available by the day of the event)

PICS FROM RECENT EVENTS:

Get tickets at: https://www.eventbrite.com/e/paint-drink-cocktails-event-tickets-25177265880

Come Alone, With A Friend Or Bring Mom For Mother's Day!

So what's this event all about? Come on out and sip cocktails, mingle and paint a great canvas under the guidance of a master artist! During the event, you'll be crafting your masterpiece while sipping drinks that are available at the cash bar. We supply paint and brushes, canvases, easels, and aprons.

BY THE WAY... YOU DON'T HAVE TO HAVE ANY ARTISTIC ABILITY TO ENJOY THIS EVENT. FOR MANY PEOPLE ATTENDING IT WILL BE THEIR FIRST TIME PAINTING ANYTHING IN YEARS. THE ARTIST WILL WALK YOU THROUGH EVERYTHING STEP BY STEP.

* WE DO DIFFERENT PAINTINGS AT EACH EVENT SO IF YOU'VE BEEN TO ONE OF OUR EVENTS BEFORE... HAVE NO FEAR... YOU'LL BE PAINTING SOMETHING NEW!


This event is mostly for singles but we don't gender balance it... meaning that sometimes we have more of one gender at the event. You'll have a great night out meeting like-minded fun new friends (Wing men/women to do other fun things with and who knows, you may even end up meeting that special someone). Typically about 75% of attendees of this event come alone and 25% bring friends. All ages are welcome to attend.

WE RECOMMEND GETTING YOUR TICKET AS SOON AS POSSIBLE AS WE HAVE LIMITED SPACES AVAILABLE FOR THIS EVENT AND MANY TIMES IT SELLS OUT.

* This is a multi-Meetup group event. Over 10 Meetup groups have been invited to attend. The RSVP list on this page is only a small portion of actual attendees.

THERE IS A 2 DRINK MINIMUM AT THIS EVENT...
YOU HAVE TWO OPTIONS FOR DRINKING:

OPTION 1: ENDLESS LIQUID BRUNCH!!
This is our most popular choice. For just $18 (paid to the waiter at the venue) you get unlimited Mimosas and Bloody Marys for the entire event! That includes your tip! You can't beat that deal!!

OPTION 2:
If you don't want to go with the endless liquid brunch option, the waiter will bring you a check for $15. That will get you 2 drinks (and includes your tip so that is the maximum you need to spend). The drinks can be non-alcoholic (Of course, you are welcome to order more if you'd like).

Get tickets at: https://www.eventbrite.com/e/paint-drink-cocktails-event-tickets-25177265880
(No tickets will be sold at venue. You must Pre-Pay online - This event almost always  sells out by the event day so get your tickets now. It's unlikely tickets will still be available by the day of the event)

results.description:
This is a weekly introductory improv class taught Sundays from 3-5pm.

-- Are you a bit shy and looking to get more comfortable with your public speaking? 

-- Are you a working professional hoping to be a bit more spontaneous during your meetings and interactions with co-workers? 

-- Or are you an actor or improv comedian looking to take your craft to the next level or get more reps?

Then this is the class for you! In this class, you will learn the fundamentals of scene work (role playing). You'll be on your feet quite a bit as I'm believer that you learn (and have more fun) through doing rather than hearing an instructor talk. Brief individual notes will be given, if that's what you're looking for, and tailored to your level of experience. At the end of each class, I'm confident you'll feel a sense of accomplishment that will leave you more energized and excited to tackle the challenges of everyday life, whether at your work place or in your personal life. 

This class is $10.  If money is an issue for you, let me know and we can work something out.  The cost goes to pay for the cost of the room rental, Meetup fees, and website.  

Hope to see you there!


Steve

www.improvnow.com

www.facebook.com/improvnow

Steve Ling is an alumnus of the improv programs of the Upright Citizens Brigade, Peoples Improv Theater, Magnet Theater, & Annoyance Theater. He regularly produces and performs improv, musical improv, & hip hop improv across NYC.

results.description:
****READ THIS FIRST || Parade Grounds Game Standards ****

Meet on field 8!!!

The game is scheduled to start at 3:30. We typically start 15-30 minutes after 3:30. Your RSVP is good if you come on time. If you come after teams are divided then you run the risk of not playing. Those who have RSVP’ed get first preference to play (This does not apply to anyone on the waiting list). Also, please  Un-RSVP if you will not be attending. That gives other people a chance to play.

Rules and guidelines:

These games are geared towards advanced to intermediate players.

Teams are divided by two team captains (captains pick players in turns in an attempt to keep teams balanced and competitive)

Physical play is allowed as long as it isn't overly aggressive or dirty.

Slide tackles are allowed only to block a shot on goal or to intercept a pass  NO slide tackling on a player with the ball.

Ball hogging is absolutely not tolerated 

Keep in mind as we don't have permit, we need to be flexible.
results.name: Sunday Pick-up Parade Grounds 3:30 PM

results.description:
NON-COMPETITIVE CO-ED SOCCER GAMES @ Frederick Douglass Playground


                                 Check our Facebook page:

              facebook.com/ManhattanInternationalCoedSoccer 

                          NO CLEATS OR PLASTIC STUDS ALLOWED

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=41MNlrZf-MY

GAME DESCRIPTION:

Our games are for all levels and people that prefer to play a non-competitive game of soccer, break a sweat while exercising running up and down the field with the ball and all this happening in a very laid-back and non-judgmental environment. Please, arrive 10 minutes before the game so we can get the teams set up.

Game Format:

We'll play three simultaneous games of 7 on 7, with small goals. There will be 6 teams on the field and we will play three games, 30 minutes/game. Every 30 minutes we will have a short break and teams will switch to play against different team. Please check our meetup message board on Saturday night or before 9:00 am on Sunday to see what team you are on. This will save us a lot of time on the field.

RULES OF THE GAME:

1-First and most important rule of the game is to have fun and enjoy the time on the field!

2-Rough play and offensive language will absolutely not be tolerated!!! In plain words, no slide tackling, no pushing and no telling off.

3-No power shots allowed.

4-If you don't sign up for the game, do not show up.

5-If you are late for the game, you must wait until the game in progress is over to join your team.


6-Those that don't comply with these rules, will kindly be asked to leave the field so others can enjoy the game.

Any other questions regarding the rules of the game or anything else, should be directed to the organizer directly or to the assistant organizer/s!!!

Please check our meetup message board on Saturday night or before 12:00 PM on Saturday to see what team you are on. This will save us a lot of time on the field.

Location:

Frederick Douglass Playground


Take the 1,2 or 3 RED Line Train to 96th street Station and walk 4 blocks down, to 101st Street and Amsterdam Ave. or the 1 RED Line Train to 103rd Street Station and walk 1 block.

Call me if you can’t find the field - [masked] Manny S. 

What to bring with you:

A pair of sneakers, indoor or turf shoes(No CLEATS), shin guards (recommended) and lots of water. There is a water fountain next to the park if you need extra water.

Fee:

You will be asked to pay $9.50 when you RSVP. This $9.50 is used to pay for, facilities permits, meetup fees, Amazon fees, goals, cones, soccer balls etc.

Refunds & Weather Policy:

Refunds will be issued if the RSVP is changed by Wednesday before 12.00PM or if the game is cancelled. The game can be cancelled if the weather conditions are severe like heavy rain, snow or thunder.

After the game we'll head to Royale for brunch and a Pint or Two:

                                       Lion’s Head Tavern 

                                     995 Amsterdam Ave

                                      New York, NY 10025

                                           (212)[masked]

PARTICIPATING IN MANHATTAN-INTERNATIONAL-COED-SOCCER ACTIVITIES AGREEMENT:

I certify that I have no known medical or other conditions that could interfere with my participation in Manhattan-International-COED-Soccer activities. I also understand and accept that the practice of soccer, both indoor and outdoor, involves certain risks of physical injury. Therefore, I, individually, hereby release and discharge, Manhattan-International-COED-Soccer Organizer and Assistant Organizers from any and all claims, actions, damages, losses, liabilities, costs and expenses of any kind whatsoever, including but not limited to any claims of negligence, arising out of, resulting from, by reason of, or in connection with my participation in any of Manhattan-International-COED-Soccer programs or activities. Manhattan-International-COED-Soccer Organizer and its Assistant Organizers reserve the right to take and utilize photographs, video, or any type of recording of participating person while engaged in our or associated activities. I consent to Manhattan-International-COED-Soccer use the photograph, video, or recording of me, for advertising, promotional, or related purposes, and waive all rights to compensation and other rights which may arise as a result.

results.description:
This run will be beginner-friendly, but we welcome runners at all levels. We will be running anywhere from 2 - 6ish miles depending on what everyone is looking to do. 

The main starting point will be at Columbus Circle by the gold statue (not the silver unisphere).

Here are some options:

Advanced: 
6 miles: Lots of hills. Run along the full outer loop of the park. The hills are more challenging if you run counter-clockwise. 

Intermediate: 
~5 miles: Run along the outer loop but cut across the 102nd st traverse.  You'll skip the infamous Harlem hill.

Beginner: 
1.7 miles: Run around the lower loop. Cut across the 72st traverse and hang a left again once you hit the west side, end back at Columbus Circle.

If possible we will break into pace groups, but either way lets meet back at the USS Maine Monument around 12-12:15am.

Where do I leave my stuff? 
The New York Running Company at the Time Warner Center (located on the 2nd floor) has open bins, and lockers behind the cash register. To use the lockers, you must bring your own lock. They also have changing rooms. These services are free. The New York Running Company opens at 11am on Sunday. 

What time does the run actually start?
Plan on arriving at 11am, but we won't start running until about 11:15am in case people need to change or drop off their stuff at the NY Running Company. We will not wait longer that 11:15am.  

What happens after the run?
After the run once everyone is together again, we can grab some food! Weather permitting, we can get something to eat from Whole Foods (or wherever you like), and we can sit and eat in the park. We can walk over to the Sheep Meadow.
If the weather is not picnic-friendly, we can hit our goto place which is Cosmic Diner on 52nd and 8th ave. Hot chocolate, coffee, pancakes? Mmmm.. If anyone wants to suggest a different place that is close by, we're flexible.


Call/text Henry at (646)[masked] if you have any questions or are having trouble finding us.

Dig deep and drag yourself out to go for a run! You'll be glad you did!

** only RSVP 'No' if you were previously a 'Yes'.

The best!

Our ground meats are extremely high quality.


THE FARMER'S WILL NOT BE PROVIDING AN INVENTORY OF EACH BOX IN ADVANCE.  THEY HAVE AN INVENTORY OF EACH BOX POSTED TO EACH BOX ON DELIVERY DAY. 


The total cost for your 15 pounds of ground grass fed dry aged beef will be $108.20. The box is $100 plus a $5 meetup fee plus the paypal fee.  


THE FARMERS WILL NOT BE DELIVERING TO INDIVIDUAL ADDRESSES MIX BOXES ALONE.  PLEASE COME AND PICK UP YOUR MIX BOX.  EXCEPTION - 2 OR MORE PEOPLE GETTING TWO SHIPMENTS WOULD LIKE TO HAVE IT DELIVERED TO THE SAME PLACE - THEY WILL DELIVER FOR THAT.

Spring Lake has a great website <a>www.springlakefarmny.com.</a> Ulla Kjarval, the farmer's daughter also writes a farming & food blog with several recipes to complement the meat her parent's raise. Our beef has been completely grass-fed. Ingi Kjarval, our farmer, has been cross-breeding his cattle to help build a smaller, sturdier steer that does well in upstate NY on grass. Our cows are part Simmental, Hereford, Angus & Highland.

results.description:
New York City detective Steve Burns Al Pacino receives orders from Captain Edelson Paul Sorvino to solve a series of brutal murders in the gay community. Steve scours the gay bars that caters to same-sex sadomasochism in a desperate attempt to solve the crime. As he infiltrates the scene, he slowly comes loose from the moorings of his own reality, and an innocent victim is tortured by the cops in an effort to exact a confession. The story is based on actual murders that took place between 1962 and 1979. The film gained considerable publicity because of the controversial subject matter while censor argued between an X and R rating for the feature.

results.description:
Hello film buddies! I've missed you! The hiatus was partly due to my own hibernation, and also due to a dearth of indie films I'm excited to see. But spring is in the air and with it is a little film that's caught my attention.


Winner of the Palme d'Or at the 2015 Cannes Film Festival, from the acclaimed director of A Prophet and Rust and Bone, comes a riveting tale of three Sri Lankan refugees: ex-guerrilla Dheepan and two strangers, who jump at the chance to emigrate to Europe by pretending to be family. But instead of the peace they hoped to find, they’re dumped in a gang-infested housing project outside of Paris, hardly less violent than the world they fled. And as their situation grows ever more precarious, Dheepan discovers he must call upon the military past he renounced if they’re to survive.

French, 115 Minutes, In Tamil and French

http://www.ifcfilms.com/films/dheepan

Meetup Details: 


This film will be released on May 6th; showtimes are not yet available. Once available, I'll choose a showing roughly in the 4pm - 7pm timeframe and update the meetup. Everyone is responsible for purchasing their own ticket.

I will be standing in the lobby a half hour ahead of time, and will walk into the theater @ 15 minutes prior to showtime. If we get separated, we can regroup outside after the film. The post-film discussion will be held at Washington Square Diner, right across the street. 

See you there!
results.name: Indie Film Series: 'Dheepan' @ IFC

We ask a donation of $5 to help cover room rental costs, but no one is turned away because they can't afford it. We want you there more than we want the money.

results.description:
The warm weather is back, and so is Improv in the Park! If you can afford it, please do make the suggested $1 donation. Meetup raised their organizer dues last year, and we're in the negative again, so if you can afford to help cover the costs, I would appreciate it tremendously.

Hopefully, the weather will cooperate, however, if it is raining within one hour of the meetup or if the temperature drops below 60 degrees, we will move the meetup to a different date.


If you arrive on time, you'll see me holding up an Improv in the Park sign. If you're late, look for one or more circles of people having a blast doing improv :). 


There's no prior improv experience required, and if you prefer to just watch, you're welcome to join as well!

I'll bring my box of warm ups and games, but please feel free to bring ideas on your favorite exercises as well!

By attending this event, you agree to the terms and conditions outlined on our About page.


Want to Keep in Touch Between Meetups?

Like us on Facebook!
Follow us on Twitter!
Subscribe to our YouTube channel!

Want to Support Our Meetup?

My goal is to keep the standard Improv in the Park meetups forever free. If you'd like to voluntarily support our community, you can do so in any of the following ways:

• Leverage your skills! Are you a rock star graphic designer? We could use some awesome images for our page (e.g., for the banner at the top, our icon, etc.)! Do you know how to work an SLR or a video camera? We love seeing photos and videos of our meetups! Do you know a thing or two about improv? Lead us in some of the exercises! The possibilities are endless! :) Huge thanks to all those of you who are already giving us the gift of your time and talent on an ongoing basis!


• Leverage your network! Know someone who can hook us up with a free performance space? Send them our way! Got friends who love improv? Tell them about our group! Is your buddy an excellent improviser and/or coach? Ask them to make a guest appearance at one of our events!


• Leverage your voice! Love our events? Write a review on Yelp! You can also leave a review on our Facebook Page or our Meetup page for other prospective members to see!


• Leverage your job! Would your (or a friend's) office benefit from a fun, improv-based team building activity? Message me with the referral, and you'll get a 10% commission on any resulting bookings! Do you want to help cover our expenses (e.g., organizer dues, which I've been paying out of pocket, a better sign that doesn't blow away with the slightest breeze, a normal container for our games, instead of my recycled microwave popcorn box, etc.)? Send a donation via PayPal to [masked] (no amount is too small)! 


Thank you, and I'm excited to see you at this event!

results.description:
Online dating is great. But how many times have you chatted with someone just to have them fade or never make plans to meet? How many dates have you had that you thought went well and then ended up confused because you never heard from that person again?

Meet other members for a brief happy hour mingle while guests arrive.  Once everyone has checked-in you'll be seated for your series of four minute "mini-dates." On your dating card that you receive at check-in, you'll select who you wish to see again. You can choose Dating or Friendship as your preferred connection.

We will collect everyone's dating cards at the end of the event and email you your mutual matches within 48 hours.

While this event is geared towards helping people meet potential romantic matches, you can also mingle with all the guests and find new friends as well.

On average, 80% of those who attend end up with at least one or two mutual matches.

* We run 3-5 Meetup Groups, plus maintain our own outside Dating Advice & Events Website. We advertise on Facebook, Twitter, Blogs, etc. Most registrations come through our outside events website, not Meetup. Therefore the number of RSVPs reflected here are NOT the total number of men or women registered.

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

PAYMENT POLICY:
$24  - PAY IN ADVANCE ONLY - WE DO NOT ACCEPT PAYMENT AT DOOR

*You must register with a valid, correct email address.

REGISTER AND PAY HERE: https://2016atwysnycspeeddating.eventbrite.com

(SEE MORE FAQ's BELOW)

ABSOLUTELY NO REFUNDS FOR LAST MINUTE/DAY OF CANCELLATIONS

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~


FAST FACTS - PLEASE READ:

*We can not accept payment at the door for these events. All registrations must be done online via the Eventbrite link below before the event. No exceptions.

*RSVPing through meetup does not guarantee admission. You must pre-pay to secure your spot in the event.

*Business casual attire requested. No sneakers, t-shirts or active wear, no ripped jeans.

*We limit our events to 12 couples/24 people. (See reason below)

*Matches are tabulated and emailed to attendees 48 hours after the event.

*Event lasts about 90 minutes give or take 10 minutes between check-in and all speeddating rounds.

*You must register with a valid, correct email address.

*There are no refunds for cancellations, late arrivals or no-shows.


OUR METHOD:

The upside of online dating is that it provides us with so many options. The downside is that people start to believe that their options are endless, which leads them to move on quickly seeking that "perfect" match.

This is where speeddating comes in. To try and combat the "shopping cart" mentality of online dating, we limit the number of attendees to 10-12 per gender.  Fewer choices to distract us means that people are more likely to make a connection. Face to face conversations result in fewer flakes. That means fewer people get put on the back burner.


FAQ'S

The Organizer RSVPD with X amount of people. What does that mean?

That number represents the RSVPS (not registrations) that have come in through our other pages listed below. It is NOT the total number of people pre-paid. The typical number of people per event is 16-20.

What should I wear?

Business casual attire is perfect. No sneakers or athletic wear, please.

What if I want to give someone my contact info at the event?

Go for it! That's the whole point. Do whatever you are comfortable doing.

Can I see photos of other attendees?

Most people do not RSVP on meetup for privacy reasons. They only pre-pay and therefore do not share their photo.

Where are all the RSVPs?

About 50% of the registrations come through Eventbrite and our main events website. They are not Meetup members. Many people prefer not to post their Meetup profile or photo for privacy reasons. We often remove the event from the calendar once it has started so that people can't contact attendees without the attendee's expressed permission.

What's The Refund Policy?

Since we need to try and ensure a gender ratio as close to even as possible, our policy is that all registrations are final. We can not offer refunds or transfers to last minute cancellations. However, if you notify us at least 3 days in advance, we can give you a credit to another event.

Can I bring a friend for moral support?

You'd be surprised how many people arrive alone. We actually prefer that guests do not bring friends or "spectators." It makes the other attendees uncomfortable. Fun fact: The people who sign up and arrive alone tend to get more matches than those who attend with friends.

Will there be equal numbers of men or women?

That's the goal. We constantly monitor registrations and amp up promotion to try and ensure and equal gender ration. Sometimes there's  more men or women. Sometimes it's even numbers. This is heavily dependent on the age range and weather. 

*This is not a guaranteed number of dates.

See other RSVPS posted on our other groups. Please note that many people opt NOT to RSVP through Meetup for privacy reasons.
results.name: SpeedMeeting-  Singles Ages 29-42

results.description:
TNYA Water Polo is an LGBTQ friendly team with practices at John Jay Sunday from 6:00 – 7:30 pm, and Tuesday 8:00 or 9:00 - 10:00 pm at the Chelsea Rec Center (for Rec Center  members only). For full information on the team, please go to 

www.tnya.org

The first practice is free and we love getting new players! Please let the coach on deck know if it's your first time with us and feel free to message Alex Barclay ahead of time if you have any questions. You will need to bring a swim suit appropriate for water polo, a towel, goggles and a lock. If you would like to practice with us regularly, you must become registered with US Water Polo at the silver level and pay our annual membership dues. 

We ask that any practice participants have some prior experience playing water polo and be able to swim a hundred yards in a row in less than two minutes. If you have a swimming background and are interested in learning water polo, please read the pdf below thoroughly and contact Alex Barclay. The coaching is typically geared to an intermediate level of play and we do work on basic skills at every practice. Everyone should be familiar with the basic rules and concepts of the game, as outlined in this pdf: 

http://www.tnya.org/wp-content/uploads/2014/07/Polo_Beginners.pdf

Practices typically include a swim set and some conditioning at the beginning, drills, and scrimmaging for the last 30-45 minutes (it's also ok to sit out and watch for the scrimmaging portion if it's your first practice). The first and third Sundays are geared towards scrimmaging and the second and fourth are more focused on skills and/or conditioning. Bob or Jeff are the typical coaches. We strive to create a positive and welcoming environment and do not tolerate any unsportsmanlike conduct. There are at least four tournaments we compete in each year and practices will adjust in the weeks before the tournaments to prepare participating players.

Hosted by Team New York Aquatics. Coached by Bob.

Welcomes all levels including beginners.

Free for first timers. Bring goggles, swimsuit, towel, and lock for gym locker.
results.how_to_find_us: Walk in. Pool is straight ahead. Tell the desk you're there for water polo.
results.name: TNYA hosts All Level Water Polo

results.description:
Online dating is great. But how many times have you chatted with someone just to have them fade or never make plans to meet? How many dates have you had that you thought went well and then ended up confused because you never heard from that person again?

Meet other members for a brief happy hour mingle while guests arrive.  Once everyone has checked-in you'll be seated for your series of four minute "mini-dates." On your dating card that you receive at check-in, you'll select who you wish to see again. You can choose Dating or Friendship as your preferred connection.

We will collect everyone's dating cards at the end of the event and email you your mutual matches within 48 hours.

While this event is geared towards helping people meet potential romantic matches, you can also mingle with all the guests and find new friends as well.

On average, 80% of those who attend end up with at least one or two mutual matches.

* We run 3-5 Meetup Groups, plus maintain our own outside Dating Advice & Events Website. We advertise on Facebook, Twitter, Blogs, etc. Most registrations come through our outside events website, not Meetup. Therefore the number of RSVPs reflected here are NOT the total number of men or women registered.

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

PAYMENT POLICY:
$24  - PAY IN ADVANCE ONLY - WE DO NOT ACCEPT PAYMENT AT DOOR

*You must register with a valid, correct email address.

REGISTER AND PAY HERE: https://2016atwysnycspeeddating.eventbrite.com

(SEE MORE FAQ's BELOW)

ABSOLUTELY NO REFUNDS FOR LAST MINUTE/DAY OF CANCELLATIONS

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~


FAST FACTS - PLEASE READ:

*We can not accept payment at the door for these events. All registrations must be done online via the Eventbrite link below before the event. No exceptions.

*RSVPing through meetup does not guarantee admission. You must pre-pay to secure your spot in the event.

*Business casual attire requested. No sneakers, t-shirts or active wear, no ripped jeans.

*We limit our events to 12 couples/24 people. (See reason below)

*Matches are tabulated and emailed to attendees 48 hours after the event.

*Event lasts about 90 minutes give or take 10 minutes between check-in and all speeddating rounds.

*You must register with a valid, correct email address.

*There are no refunds for cancellations, late arrivals or no-shows.


OUR METHOD:

The upside of online dating is that it provides us with so many options. The downside is that people start to believe that their options are endless, which leads them to move on quickly seeking that "perfect" match.

This is where speeddating comes in. To try and combat the "shopping cart" mentality of online dating, we limit the number of attendees to 10-12 per gender.  Fewer choices to distract us means that people are more likely to make a connection. Face to face conversations result in fewer flakes. That means fewer people get put on the back burner.


FAQ'S

The Organizer RSVPD with X amount of people. What does that mean?

That number represents the RSVPS (not registrations) that have come in through our other pages listed below. It is NOT the total number of people pre-paid. The typical number of people per event is 16-20.

What should I wear?

Business casual attire is perfect. No sneakers or athletic wear, please.

What if I want to give someone my contact info at the event?

Go for it! That's the whole point. Do whatever you are comfortable doing.

Can I see photos of other attendees?

Most people do not RSVP on meetup for privacy reasons. They only pre-pay and therefore do not share their photo.

Where are all the RSVPs?

About 50% of the registrations come through Eventbrite and our main events website. They are not Meetup members. Many people prefer not to post their Meetup profile or photo for privacy reasons. We often remove the event from the calendar once it has started so that people can't contact attendees without the attendee's expressed permission.

What's The Refund Policy?

Since we need to try and ensure a gender ratio as close to even as possible, our policy is that all registrations are final. We can not offer refunds or transfers to last minute cancellations. However, if you notify us at least 3 days in advance, we can give you a credit to another event.

Can I bring a friend for moral support?

You'd be surprised how many people arrive alone. We actually prefer that guests do not bring friends or "spectators." It makes the other attendees uncomfortable. Fun fact: The people who sign up and arrive alone tend to get more matches than those who attend with friends.

Will there be equal numbers of men or women?

That's the goal. We constantly monitor registrations and amp up promotion to try and ensure and equal gender ration. Sometimes there's  more men or women. Sometimes it's even numbers. This is heavily dependent on the age range and weather. 

*This is not a guaranteed number of dates.

See other RSVPS posted on our other groups. Please note that many people opt NOT to RSVP through Meetup for privacy reasons.

results.description:
Photo Credit: Jazzville, NJ member, Maurice Jefferson

Robin's Nest in Linden is truly one of the friendliest venues we've ever been to. Walk in once and you're part of the family.

Plus, it doesn't hurt that the open jam session lets everyone join in the fun. Musicians and vocalists are invited to get on stage and join the band for a few songs.

Over the years, we've had members grace us with their talents and it's always fun to see someone you know join the band for a few numbers.

There is no cover and the food is excellent, so bring an appetite!

Your GPS is not misleading you

Robin's Nest is in a very residential area. Most first-timers think their GPS is taking them the wrong way. Just continue to follow it. Once you get to the club, it's very visible amongst all the houses.

A Note About Parking

It's a small lot and double parking is common. If you are on a time schedule, it's best to park on the street so you don't get blocked in.

The area around the club is very safe and there is plenty of space on the surrounding streets.

How To Find Us

Robin's Nest is a cozy little place, so you shouldn't have any trouble locating us, but if this is your first time joining the group, you might not recognize us right away.

Here are three easy ways to find us:

• look for the Jazzville, NJ Meetup sign: http://bit.ly/zBZxVL

• look for me: http://bit.ly/zP11QP

• ask at the bar for the "Jazzville, NJ Meetup" group

Don't be shy! Come introduce yourself and partake in the music and merryment!

peace and jazz,

D.A.
results.why: Robin's Nest is the place to be on Sunday evenings! If you're a singer or musician, you can join the band on stage. If you're not, just get ready to be blown away by the talent!
results.how_to_find_us: Ask at the door or the bar for the Jazzville Meetup group or look for the Meetup sign.
results.name: Second Sundays: Cool Jazz Open Jam @ Robin's Nest, Linden

Join us, to explore our Intuition and have FUN at the same time! All levels are welcome, beginners too! Come meet new people and discover exciting Intuitive abilities you never knew you had!

The Intuition Circle is held the 2nd Sunday of Each Month!

At each monthly Intuition Circle we will explore different aspects of Intuitive development, aspects like:

• Precognition - The Intuitive Sense of Knowing.


• Clairvoyance - Seeing Visions With the Minds Eye.


• Telepathy - Hearing the Inner Voice of Spirit.


• Empathy - The Ability to Read The Energy of Others.


• Psychometry -Picking Up Impressions From Objects.


• Spirit Guides - Connecting to Our Spiritual Guardians.


• Past Lives - Discovering Who We Were, Before This Life.


• Auras & Chakras - Discover The Abilities of Your Energy Body.


• Lucid Dreaming - Learn To Control Your Dreams.


• Using Oracles - Learn Simple effective Methods of Divination.


• And Much More!

What Abilities Will You Discover? - Find Out!

Don't Miss, The Next Intuition Circle! 

Sage Logan: was raised within a family tradition of African American folk magic known as Rootwork. He is also a Shamanic Practitioner, and has learned sacred ceremonies and healing techniques first hand, from indigenous healers, from the Lakota & Cherokee traditions, healers from Peru & Ecuador, the Maori of New Zealand, South African Sangoma's & many more.

results.description:
CROATIA: 8 Day Group Tour - May 8-15, 2016

We'll be joining GEC travel club members from all over the US and Canada on this exciting 8 day group tour of Croatia!

Travel May 8 - 15, 2016 and visit the up and coming country of Croatia with this exciting 8 day GECtravel small group tour. Discover the stunning Dalmatian Coast and historic cities of Split and Dubrovnik... we've even added some Game of Thrones sightseeing along the way! Included in the tour, we'll also travel through the Croatian countryside and into Bosnia-Herzegovina to visit the charming town of Mostar and visit the beautiful Kravice waterfalls where you can take a swim. In addition to visiting these historic cities, we also have optional day tours to visit the spectacularly beautiful Blue Cave and Island of Hvar off the coast of Split & a full day tour from Dubrovnik to the wonderful country of Montenegro.

-----------------------------------------------------------------

Pricing and Booking:

PRICE: $2,399 plus air

CLICK HERE for details & to book your space on this tour.


(NOTE: a meetup RSVP does NOT reserve your space.)

----------------------------------------------------------------- 

GROUP TRIPS:  are typically 10-15 +/- people and they tend to sell out 1 - 3 months before departure, so be sure to book your space soon.  These small group trips are open for anyone to join. You can sign up as a solo traveler (roommate matching is free) OR join with friends, a spouse, or other family members. All are welcome!  

GET THE SCOOP! Want to see what GEC travel club members are saying? Then check out the Global Expeditions Club's Testimonial Page

-----------------------------------------------------------------

Included in the awesome adventure:

* Expert English speaking local experts for select tours
* Global Expeditions Club Leader
* Small group tour of Croatia
* Tour of Split (with Game of Thrones Highlights)
* Full day excursion to Mostar & Kravice Falls in Bosnia
* Walking Tour of Dubrovnik (with Game of Thrones Highlights)
* Cable car up to the hills above Dubrovnik
* High-Speed Ferry Split to Dubrovnik
* Breakfast daily
* 7 nights lodging in excellent mid-range hotels
* Optional: Full Day Boat Excursion to Blue Cave & Hvar Island
* Optional: Full Day Tour to Montenegro

Need help booking your airfare?  Just email me or give me a call at[masked]

Click Here For Complete Details and to Book Your Space on the Trip.

>Places Visited: Group Tour of Croatia, Dubrovnik, Spilt, tour of Mostar & Kravice Falls in Bosnia, Optional Blue Cave and Hvar, Optional group tour to Montenegro

----------------------------------------------------------------

The Global Expeditions Club is a group of fun-loving travelers looking for other like-minded people to travel the world with.  The travel club started 8 years ago with just a handful of meetup members, but has grown into one of the largest travel clubs in the world.

Check out the Global Expeditions Club's Testimonial Page to see what others are saying about these trips.

Of course, if you have any questions you can always contact me or one of the other organizers through meetup message or via phone at (617)[masked]


Make Friends. Travel the World.
results.name: CROATIA: 8 Day Group Tour

The Vegans are coming!

The vegans are taking over everything! They're replacing hamburgers with Veggie Burgers.. Fries with Kale, Ice Cream with VEGAN Ice CREAM!! 
They even took your favorite bar and turned it into a vegan restaurant.. NOOO!!!

But like the old adage goes, when you can't beat them... DO A COMEDY SHOW in their RESTAURANT, and we've chosen the best vegan restaurant in town to do it, The VSPOT on ST MARKS!!

Come end the weekend with some laughs!!

Come and receive - spiritual nourishment and an opportunity to relax and rejuvenate - in the physical and every other sense. We've had some amazing gatherings Sunday after Sunday - sunshine for the soul through each and every one's Light - their presence and spiritual participation. This is what make Neolyth such a well of positive atmosphere - community gatherings of kindred spirits. We are 'spiritual beings having a human experience' and every one has unique gifts to offer from and through their Soul.

These gatherings will now provide a space to lie down in Savasana or relaxation pose while listening to live sound of alchemical crystal bowls, guided imagery, and spiritually oriented ancient verse and poetry. The door will remain open for you to come in quietly and find a comfortable mat and seat. Small donations appreciated!
results.name: Sunday Night Meditation with Crystal Bowls

results.description:
Each week following the 5:30 mass at Holy Trinity dozens of people get together following the 5:30 mass at Holy Trinity for socializing, eating, beverages and connecting.  It is a fun and casual way to meet others in the group in a fun and relaxed setting.

You can meet the group on the steps to the church following mass and walk over together or you can meet the group at the bar.  It is easy to find us.

Grab a seat at the bar or you can sit at a table to eat and drink.

Pay as you go for food and drink. A full menu is available

Can I come alone? Yes, many of those attending come on their own.

Do I need to be a member of Holy Trinity to attend? No, people come from all over the tri state area to our events.

Do I need to go to the 5:30 mass to go to the gathering?  No, you can attend your home parish and join us for the party. 

How long does it last?

Usually around 9ish
results.name: After Mass Gathering at Joe's Burgers

results.description: We meet every Sunday night from 7:30-8:45 pm at South Mountain Yoga. We do a 20 minute guided meditation (usually one of Thich Nhat Hanh's), walking meditation, and a 20 minute silent sitting. Jean also picks a reading. At the end, there is time for sharing (optional) as a way to practicing listening and speaking about issues of mindfulness in our week, sittings, and daily lives. No experience is necessary.  There is a suggested donation of $10. Please try to arrive on time and refrain from wearing fragrances.  Cushions and folding chairs are available or you can bring your own. Please note: many sangha members attend the group without responding here on meetup.
results.how_to_find_us: Next to the Chase Bank; next to the sound garden. One flight walk up to 2nd Floor. Parking on street or in parking lot behing the buiding. No meters on Sunday.

Week #2 New Swing Dance Session With Spencer @ The JCC in Manhattan

334 Amsterdam Avenue, New York, NY @76th street

 with  Spencer Weisbond

Six week, progressive session : Sun, May 01 - Sun, Jun 19, 2016
  Except 5-29 and 6-12
7:30PM - 8:30PM & 8:30PM - 9:30PM
# of Sessions: 6
    102: Advanced Beginner -  7:30 -8:30pm Advance in Jitterbug and East Coast Swing by learning more involved patterns with harder footwork. Build your dance vocabulary and partnering skills. This class is the prerequisite for Lindy Hop (level 3), which is the grandfather of all swing dances and has 8-count patterns. No partner needed


  103: Lindy Hop﻿ Pre-Intermediate 8:30- 9:30pm
Bring all your moves together into complete sequences. Learn new eight-count patterns to make your dance more intricate and expressive.  

  Teacher: Spencer Weisbond please call me with questions about your level[masked]
Level one is now on Wednesday nights!
  Register and pricing below:

  jccmanhattan.org/dance </a> <a href="http://ebiz.jccmanhattan.org/personifyebusiness/Programs/ProgramDetail.aspx?pid=643452358">

Spencer has been dancing swing since 1998. He has studied Lindy hop extensively with 4 time world champion and 8 time American champion, Nathalie Gomes. Spencer had led the outreach program for Hop Swing And & Jump dance studios at local venues around NYC.
Spencer has had his own program in swing at the JCC in Manhattan for over 8 years, and also teaches privately. He has taught for Lincoln Center’s “Midsummer Night Swing” He currently organizes the New York City Swing Dance Meetup Group, which has over 3400 members, making it one of the most active swing dance clubs in the world. Spencer also co-founded the popular NYC dance  event “Swing Remix”. www.SwingRemix.com </a> <a href="http://ebiz.jccmanhattan.org/personifyebusiness/Programs/ProgramDetail.aspx?pid=135393">

Sunday the 8th is also Mother's Day so I pushed the start time back to 7:30 so I and everyone else can have a little extra time with Mommy.  :)

Outside drinks & food are NOT allowed and may get you kicked out. (I've seen it happen)

I'll be here at 7:30ish to make sure we get a booth or seats by the back. Tables/booths are first come, first serve, so folks who get here early will have a seat.

See you there!!!!!

results.description:
I want to thank everyone who came out for this, What a great show and an amazing meetup. we had so many people we couldnt accomodate all but its was a great show and i hope everyone met each other. Were gonna continue doing this as long as the club lets us. I met some of the most fun and amazing people, the comics were a full top Comedy Central line up too. For those of you who havent been to this, This is a special Meetup, we finally got a deal with Stand Up New York the hottest club in New York City to let us in free of charge and see comics like Amy Shumer, Godfrey, Kevin Brennan and top names, this is NOT an amateur show like alot of the meetups. I just ask that everyone who Rsvp's really do their best to show up AND MAKE IT ON TIME. as you know I dont charge for this meetup so come out see the hottest comedy show and maybe even make some new friends. this sundays line up includes the below.

This Mothers day we got: Ari Shaffir, Louis Katz, Joe Zimmerman, Sarah Tollemache and Sam Morril and pretty much any comic you see on Comedy Central these days drops by and shows up on the lineup who knows who might drop by usually its Amy Shumer or Judah Friedlander.

I will be at the front end of the bar by the iphone charger as usual to meet with everyone and give you tickets for free admission and have everyone sit together so we can all share laughs. Try to be early the show starts at 8 and everyone sits at same table but i do this earlier so all of you can meet your fellow meetup members. This is a 2 show ticket, so if you show up for the 8 you can stay for the ten also which has a different but also comedy central lineup. Or if you would like to come for the 10 you can just say meetup at the door and they will point you to me.

THERE IS PLENTY OF ROOM SO COME ON DOWN!!!

Even though the RSVP's are closed, just RSVP by messaging Silver Moon or Corwin!! If you have to change your RSVP or add to your RSVP just message. No problem with space in this room tonight!!

-----------------------


PLEASE RSVP HERE FOR BOTH ROOMS of the event unless you are already RSVP'd to the Main room!! RSVPs to the Main room's wait list will be forwarded here.

Episode 3 "Oathbreaker"


See the main event listing for the details.

Due to the high number of RSVPs it has been decreed that action be taken. So that none shall be Throneless for this event we have set up an extra room and an extra screen. This is the second room for the event to handle the excess people from the main room. Members are being taken off the main waiting list and placed here. If anyone doesn't show up for the main event, their slot will be taken by people in this second room using the following protocol:

The main room gatekeepers (South of the Wall) will let through anyone marked "Northerner" or "Wildling" to fill any extra space in the main room. No one marked "Wight" will be let through South of the Wall. Anyone without a status is a "Wight" until further notice.

Note:


You become a wight when you RSVP and don't show, or cancel an RSVP on short notice, with no previous record of attendance. We introduce you to Melisandra or Thoros if you actually show up for your RSVP.


If you attend make certain that you are marked present. It effects your priority on RSVP and wait lists. The North remembers!

Do not RSVP here if you are already RSVP'd to the main room!!!

results.description:
PLEASE RSVP TO THE SECOND SCREEN!! (WAITLIST NOW BEING SENT TO SECOND SCREEN) In order to prevent spammers from taking  the slots of real users we have to fill the slots from the wait list until further notice.

Episode 3 "Oathbreaker"

All are welcome. If you are a fan of the HBO Game of Thrones and want to join a group of fellow fans, come on in. If you are a full fledged Maester who has read all of the books (and even the extras like Dunk & Egg) come join us and watch the marvelous series with a group of fellow Maesters. Discussion about anything we just watched is encouraged here (and since the show has passed the books, talk about the books is also encouraged). This group does not consider mentioning Ned Stark's beheading during Season 6 a spoiler.*

There is a delicious and very affordable menu of food and drinks for you to enjoy when you get here.

8PM

Discuss, debate, and compare notes while watching last week's show.

9PM

Watch new episode (without debate or talking so we don't miss anything).

10PM

Socialize and discuss the show.


Come early to get the best seats.


*It is highly recommended that people who consider a wide range of topics to be spoilers watch the show alone at home with the doors locked and the internet disconnected. Make sure to also avoid all news outlets.
